description: Why are we looking for you?We are KUGU. We make buildings energy efficient and sustainable!As a SaaS solution, we make energy consumption transparent and visualise it on our energy data platform. This way we reduce CO2 emissions and increase resource efficiency for our customers!We are still at the beginning of our journey to become the leading energy data platform in Europe!That's why we're looking for a dedicatedQA-Engineer(m/f/d)in Berlin.Join us and contribute to climate change!Your missionYou ensure the quality of our platform with the help of automated and manual testsYou estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate all test activities?with a high degree of autonomyYou cooperate with our product managers to adjust the product development process that the quality of our product is constantly increasingYou are in close contact with the product, design and operations team, give feedback and create understanding for a high-quality standard throughout the companyYou promote and support the shift left approach throughout the SDLCYour profile3+ years of experience in JavaScript2+ years experience working with tools like Cypress or Selenium2+ years of experience with API testing using Postman/SoapUIYou understand software architecture and can work with databases, ReST APIs, messaging engines, logs, etc.You are able to think your way into complex issues in a fast-changing Start-up environmentYou love to support your team actively and help solving with their problemsYou are fluent in spoken and written English (C1)You don't meet all the points with your profile and are unsure whether you should apply?Don't worry, motivation, experience and the will to learn count more for us than the formal CV. Give us the chance to get to know you!Why KUGU?As a team, we want to make a difference to an entire industry through our innovation. We live sustainability, have lots of fun together and much more:The basics:Exciting insights into a dynamic and growing green start-upImplementation of your ideas through flat hierarchies and short decision-making pathsPromising career opportunities & flexible working modelsCold drinks in the fridge and a wide range of delicious snacksThings our team loves:Enjoy the end of the day with the team, drinks & table football in our community spaceBook a talk, mindful session or masterclass with the OpenUp psychologistsThe option for cool benefits Â¨C such as the use of our pool car, subsidies for lunch, travel tickets and pension schemesExciting team events with insights into the culture, history and gastronomy of BerlinStart the day with language coursesAn industrial style office in Prenzlauer Berg with very good transport connectionsFind out whether your heating and utility bills are correct Â¨C our team will be happy to help!Questions?Our People Operations & Recruiting Manager Tom will be happy to help you! Simply contact him via Mail or LinkedIn.About usWe are a diverse team of international techies, designers and business wannabes. We share a passion for new technologies that do good and simplify the lives of users.Want to learn more about KUGU?Visit our website for more information about our products, customers and partnersOn our LinkedIn page you will find news about KUGU, our team and our projectsYou have not found the right position? Take the initiative - we look forward to receiving your application at jobs@kugu-home.com

As the experts in digestive and metabolic medicine and as a family-owned business with a global presence, we focus on developing and marketing innovative medicines to treat a wide range of gastrointestinal disorders like inflammatory bowel disease or eosinophilic esophagitis as well as hepatobiliary disorders such as primary biliary cholangitis. Our aim: to meaningfully improve therapeutic practice as well as patient health and well-being. We firmly believe that medical progress can only be achieved by working together. That is why we are looking for:Your tasksWe look for someone who is a healthcare enthusiast and who is capable of assimilating and interpreting scientific content or a wealth of clinical efficacy and safety data with adeptness in ability to translate into a logical, scientifically balanced compelling medical story for appropriate audience.Create  scientific presentations, lectures, training courses, speaker decks, FAQ documents etc. with targeted content for the respective stakeholdersCollaborate with Regulatory Affairs and/or R&D on creation and review of regulatory (EMA and FDA) and clinical content and documentation, related to new drugs, clinical trials, as well as medical treatments (f.ex. parts of clinical dossier module 2.5, scientific advice requests, investigator brochuresÂ¡Â¯ clinical parts) - with focus on epidemiology, therapeutic area or indication background, national and international guidelines and patient journey/medical need, based on study reports, medical-scientific publications and other literature and key external expertsÂ¡Â¯ insightsAnswer and process (in close cooperation with the global safety department) internal and external medical inquiries from health care providers, patients, affiliatesÂ¡Â¯ colleagues and/or distribution partnersConduct extensive research on medical-related topics to ensure competent, factual, accurate and compliant communication and information on pharmaceutical-medical issues internally and externallyInput and participate in scientific events and international stand-alone symposia of the companySupport  the Scientific Innovation & Partnering department through medical evaluation and due diligence support of potential pipeline candidates, contact with opinion leadersFor your daily work you will collaborate closely  cross-functionally with R&D, Regulatory Affairs, Marketing, Market Access, etc.Your dutiesDegree in natural sciences, preferably medicine, pharmacy or biology/biochemistry, doctorate desirablePharma industry experience in medical science (medical advisor,Â¡Â­) at an international (European) levelExperience in gastroenterology and hepatology is a strong advantageIndependent and structured way of working, strong communication skills, empathetic and transparent personality. Clarity and accuracy is natural for youVery good written and spoken English and German, other foreign languages such as Italian and/or French an advantageProficient in MS Office and Teams/Sharepoint and literature databases, Prism Graph Pad or Adobe Illustrator knowledge very welcomeYour benefitsSupportive, respectful and appreciative work atmosphere in a small, dedicated teamDiverse learning culture and individual development opportunitiesInternational and growing family business with short decision-making processes, financial independence and long-term perspectiveNew work, flexible working hours and mobile workingWide range of benefits (free beverages, health and sports benefits, canteen, JobRad)Comprehensive onboarding and mentoring programIf you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at personal@drfalkpharma.de or call + 49 761 1514-102. We look forward to receiving your
application via our online portal.HR department


Dr. Falk Pharma GmbH

Your way into the futureJoin us asTest Operator (m/f/x)and work with us on changing the future!What awaits you at MynaricAs part of our Environmental Test Team, you operate our test beds (shaker, thermal chambers, and optical test beds) to test high-tech, bleeding-edge laser communication terminals rolling off our assembly line.You support the maintenance and calibration of various test equipment and handle the associated documentation.In close cooperation with our Test Engineers, you prepare, execute, and document tests in the areas of structural mechanics, thermal, optics and electronics.You assist in the preparation and improvement of testing procedures and setups.You bring your creativity and experience to an innovative high-tech company.You provide feedback to our engineers, production, and project teams regarding the practical aspects of test design and execution.What you bring with youSuccessfully completed vocational training in a technical field or relevant experience working with multi-disciplinary systems. Work experience in the field of testing is a plus.You have a passion to work at the cutting edge of technology.Ideally, you are proficient in test planning, execution, and documentation.You are a team player, eager to learn and share knowledge.You have a hands-on mindset for practical solutions and a distinct can-do-attitude.The ability to communicate in German or English is necessary.You are creative, proactive, and can independently find optimum solutions to complex technological problems.The willingness to learn and expand your skillset continually.What we offer youBe part of the company that is changing the world!Have you always wanted to wear your favourite space outfit to work? Then you are exactly theright fit for us! Forget the office politics and come and work with inspiring colleagues from allover the world as you embark on an incredible journey with Mynaric to work on unique andchallenging projects and make a real contribution to the future of connectivity.We offer you permanent employment, varied areas of responsibility, and attractive employeebenefits. Mynaric is absolutely committed to being an equal opportunity employer so wewelcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, gender,disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.About usMynaric produces optical fiber for the skies and, as a pioneer in laser communications, enables extremely fast and secure wireless data transmission between satellites, drones and the ground. The products are used by well-known international technology companies to build global communication networks. The emerging Internet over the clouds will connect the previously disconnected 3 billion people, bring the Internet of Things to the remotest corners of the earth and make international communication more secure than ever.

THE ROLEAre you ready to make a real impact? Are you excited by the opportunity to use your exceptional sales skills to unlock climate action for enterprise organizations?Then join CEEZER and help companies across the globe to leverage a truly impactful solution that is finally fixing the voluntary carbon market through data-led insights. Use your skills to tackle one of the most critical challenges humanity has ever faced: climate change.Businesses must decarbonize their operations to achieve real climate progress. Some emissions are unavoidable, and thatÂ¡Â¯s where CEEZER comes in.CEEZER is a platform for CO2 compensation and high-tech removal credits with access to >9,000 climate projects worldwide, verified by globally recognized registries. Transactions take place between corporations and project developers at the source, without any middlemen or hidden fees. CEEZER achieves this by providing scientific quality and pricing insights that help buyers and sellers interact, while allowing them to monitor credits in a balanced, high-quality portfolio.We are looking for a highly motivated Enterprise Account Executive (f/d/m). closuresDelivering a value-based selling experience to customersEngaging with prospective customers to understand their sustainability strategy and carbon credit needsEnsuring customers achieve their high-quality carbon portfolios to support client goalsPartnering with Marketing to leverage campaigns that drive engagement and leadsAttending conferences and travel as needed to meet with prospective and current clients, participate in networking opportunities to build brand awareness, and generate leadsWHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEEDExtensive Enterprise Sales experience with complex multi-stakeholder sales cyclesFluency in English, and additional languages are a plusProven track record of exceeding sales targets and acquiring enterprise clientsStrong understanding of enterprise sales processes and methodologies, including account planning and pipeline managementExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environmentExcellent presentation skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas and solutions in a compelling manner to C-level executives and lawyersExperience in a startup or similar fast-paced environmentSelf-motivated, results-oriented, and capable of working independentlyExperience in sustainability, or the Voluntary Carbon Market is a plusWHY CEEZERMake a positive impact on the world and work on a mission that mattersA rapidly growing international team of talented and highly committed people who are significantly contributing to the net zero transitionStrong learning and development culture in a VC-backed, early-stage startupCompetitive salaryFree Urban Sports Club membershipOffsites, team dinners and other after-work team activitiesCEEZER is a carbon positive company that will neutralize your footprint from day 1A truly inclusive environment - diversity is in our DNA and we flourish as a team of different races, genders, sexual orientations, and identitiesAbout usBusinesses must decarbonize their operations to achieve real climate progress. Transactions take place between corporations and project developers at the source, without any middlemen or hidden fees. CEEZER achieves this by providing scientific quality and pricing insights that help buyers and sellers interact while allowing them to monitor credits in a balanced, high-quality portfolio.

Position Overview:This is a vacancy for a hybrid/on-site role at our HQ in Tutzing. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of gender identity.As we expand, we are seeking a skilledCloud SysOps Administrator (m/f/x)to join our Cloud Services team, where your work will bridge customer environments with the Lobster Data Platform Cloud infrastructure, establishing secure and efficient connections.In this role, you will manage customer systems and software as they transition into a cloud environment, working with platforms such as AWS or, for some customers, continuing to support on-premises setups. Ready to make an impact?YouÂ¡Â¯ll get to take ownership of:Transferring and maintaining infrastructure support for Lobster customers, managing both cloud (AWS) and on-premises (local data centre) environments.Work with AWS, utilizing tools like AWS CloudFormation to deploy and configure customer applications and services.Connect customer systems securely to the Lobster Cloud infrastructure, setting up VPNs such as IPSEC for seamless integration.Provide technical assistance and troubleshooting support to customers, ensuring a smooth operational experience.Monitor, maintain, and optimize network, server, and firewall infrastructure to ensure high availability and security.Collaborate with the team to continuously improve infrastructure reliability, scalability, and security standards.WeÂ¡Â¯d love to meet someone with:Professional background in the field of computer science, with experience working in SysOps, Cloud Administration or a related fieldStrong knowledge of cloud platforms, particularly AWS, ideally with hands-on experience using AWS CloudFormationIn-depth understanding of operating systems such as Linux, and strong general IT infrastructure skillsProficiency in network setup, server management, and firewall configuration, with expertise in VPNs and IPSECPython coding skills,with the ability to write scripts for automation and systems management.You communicate fluently inGerman(within the team and with the customers), and having a conversational level of English is welcomed.Nice to Have:Experience with Terraform.You can look forward to:State-of-the-art, spacious offices with a view of Lake Starnberg in TutzingSubsidised lunches in our in-house restaurantA cycling package through our partnership with JobRad, plus additional cash incentives if you commute regularly by bikeOpportunity to work flexibly from homeTeam get-togethers every Thursday with refreshmentsA Company Pension Plan (bAV)30 vacation days a yearReady to explore this opportunity? Apply now!Lobster is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where empathy and respect guide our interactions.About usLobster is a pioneering no-code software company that enables organisations to unlock the full potential of their data. Its comprehensive Data Platform allows companies to integrate, manage, and automate data efficiently, while its Data Network facilitates secure and seamless data exchange between partners and systems. From connectivity to consumable Data Products, LobsterÂ¡Â¯s solutions empower businesses across industries to stay agile and competitive. With a presence in DACH, the UK, France, Scandinavia, and the Benelux region, Lobster serves over 2,000 customers globally.

It is a joint venture of BASF, BMW Group, Henkel, Mercedes-Benz, SAP, Schaeffler, Siemens, T-Systems, Volkswagen and ZF. The vision of Cofinity-X is to run an open marketplace for the provision of own and third-party business applications and further services that enable secured and standardized data transfer along the automotive value chain in accordance with the Gaia-X and Catena-X principles with initial focus on the European market.

Non-Profit Organization.Commitment to FSCÂ¡Â¯s mission and values.Why us?Why Join FSC in Bonn, Germany?Be part of a globally recognized organization at the forefront of sustainable forestry and Role OverviewThe HR Business Partner will support operational HR processes and is responsible for advising and assisting employees throughout the entire employee lifecycle. This role focuses on supporting HR operations, particularly in recruiting, onboarding, and payroll preparation, in close collaboration with the HR.Your TasksRecruiting: Supporting and conducting recruitment processes from job posting to contract creation, collaborating closely with team leaders to identify staffing needs.Onboarding & Offboarding: Organizing and overseeing the onboarding process, including preparing and managing employment contracts, and ensuring a structured offboarding experience.Payroll Preparation: Assisting in payroll preparation by accurately verifying and updating employee data.Employee Support and Advising: Serving as a contact point for employees on HR-related topics, including employment laws, benefits, and company policies.Document Management: Maintaining and managing employee records to ensure organizational and legal compliance.Employee Engagement and Development: Contributing to employee satisfaction and retention measures and supporting projects focused on HR process improvement.Your ProfileEducation: BachelorÂ¡Â¯s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (equivalent HR qualifications or certifications are also acceptable).Experience:4+ years of experience in HR, ideally within the IT industry.Hands-on experience in recruiting, employee relations, and payroll preparation.Knowledge of employment laws in Germany.Skills:Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.Excellent communication skills and ability to interact professionally with various stakeholders.Proficiency in HRIS systems (ideally Personio) and standard software tools (e.g., MS Office).Fluency in written and spoken German and English is required.That sounds like you?Then don't wait any longer and send us your resume. We are looking forward to the exchange with you!Stefan Berndtis your contact person.Reasons to become part of AMDTTransformative Opportunities: Be part of a transformative company undergoing dynamic changes, offering numerous opportunities for growth and development.Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse and supportive community where your contributions are valued, and collaboration thrives.Flexible Work Options: Work how you work bestÂ¡Âªremotely, hybrid, or from our state-of-the-art office.Future Security: We invest in your future with a comprehensive pension plan, contributing 20% towards your direct insurance (deferred compensation).Celebrating Milestones: Enjoy special bonuses and gifts for significant life events like marriage, the birth of a child, or your 10-year anniversary with us.Wellness Programs: Prioritize your well-being with monthly relaxation sessions in Landau to help you unwind and recharge.Sustainable Commutes: Promote a healthy lifestyle with JobRad, our bike leasing program, for an eco-friendly commute.Continuous Learning: Access Preply for easy language learning, supporting your personal and professional growth.About usAMDT is the global market and technology leader for versioning and backup solutions in industrial automation. With its octoplant software platform, the company secures the automation of production processes through strong end-point management, where it consistently records and monitors changes to configurations, programming and project statuses in production. This minimizes downtime, increases efficiency, quality and safety standards, and saves costs as well as resources. As a modular solution, octoplant can be linked to different automation technologies and devices, regardless of the manufacturer.AMDT was formed in 2022 from the merger of the two established market leaders AUVESY GmbH and MDT Software Inc. The company is headquartered in Landau, Pfalz, Germany, with additional locations in the USA and China. The company works with more than 100 partners on all continents and serves over 3,000 customers worldwideMore information at: amdt.comWe are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. AMDT maintains a drug-free workplace.

A JOB OPPORTUNITY ATGOPA Worldwide ConsultantsA JOB THAT INSPIRES YOUAre you a proactive individual who thrives in dynamic, international environments and enjoys taking responsibility? Do you excel in communication and have an eye for detail? Are you reliable and capable of meeting deadlines even under pressure? If you have a can-do attitude and are seeking a role where you can be the central point of communication for a bustling team, then you are the right fit for us!Your tasks:Act as the central communication hub for the department, ensuring seamless information flow.Think on your feet to quickly address and resolve emerging issues.Intervene effectively and diplomatically to keep processes moving forward.Format documents with precision, ensuring consistency and style.Utilize your strong command of the Microsoft Office package to create polished and professional documents.Pay close attention to details to maintain high standards of accuracy and quality.Manage daily mail and correspondence.Update data on Sharepoint and checklists.Arrange travel logistics and itineraries.Organize and manage events, meetings, and department schedules.Provide general support to the department as needed.A BACKGROUND THAT CONVINCES USYour ProfileYou have an academic degree or successfully completed vocational education.Your prior work experience has equipped you with relevant skills for this role and confirmed your affinity for these tasks.You have excellent oral and written communication skills in English and at least basic knowledge of German. Additional French and/or Spanish language skills would be appreciated.Full command of Microsoft 365 and your attention to detail shines through.You enjoy playing around with different graphic tools and style applications.You have a strong passion for diversity and are open to a variety of team structures and cultural backgrounds.AN ENVIRONMENT THAT MOTIVATES YOUWhat we offer:Team & culture: You will join dynamic, multi-cultural and multilingual team mem-bers who enjoy working together and who support each other.Responsibility: You join a company com-mitted to being environmentally responsible wherever we operate.Development: Our annual career develop-ment and performance review process will help you to set clearly defined goals and objectives. As a new employee, you will be part of a mentorship system.Location: GOPA is located close to Bad HomburgÂ¡Ã¤s railway station, enabling quick and easy access to FrankfurtÂ¡Â¯s cultural activities and events.Fringe benefits: GOPA offers an RMV job ticket and job-bike leasing, as well as sub-sidies for a fitness studio and day care for your children, to mention a few.Flexibility: We enable flexible work arrangements, including flexible working hours, mobile or telework.Inclusivity and Work EnvironmentDEI Commitment: We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.Work Flexibility: Though we are an international and flexible team, this role requires someone to be primarily based at our headquarters due to the specific needs of the position.READY FOR CHANGE?We are looking forward to receiving your online application, including your possible commencement date and salary expectation.About usAs a leader in development consultancy, GOPA Worldwide Consultants implements projects in developing and transition economies on behalf of national and international development partners, national authorities, industry representatives and civil society organisations. To ensure that the programmes we implement have a lasting impact in terms of economic growth, sustainability and poverty reduction, we target structural reforms and capacity building in six core sectors.These six sectors represent our commitment to improve the social and economic situation of people through Education and Employment Promotion, Governance and Economic Development, Rural Development and Environment, Health and Social Development; and measuring the long-term impact of interventions through Statistics and Monitoring and Evaluation.We are member of GOPA Consulting Group, which consists of 6 large consulting companies, with additional complementary branch organisations, whose expertise and location respond to specific market demands.In 2021, we became a certified carbon-neutral company for 2020. We are further committed to avoiding and reducing our carbon footprint, as well as identifying new measures together with our staff members.

job_title: Doctoral Student/Ph.D. Candidate (m/f/d) - Functional epigenomics in leukemia
description: Doctoral Student/Ph.D. Candidate (m/f/d) - Functional epigenomics in leukemiaFull-timeT?tigkeitsfeld: Wissenschaft und ForschungBesch?ftigungsumfang: VollzeitCompany DescriptionOur research lab is situated in the Robert Bosch Center for Tumor Diseases (RBCT). RBCT is a newly established translational cancer research institute located at the Robert Bosch Health Campus in Stuttgart, Germany, in direct proximity to the Robert Bosch Hospital (RBK). As an integral part of the National Center for Tumor Diseases (NCT) South West and the Comprehensive Cancer Center TÂ¨Â¹bingen-Stuttgart, RBCT is exclusively dedicated to innovative cancer research and treatment.Our group focuses on unraveling complex gene regulatory networks that govern the pathogenesis of hematological malignancies, including myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) and acute myeloid leukemia (AML). We employ cutting-edge techniques such as NGS-coupled multiomics, high-throughput screening, and gene interference or editing on tumor cell lines, primary patient samples, and mouse tumor models. Our primary research goal is to identify novel molecular biomarkers and therapeutic targets/approaches in human MDS or AML.Job DescriptionLead or participate in research projects involving epigenetic mechanisms driving human leukemia using state-of-the-art multidisciplinary molecular techniques including:Standard wet lab techniques, including molecular cloning, DNA/RNA/protein detection, immunoprecipitation, cell culture, cell transfection, flow cytometry, RNA interference, gene editing, retro- or lentiviral transduction, etc.Advanced methods coupled with next generation sequencing (NGS), such as ChIP-seq, CUT&RUN or CUT&TAG, RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, CLIP/eCLIP, HiC/capture HiCNGS data analysis and interpretationEx vivo or in vivo tumor modellingInternal and external collaborations to achieve the fulfillment of research goalsSupervisory duties on junior members (e.g. interns) in the labAttending and presenting research data at local, national and international seminars or meetingsSummarizing work results for scientific publicationsQualificationsAdequate professional qualifications:Master degree in life science, e.g. Biomedicine, Biology, Molecular Biology, Biotechnology or similarResearch training in molecular biology, cell biology, epigenetics or relevant disciplinesDocumented experience through scientific publicationsKnowledge in tumor biology and RNA biology would be a plusFirst-hand experience in gene gain- or loss-of-function and NGS methods would be highly desiredEnthusiasm for engaging in cancer research and awareness of the translational significance of research workCapability of working independently as well as good spirit of team workingOpenness to personal growth and ongoing learning initiativesCompetence in interpersonal communication, presentation, and scientific writingProficient English skills for both oral and written communication for academic information exchangeAdditional InformationRBCT provides excellent research facilities and a supportive environment for young researchers to further their career development. We prioritize the personal needs of candidates in their scientific training and offer a great opportunity to gain proficiency in a wide variety of modern technologies. Exceptional mentorship is a priority at your career development with us.This position is partially supported by a DFG-funded project and institutional core funding, with funds available for supporting the whole duration of PhD work training.If this opportunity interests you, please send your CV, cover letter, and a list of three references via Email to Haiyang Yun, Ph.D ( [email protected] ). description: What you can expectWe are looking for a temporary parental leave replacement as Head of Marketing (m/f/d) until autumn 2025. Your tasks in particular:You will lead the marketing strategy and serve as the go-to person for all marketing-related mattersYou will head the planning, implementation, optimization and evaluation of all marketing activities (B2C & B2B) for all our camping booking platformsYou are responsible for the prioritization of resources and projects to make sure that we are hitting our ambitious targetsYou will lead an international team of motivated people and freelancers/agencies and ensure an efficient workflow and proper communication between and across all channelsYou will also head our customer support teamYou will optimize existing and develop new growth strategies with the aim to accelerate our business in the different marketsYou will foster the network and collaboration with relevant stakeholders at our mother companiesWhat you should bringProven track record in a leading marketing role, preferably within a digital startup or fast-paced environmentMarketing experience running successful marketing campaigns with broad knowledge across the full marketing mix of channelsStrong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a teamGrowth and experimental mindset and experienced with setting growth hacking strategiesStrategic thinking with a creative mindset and a data-driven approach to decision-makingYou are an excellent verbal and written communicator in German and EnglishIdeally, you are a camping fan yourself and are familiar with the subjectWhat we offerA good mix of agile start-up and grown professional structuresFlexible working hours, home office, work abroad, hybrid workingAn appreciative work culture and atmosphere in an international teamBest hardware of your choice, modern toolsModern office in the heart of Berlin with excellent public transport connections and a rooftop terrace for fresh air and sun-bathingRegular feedback as well as internal and external training, e.g. at our PiNCAMP AcademyA steep learning curve with a lot of responsibility from day one, flat hierarchies, quick decisions, room for creative ideas and new impulses30 vacation daysHealth promotion, e.g. through subsidies for Urban Sports Club or ergonomic workstations, free fruit, vegetables and muesliA camper for your short trip or vacationRegular company parties and eventsSnacks and drinksVarious employee discounts, e.g. Travel Industry CardAbout usPiNCAMP is the camping startup of ADAC, ANWB and TCS - in Germany, the Netherlands and Switzerland, as well as throughout Europe. An international team of more than 80 digital experts digitises the camping industry by combining the experience and reputation of our shareholders with the speed of an agile start-up. Our goal is to be Europe's leading camping platform. For our further growth we are looking for passionate hands-on people who want to grow with us and are eager to build an excellent product for campers and campsites alike.

job_title: Senior Technical Product Owner - Custom Solutions (f/m/d) - Berlin based
description: HELLO THERE! PEOPLE AT HUMANOO ARE HAPPY TO GREET YOU!With a team of over 80 people from over 25 different nationalities, Humanoo is building a one-of-a-kind holistic platform that makes people healthier. We are ambitious and goal-oriented and enjoy working by creating a positive atmosphere.Position:Senior Technical Product Owner - Custom Solutions (f/m/d)Location:Berlin, GermanyStart date:as early as possibleYour Mission in a Nutshell:As aSenior Technical Product Owner - Custom Solutions (f/m/d)at Humanoo, youÂ¡Â¯ll play a central role in transforming our insurance vertical, managing and executing high-impact, white-label products for our biggest clients. Acting as the bridge between Product and Insurance, youÂ¡Â¯ll lead customisation projects end-to-end, ensuring seamless workflows and strategic alignment across teams. With a unique blend of hands-on project management and mentorship, youÂ¡Â¯ll set the standard for excellence, driving exceptional outcomes and establishing best practices in project management.The Team:Join a passionate and ambitious team dedicated to transforming our insurance vertical through innovative health and wellbeing solutions. Reporting directly to the VP of Product, youÂ¡Â¯ll work alongside Senior Product Managers, Insurance Project Managers, and the broader Product, Design, and Engineering (PDE) team. Together, we foster a supportive, solution-oriented environment where collaboration and impact are celebrated.HOW YOU WILL SPEND YOUR TIME:Client & Stakeholder Management:Act as the primary contact for insurance clients and internal PDE teams, aligning on project goals and maintaining proactive, transparent communicationProject Planning & Execution:Oversee project timelines, task assignments, and deliverables via Jira to keep all aspects running smoothly. YouÂ¡Â¯ll ensure our processes are efficient, scalable, and ready for growthStrategic Management:Develop annual plans to manage customisation requests across our insurance clients, strategically balancing resources and identifying potential bottlenecksProcess Improvement & Mentorship:Drive continuous improvement by implementing best practices, optimising workflows, and mentoring team members to foster a culture of excellenceWHAT YOU SHOULD BRING TO THE TABLE:Proven Experience:4+ years as a Product Owner, Project Manager, or in a similar role, with a strong track record of managing technically complex projectsBilingual Communication Skills:Fluent in both German and English, essential for clear and effective communication with our clients and internal teamsTechnical Proficiency:Hands-on experience with Jira and a deep understanding of project management in complex technical environmentsExceptional Communication:Excellent communication skills, and being comfortable setting boundaries, managing expectations, and ensuring alignment with tact and confidenceProactive Mindset:Adaptable, with a natural ability to bring clarity to evolving situations, navigate change, and make decisive movesClient-Centric Experience:Prior experience in a client-facing role is a plus, giving you the insight to build strong client relationships and drive successWHAT IS OUT THERE FOR YOU?What we stand for:Integrity:Acting in the best interest of the Company, Customers, and Employees. Making tough decisions with honesty, transparency, and accountability. Our word is our bond, and we prioritise data-informed decisions.Leadership:Owning domains, big or small, with a commitment to excellence. Empowering others, leading with empathy, and communicating clearly. Never stop the learning process and keep on improving as individuals and as a team.Together:Valuing contributions, appreciating strengths and weaknesses. No room for discrimination - raising our voices against it. Success is shared, and failure is a chance to learn. ONE TEAM, prioritising each other, giving and receiving feedback with care.A sneak peek into your Benefits:Additional health insurance coverage for 900 EUR per year, a monthly subsidy of 70 EUR to cover the daily expenses, permanent contract, 28 days off + 1 more day off for every year you stay with us (capped by 3), 24th and 31st December free and many moreÂ¡Â­INTERVIEW PROCESSUpon receiving your application, our Talent Acquisition team will thoroughly evaluate your submission. We endeavour to respond within 3-5 business days. If your application progresses positively, you will be invited to participate in our comprehensive selection process, which includes the following stages:Recruiter call(45 minutes)Interview with the Hiring Manager(60 minutes)Whiteboard Challenge with two members of the product management team(60 minutes)Value Add interview with two members of the PDE team(45 minutes)After these interview stages are completed, our hiring team will convene for a debrief session to discuss your application. Following this debrief, our Talent Acquisition Partner will contact you to provide feedback and communicate the final decision regarding your candidacy. We value your interest in our organisation and appreciate your participation in our selection process.About usHUMANOO is an automated DIGITAL CORPORATE WELLNESS SOLUTION for corporations and insurances worldwide that helps people lead healthier lives.HUMANOO has offices in Berlin and Paris and helps users to improve physical and mental health by offering customised, on-demand programmes for fitness, yoga, mindfulness, sleep, and nutrition.HUMANOO's pioneering vision allows users to be rewarded for health activity through monetary and non-monetary rewards, leading to sustained engagement and study-based health improvement.More than 600 companies in over 10 countries are already successfully using Humanoo to make their employees and clients healthier and more productive. TK, Coca Cola, Axel Springer, Korian, NÂ¨Â¹rnberger Versicherung, CSS are only some companies using HUMANOO.For more information: https://www.humanoo.com/

highest level of security for our organization.Main Roles & ResponsibilitiesContribute to establishing and implementing the Cybersecurity roadmap, actively shaping strategic initiatives from inception their compliance with cybersecurity requirements.Select, implement, and manage security technologies and tools (e.g., firewalls, SIEM, IDS/IPS) to protect against threats and vulnerabilities.Maintain thorough documentation of security policies, incident reports, risk assessments, and security measures.Plan and execute security audits, compliance assessments, and penetration testing, driving remediation efforts and ensuring adherence to standards.Collaborate on business continuity and disaster recovery plans, ensuring critical systems can be restored swiftly.Stay up to date with emerging cybersecurity threats, technologies, and best practices through continuous learning and professional development.Undertake any additional tasks as agreed upon with the supervisor, ensuring a flexible and adaptive approach to fulfilling the organization's cybersecurity needs.Any other task as assigned by formal supervisor and project work as assigned according to special organizational needs.Your profileEducation and Training:A university degree in Mathematical, Statistical and/or Computer Sciences, or suitable IT-related fieldIndustry recognized certification in Security Incident Handling and Industry standard certifications in security (CISA, CISM, CISSP etc.) is a plus.Working Experience, Style and Skills:Proven experience in cybersecurity and Cyber Incident Management4 -6 yearsÂ¡Â¯ relevant experience in Cyber SecurityExperience in crafting and implementing cybersecurity policies and procedure.Proficiency in implementing secure coding practices and ensuring adherence to coding standards that minimize vulnerabilities.Familiarity with secure software development life cycle methodologies.Experience with various application security tools and technologies to identify and mitigate security risks in software applications.A probing and analytical approach with the ability to pre-empt potential problems and identify inefficiencies.Proactive team playerComputer Skills:Experience with cloud security tools and platforms such as Microsoft Azure Security Center or AWS Security HubFamiliarity with security automation and orchestration tools like Terraform and Ansible.Knowledge of machine learning and AI-based security tools for advanced threat detection, analysis, and responseLanguages:Fluency in English (spoken and written).German is a plus.Others:Experience in working in a multi-cultural, multi-lingual, global team.Commitment to FSCÂ¡Â¯s mission and values.Demonstrated cultural awareness and sensitivity to the diversity of values, views and approaches to issues relevant to the FSC program by stakeholders around the world.Why us?Why Join FSC in Bonn, Germany?Be part of a globally recognized organization at the forefront of sustainable forestry and contribute to the mission to help protect the worldÂ¡Â¯s forests.Play an active role in the FSC global community of 400+ forest stewards who come together in-person at least once a year.Benefit from cross-cultural collaboration and networking opportunities by working in a dynamic, inclusive, and diverse international culture with over 60 nationalities represented under one roof.Enjoy comprehensive benefits, including relocation assistance if needed, and investment in training and development opportunities (e.g., LinkedIn Learning, Learning Lunches and more) to advance your career.Explore the vibrant federal city of Bonn, home to Beethoven, Haribo, and the beautiful Rhein River promenade including many urban parks and close access to nature. The JobThe Chief Operating Officer (COO) will be instrumental in building and scaling the operations of a fast-growing startup at the forefront of Germany's Energiewende (energy transition). The COO will take charge of setting up the foundational structures, processes, and teams required for scalable growth, while driving operational excellence. This role demands a leader with a proven track record in developing high-performing teams, designing efficient operational frameworks, and utilizing data-driven approaches to optimize performance.Key ResponsibilitiesOperational Excellence:Drive and refine end-to-end operations across our energy platform, with a strong focus on the smart metering business. YouÂ¡Â¯ll optimize processes from supply chain and logistics to customer support, ensuring seamless integration between our energy management solutions and the needs of homeowners. Your goal: operational efficiency that matches the cutting-edge nature of our technology.Scaling for Growth:As Spot My Energy expands, youÂ¡Â¯ll be at the forefront of building scalable systems and processes. From managing partnerships with hardware providers (such as PV systems, EV chargers, and home storage units) to optimizing installations and customer onboarding, youÂ¡Â¯ll create the infrastructure to help us scale rapidly while maintaining top-tier service. Growth without compromise.Innovation & Strategy:In close collaboration with the CEO and the rest of the leadership team, youÂ¡Â¯ll help shape the strategy that keeps Spot My Energy ahead of the curve in a rapidly evolving market. Together, youÂ¡Â¯ll ensure our  execution, tech and business model are always on point and ahead of competitors.Team Leadership:Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing operations team focused on excellence, speed, and innovation. YouÂ¡Â¯ll foster a culture of accountability and customer-centricity, ensuring that both our customers and partners are satisfied and loyal and your team can thrive.Your profileExperience5-8 years of operations management experience, including a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role, preferably within a startup or scale-up environment.Proven track record in building and leading teams, establishing operational processes, and scaling operations in a fast-paced startup context.Familiarity with relevant industries, including B2B2C business models, the German energy market, or installation businesses, is advantageous.Leadership SkillsStrong leadership and team-building capabilities, with hands-on experience in hiring, structuring, and developing high-performance teams.Proven ability to cultivate a culture of accountability, innovation, and collaboration across the organization.Working CharacteristicsHighly analytical and structured approach to problem-solving, with experience in designing and implementing data-driven operational frameworks.Exceptional communication skills, enabling effective engagement and alignment with stakeholders across various departments and organizational levels.Entrepreneurial mindset with a focus on growth and adaptability in a dynamic environment.OthersFluency in both German and English is required.Willingness to frequently work on site from our office in Cologne.About usWith the ongoing transition to weather-dependent energy sources, the need for flexibility in the energy market is skyrocketing. At SpotmyEnergy, we are at the forefront of the energy transition, pioneering smart solutions to integrate millions of small assets to provide this flexibility. We innovate asset optimization and flexibility marketing by providing an unparalleled smart metering and asset base that benefits residential customers.

Location: Tubize, BelgiumThales people architect solutions at the heart of the defence-security continuum. Interoperable and secure information and telecommunications systems for defence, security, and civil operators, are based upon innovative use of radiocommunications, networks, and cybersecurity. We are ground breaking new digital technologies such as 4G/5G mobile communications, cryptography, cloud computing and big data for use in physical protection systems, and critical information systems.Thales Belgium SA, Belgium competence center of Thales, is a company located on 2 sites, one in Tubize (near Brussels) and the other one in Herstal (near LiÂ¨Â¨ge). Thales Belgium, which employs more than 280 collaborators, is specialized in the design, development and supply of critical information systems for customers in the sectors of Defense, Security (including Cyber) and Aerospace.Say HI and elevate your career: Internship in Collaborative Combat at Thales Belgium!Are you ready to take the next step in your engineering journey? Thales Belgium invites passionate and talented students for an exciting internship in the Innovation Department , where YOU get to choose your area of interest!1st Internship Topic : Developing the reward functionContext:This research is based on pre-existent work centred on reinforcement learning within multi-agent environments. The proposed challenge is that of designing effective reward functions to accurately guide the algorithm learning process. As the project background is based on decision aid for land collaborative combat, the design of the reward functions needs to take into consideration the collaborative nature of the agents, not just individual goals.Goal:The primary goal of this research is to develop a robust and effective reward function for reinforcement learning algorithms specifically tailored for decision support in collaborative combat.2nd Internship Topic : Research the probabilistic nature of situational awareness and develop a framework that quantifies uncertainty and explores new ways to improve decision making based on itContext:Situational Awareness is a critical component with applicability in varied fields such as military, aviation, emergency responses etc. it is traditionally comprised of perception, comprehension and projection of an environmentÂ¡Â¯s state, and is fundamental in the decision-making process (from perception to performance of action).Focused on the military operations field, this research into situational awareness is meant to delve into the probabilistic nature of situational awareness to further design decision aid models that take uncertainty and variability into account.Goal:Investigate the probabilistic aspects of situational awareness and their implications for decision-making in complex environments (military operations).Develop a framework that quantifies the uncertainty associated with situational awareness and explores how probabilistic models can enhance our understanding of cognitive processes in dynamic settings.3rd Internship Topic : Research state-of-the-art in scientific literature and based on it develop a validation methodology for decision support algorithms (in the context of collaborative combat operations)Context:Reinforcement Learning is a machine learning technique where an agent learns to make optimal decisions by interacting with its environment and maximize cumulative rewards over time. Based on this logic, one of the fields of applicability for RL is in military operations Â¨C namely for decision support models.Goal:Develop a validation framework for decision support RL algorithms used for collaborative combat scenarios.The validation methodology should exhaustively take into consideration the following elements, but is not limited to these:Establish performance metricsTest scenariosMeasure stabilityDetermine and assess risksWhat YouÂ¡Â¯ll Experience:Collaborate with seasoned professionals on groundbreaking R&D projects.Get hands-on with industry-leading tools and technologies in your chosen field.Participate in innovative brainstorming sessions that encourage your ideas.Contribute to real-world applications that make a difference globally.What We Offer:A unique opportunity with a leading company in aerospace, defense, and secure communication.Mentoring from experienced engineers dedicated to your growth.A vibrant and inclusive workplace that celebrates diversity and innovation.The chance to make a real impact on projects that shape the future.Who You Are:A current student pursuing a degree in Data & AI, Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline.Eager to learn and explore various engineering domains.A problem-solver with a knack for creativity and teamwork.Ready to embrace challenges and make meaningful contributions.How It Works:After reviewing your application, we will send you a form to fill where you will be able to specify the topic of your choice together with some administrative questions regarding the internship.At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!Interested?Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.Diversity StatementWe actively support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. That means that equal opportunities, inclusion and an informal culture are integral to our success. It also means that your well-being and happiness matter to us! ThatÂ¡Â¯s why we offer you the flexibility to do whatÂ¡Â¯s important to you; whether thatÂ¡Â¯s part time hours, job sharing, remote working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times.

Protein Biochemisty grouphas a mission to design and generate vaccine candidates by understanding their relation to disease using state-of-the art technology and talent, ensuring delivery of best-in-class vaccines to the patients.Job PurposeThe Associate Scientist in Protein Biochemistry group is expected to design and execute scientific studies in the lab, under guidance of the Lab head, to support vaccine pipeline projects in discovery, development, or life cycle management. More specifically, he/she will be responsible for planning, executing, analyzing and troubleshooting vaccine prototype production activities (mRNA, recombinant protein) as well as new technology implementation within the expression platform and may support other activities within the group.Key ResponsibilitiesResponsible for its routine planning, implementation/execution, and interpretation of scientific research experiments in support of vaccine research and development under the lab head supervision.Manage organization and maintenance of the laboratory, including inventory and lab supply management.Master students internship supervision.Perform data management and draw conclusions from experimental data. Based on data interpretation, suggest next steps to meet project objectives.Ensure timely data collection, & reporting (including participation to internal/external scientific documents) in area of responsibility. Participate actively and present lab results in internal meetings, working groups and technical teams and ensure extensive quality check of raw data.Ensure highest ethical standards, good scientific practices & data integrity are implemented in daily scientific activities.Demonstrate knowledge of the key research activities and basic regulationsTakes appropriate actions to resolve issues in area of responsibility affecting research strategy and progress.Communicate issues proactively and effectively negotiates potential solutions.Why you?Basic Qualifications:We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:Bachelors or Masters degree in Life sciences, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related field.1-3 years of relevant experience in mRNA-based vaccine production.Fluent in French, oral and writing. Proficiency in English would be highly advantageous.Good communication skills, oral and writing.Ability to present data and findings clearly and concisely.Good project scientific/technical strategy skills.Strong collaborative skills with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.Preferred Qualifications:If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:Master in Life sciences, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related field.Previous experience working in cross-functional teams, demonstrating an ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with experts from different scientific backgrounds.Demonstrated ability to lead a research or development project within the area of expertise.Experience in recombinant protein-based vaccine production is an asset.Experience in recombinant protein purification and characterization is an asset.If you have a disability and require assistance during the course of the selection process, you will have the opportunity to let us know what specific assistance you require in order to make suitable arrangements.Why GSK?Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose Â¨C to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together Â¨C so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns Â¨C as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, itÂ¡Â¯s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves Â¨C feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.Important notice to Employment businesses/ AgenciesGSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Location: Tubize, BelgiumThales people architect solutions at the heart of the defence-security continuum. Interoperable and secure information and telecommunications systems for defence, security, and civil operators, are based upon innovative use of radiocommunications, networks, and cybersecurity. We are ground breaking new digital technologies such as 4G/5G mobile communications, cryptography, cloud computing and big data for use in physical protection systems, and critical information systems.Thales Belgium SA, Belgium competence center of Thales, is a company located on 2 sites, one in Tubize (near Brussels) and the other one in Herstal (near LiÂ¨Â¨ge). Thales Belgium, which employs more than 280 collaborators, is specialized in the design, development and supply of critical information systems for customers in the sectors of Defense, Security (including Cyber) and Aerospace.This document outlines the proposal for a six-month internship opportunity at Thales Belgium (TBE) in the Hardware Department. The purpose of this internship is to provide a framework of the activities to be carried out, define the goals, and set the expectations for the student and the company. More precisely, the Hardware Department at Thales Belgium is seeking exceptional students in Physics to join our team for a six-month internship. This internship will focus on improving a Python code [1] used for simulating several complex phenomena related to Rydberg physics in alkaline earth atoms. The intern will be involved in enhancing the code to simulate:Alkali Rydberg States and Stark Maps:Computation of highly-excited atomic states and their energy shifts under external electric fields.Pair-State Interactions for Alkaline Earths:Modeling the interactions between pairs of Rydberg atoms, which is crucial for understanding entanglement and other quantum effects.Perturbative van der Waals C6 Calculations:Calculations within manifolds of energy-degenerate states to understand long-range interatomic forces.Inter-Species Pair-State Calculations:Simulating interactions between different types of atoms in Rydberg states to explore multi-species systems.Sensitivity analysis :Simulating the sensitivity of Rydberg atom based sensors to electromagnetic fields.Background on Rydberg PhysicsRydberg physics is a field focused on highly-excited electronic states where an electron orbits far from the nucleus, creating atoms that are exceptionally large and sensitive to external influences. These "gentle giants" of atomic physics have unusual properties:High Energy and Long Lifetimes:Rydberg atoms are created with high energy and have longer lifetimes compared to other atomic states.Large Size and Sensitivity:Their large size makes them extremely sensitive to their environment, allowing even a single photon to affect the behavior of numerous Rydberg atoms over observable distances under an optical microscope.Common Characteristics:Whether in atoms, molecules, or solids, Rydberg states exhibit features that are well described by the Rydberg formula, which outlines the energy levels of highly-excited hydrogen atoms.Internship Focus: Electromagnetic Field Sensing Using Rydberg AtomsThe primary focus of this internship will be on the simulation of electromagnetic-field sensing using Rydberg atoms in vapor cells. The goal is to improve the simulation's capability to predict the sensitivity of Rydberg atoms to external electromagnetic fields, with the ultimate aim of developing ultra-wideband sensors. These sensors could have applications in fields such as telecommunications, security, and scientific research.Key elements of this research include:Electromagnetically Induced Transparency (EIT) Spectroscopy:This is a nondestructive optical detection technique used to detect signals from Rydberg atoms in the gas phase. EIT has been successfully implemented in both cold atomic gases and room-temperature vapor cells, making it a versatile tool for studying Rydberg states.Simulation of Sensitivity to Electromagnetic Fields:The intern will work on simulating the response of Rydberg atoms to various electromagnetic field conditions, exploring their potential as ultra-sensitive detectors that can operate across a wide range of frequencies.Expected OutcomesBy the end of the internship, the student is expected to achieve the following:Enhancement of Simulation Code:Improve the existing Python code to enhance its accuracy, efficiency, and scope for simulating Rydberg physics phenomena.Development of New Algorithms:Develop and implement algorithms for simulating new types of interactions or field effects that have not yet been explored in the current framework.Analysis and Reporting:Conduct detailed analyses of simulation results, compare them with experimental data, and document findings in a clear and concise manner.Research Contribution:Contribute to the ongoing research efforts at Thales Belgium by collaborating with physicists and engineers, potentially leading to publications or presentations in scientific conferences.At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!Interested?Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.Diversity StatementWe actively support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. That means that equal opportunities, inclusion and an informal culture are integral to our success. It also means that your well-being and happiness matter to us! ThatÂ¡Â¯s why we offer you the flexibility to do whatÂ¡Â¯s important to you; whether thatÂ¡Â¯s part time hours, job sharing, remote working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times.

job_title: Job in Germany: (Junior) IT Application Manager (m/w/d)
description: Work with us on a sustainable energy supply! We do renewables out of conviction: ABO Energy plans and builds wind and solar parks as well as battery and hydrogen projects worldwide. For almost 30 years, ABO Energy's in-house specialist departments have been offering everything from a single source: from site assessment, planning, approval and financing to construction, electricity marketing, grid connection, operational management and service. Securing a future worth living for future generations is our overriding goal. Renewables are in our DNA. (Junior) IT Application Manager (m/f/d) As an internal service provider, the IT&GIS department supports the specialist departments in recording requirements and finding creative solutions, be it for reliable IT infrastructure, process-oriented software and data provision, the precise delivery of geodata and solutions or accurate user support. Supports employees with company applications process and document international inquiries in a ticket system create and maintain user manuals and internal documentation prepare and conduct user training sessions take on other tasks within the "IT Application Management" team work on group-wide IT projects together with the other IT teams Implement smaller IT projects independently Your qualification - you... have completed vocational training in IT or have relevant professional experience work in a solution-oriented, independent and structured manner are a strong team player ideally have experience in the use or support of large-scale IT systems such as DMS and ERP ideally have knowledge in the administration and support of Microsoft365 applications and services Knowledge of SQL queries is an advantage have a very good knowledge of German (at least C1) have a good command of English (at least B2) Don't meet all the qualifications? So if you're interested in a role, apply - even if your previous work experience doesn't meet all the qualifications. You could be just the right candidate for this or another position! Severely disabled applicants will be given special consideration if they are equally qualified. Good reasons for joining ABO Energy We want you to develop to your full potential and use your talents in the right place. Together we will lay the foundation for your career. Flexible working hours Continuing education Job bike Employee events EGYM Wellpass 30 days vacation (+ days off on carnival/Christmas Eve) 13th monthly salary Mobile working Company car (depending on position) Kitchen with free coffee & tea Environmental bonus Charging station Premium insurance (also for private accidents) In just 2 minutes to your completed application Contact person Henri Lauer Junior Consultant Recruiting & Personnel Marketing Write e-mail We look forward to receiving your application via our online form! The European Endowment for Democracy is urgently looking for a Grants Assistant Coordinator(s) to support its flexible democracy support work. Specifically, EED is looking for support in the administrative and financial management of its grants in Eastern Europe and other countries of EED operations.The ideal candidate has a keen interest in financial management. At least two years of proven full-time professional experience in civil society-related projects and programmes is required. The candidates must have full working knowledge of English and Russian. Working knowledge of other languages of the region would be a significant asset.1. Main functions of the post:? Supporting the management of EED grants, in close coordination with relevant staff, focusing on ensuring eligibility of costs, monitoring the financial management of the projects and compliance with contract stipulations;? Providing guidance and assistance to EED grantees regarding the financial management of the grants;? Preparing financial reports and other documentation for submission to EED donors.2. Duties and Responsibilities:The selected candidate will work under the guidance of the relevant Grants Manager(s) and report to the Director of Operations, and shall be responsible for (in addition to the above-mentioned):? Directly reviewing financial reports from EED grantees (and all related supporting documents/invoices submitted by grantees in local languages) in order to verify eligibility of expenses;? Assisting in the assessment of budgets of initial proposals for EED grants;? Drafting contracts and all related contractual documentation;? Ensuring compliance of grant implementation with EED contractual requirements;? Ensuring internal grant administrative cycles (e.g. preparing internal memos etc.);? Liaising with grantees to provide training, assistance and advice regarding the financial management of the grant, including support in preparing requests for addenda regarding changes in activity plans, budget revisions and project extensions;? Coordinating with EED colleagues and sending consolidated feedback on financial and narrative reports to grantees;? Collecting, verifying and aggregating data related to substantive, technical and financial implementation related to the different grants;? Assisting in the preparation of comprehensive financial reports for EEDÂ¡Â¯s donors and ensuring timely submission of such reports (with all required supporting documents), in compliance with contract stipulations;? Assisting in keeping track of expenditure by financial year; and liaising with relevant colleagues to keep track of funds received from and/or to be reimbursed to donors in each financial year:? Supporting internal knowledge management and learning;? Advising grantees on donor regulations;? Coordinating with EED external consultant(s);? Carrying out on-site monitoring missions, if required;? Providing translation of short texts and/or commissioning/coordinating translation of more extensive documentation, as necessary;? Performing other related tasks as required.3. Key eligibility and selection criteriaa. Conditions for eligibility:o preferably be a national or having permanent residence permit of one of the EED Member Stateso Be entitled to his/her full rights as a citizen;o Have completed any obligations imposed on him/her by the laws concerning military service;o Be physically fit to perform his/her duties.b. Essential selection criteriaLevel and type of formal education:o University degree in Finance or Economics, International Affairs, International Development or related discipline.Professional experience:o Demonstrated track record in grant-making (particularly from the administrative and financial perspective), and/or project management and/or audit, financial control;o At least two years of proven full-time professional experience in grant management ideally within civil society-related projects and programmes;o Experience in working with democracy-support donors in government and/or international organisations and/or from civil society;o Experience of working with civil society in the countries of Eastern Europe considered an asset.Functional competencies:o Full professional working knowledge of Russian and English (including ability to draft quality reports for donors);o Working knowledge of other languages of the region would be an asset.o Ability to verify financial reports (including verification of all supporting documents);o Ability to liaise with donors;o Substantive understanding of political issues and trends in the Eastern Neighbourhood as well as EU policies towards the region;o Solid ICT skills, especially in Microsoft Excel;o High drive for detail and precision;o Ability to keep full confidentiality about all assigned tasks and related documentation as well as capacity to exercise confidentiality, discretion and tact when dealing with diverse groups of people;o High degree of communication skills and excellent interpersonal skills;o Ability to develop strong working relationships internally and externally at all levels;o High personal and professional culture;o Ability to work in a multicultural environment;o Readiness for duty travel.4. ApplicationPlease make sure you meet all required qualifications and experience before applying. Applicants must upload a motivation letter (outlining why they apply for this job, max. one standard page), a CV (Europass format required), and contact information for three references via the EED recruitment portal. Failure to submit these three documents shall result in the exclusion of the applicant concerned from the selection procedure.Applications should be made online using Â¡Â°ApplyÂ¡Â± panel on this page. After successfully submitting your application you will receive an automatic email confirming receipt of your application. Please no phone calls/emails/letters. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.Applications should be submitted no later than 31 December 2024, midnight (Brussels time), given the urgent needs in the region. Interviews will be planned for short-listed candidates. A written test may be organised.The information provided in the applications is subject to EU legislation on protection of personal data and confidentiality of information. Applications will be subjected to pre-employment screening & vetting, including criminal records check.5. Terms of contractEED is not an international organisation or EU institution and its employment contracts are fully based on Belgian Employment Law. Indicative GROSS salary is around Â4,000 per month plus standard benefits foreseen under Belgian labour law (meal vouchers, 13th month salary etc.), with additional medical insurance.The successful candidate will be offered a fixed term contract until end February 2026. Subsequent extensions will depend on available funds and satisfactory performance.Expected starting time at EED: January 2025Working place: EED Secretariat located in the centre of Brussels, Belgium.

Do you enjoy working with PowerBI and ETL processes?Would you like to contribute to building and managing a solid data platform for data-driven decision-making to make a real impact?Then you are the Data Engineer we are looking for! You are in contact dailyWith various departments including IT and the Key Users to properly monitor and coordinate everything. You are responsible for code generation and applying generic functions and patterns. You use Cloud Technology for optimization. You support new working methods such as CI/CDand dBt. you are responsible for the management of the powerbi environment. You do incidental maintenance of the server environment. Where are you going to work? Our customer sells and distributes payment terminals. Why is this something for you? You have a bachelor's level and work level. You have a solid knowledge of ETL processes and tools for data integration. You speak quicklyDutch and English. You have experience with agile/scrum. What does your employer offer? You end up in a close-knit BI team in which cooperation and pleasure are central. You enjoy a very good work-life balance where you 3 days perWeek from home can work. You get an attractive wage supplemented with numerous fringe benefits including firm car, group and hospitalization insurance, GSM with subscription for private use, laptop, home work allowance, meal and eco vouchers, cafeteria plan, wage bonus etc.4/5th worksis possible in this position. You enjoy 20 vacation days + 12 ADV days.
