description:
About Glovo

WeÃ¢ÂÂre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, youÃ¢ÂÂll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of livesÃ¢Â?all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world class Data Analyst to join our Regional team in Poland. The team is deployed in the top cities in Poland, leading our growth and working on delivering on our vision of giving everyone easy access to anything in every city in Poland.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Develop and own scalable and reliable reporting tools for the Regional team, enabling the team to make decisions based on up to date and insightful data with a 360 view, including commercial, operational and financial KPIs.
Support the definition of targets and calculation of achievements both for the team and for single individuals, ensuring fair but challenging targets.
Track KPIs, identifying trends and factors that represent risks and opportunities, across areas such as Sales, Marketing & Growth, Operations, Profitability.
Perform ad hoc analyses and deep dives as required, owning them end to end: frame problem, identify and gather data, perform analysis, present insights and results with appropriate visualizations.
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference

Expertise in SQL - Redshift experience a plus

BachelorÃ¢ÂÂs degree in a scientific or business discipline
Proficiency in English (written and communication) is a must. Proficiency in Polish desired.

description:
Farm21 is looking for Data Specialist who likes to work in a highly dynamic Agritech startup. While we currently have a small team, we are active in 15 countries.

Our online platform provides farmers with advice and actions needed for optimal crop production. Through this advice, fewer resources are used to achieve better yields; more efficiency, better returns; higher sustainability. Data sources we use for this include our own field sensors but also weather forecasts, soil information, satellite images, etc. It is up to the Data Analyst to build the data analytics and find the connection within the data.

In addition, our ambitions go beyond large farms. In the coming years, we will also work on propositions for small farmers in developing countries. They are responsible for 80% of the food consumed in developing countries. We believe they must be part of the digitisation of agriculture to solve the world food crisis. We can help increase their yields, giving them a better income and the world more food.

As a data analyst, you can make a huge impact on the agriculture sector, globally!

This role allows you to work on an infinity of possibilities, but within one platform. At Farm21, you get the time and space for depth, but every project requires a different approach and data set to work with.

Tasks

Farm21 aims to generate insights for farmers based on data. We're continuously looking for more and better data to help farmers make better decisions. Your tasks will include:

Combining different data sources.
Refinement of (sensor) data, and identifying gaps in data.
Generate insights and visualize/ interpret data using machine learning/deep-learning models.

Requirements

You

Have experience or a strong interest in arable farming
Knowledge of biological (plant) processes
Are always curious about learning new stuff
Identify good-quality data sources

Responsibilities

Work together in a team to generate useful insights from data
Identify good-quality data sources
Identify missing data
Build, test and maintain data models
Implementation of data models in a production environment

Qualifications

Fluent in English
Experience in the agricultural sector
Bachelor's degree/level or higher

Bonus

Experience in crop growth modeling
Experience in SQL/PostgreSQL
Experience in Python

Benefits

We offer:

Fantastic colleagues to work with, a young and dynamic team
A good salary
Provided lunch at the office
The opportunity to work both remotely and in the office (Amsterdam)

Does this suit you? Then apply quickly!
linkedin_skills: PostgreSQL, SQL, Data Models, Data Engineering, Data Modeling, Data Science, Databases, and English

description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that's what we're doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we've still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

Right now, we have more than 20 million users around the world. We work across 8 countries and 90 cities, adapting our product fast to be leaders in all of those markets and taking care about sustainability.

Our Data teams include an eclectic bunch of awesome and diverse people from different backgrounds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries. Having a diverse and inclusive work environment is really important for us. That's why we like to count with different points of view in our team that help us to solve problems in a better way.

You will:

Leverage data to perform intensive analysis across all audiences of our business to improve operational efficiency and streamline processes.
Generate and execute on ideas for exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics
Use data visualization to distill complicated spatio-temporal data into easy to digest summaries that are used to monitor health and inform product
Present findings to senior management to guide business decisions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such Operations, Growth, and Tech

Our Ideal candidate has:

Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
Graduate degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, or related fields
Working experience as a Data Analyst or Operations Analyst
Working experience in execution process optimization, measurement and follow up on customer-centric processes based on scalability and continuous improvement
Proficient in writing and understanding SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma. Certificate will be a plus
Working knowledge of Tableau or any other data visualization tool
Master degree on Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related will be a plus
Good communication skills and priorities identification
Fluency in English and Spanish

What's it like to work at Cabify?

We're a company full of happy, motivated people and we never want that to change. Here are some more reasons why it rocks to be part of our high-performance.

Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-38KÃ¢ÂÂ¬], L3 [35-48KÃ¢ÂÂ¬]

Training programs

All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent)
A pet room, so you don't have to leave your furry friend at home

Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability.

Join us!

description:
About the company:
NOOS Digital is an agency specialized in digital business development. We started the company with the idea of bridging the gap between executive management and operations in digital transformation and acceleration. We define our offer in strategy, analysis, and project management in order to improve our clients digital operations. Currently, we work on exciting assignments with Djerf Avenue, Sneakers n Stuff, Stadium, Scandinavian Photo.

NOOS strives to always be data-driven, insightful, goal-oriented, and innovative in our assignments. Our projects are delivered with dignity and we are passionate about creating long-term and sustainable growth for and together with our clients. Our ambition is to create an outstanding agency that is ub top level of the competition of what we do. For us, being the best means continuously challenging ourselves, our clients, and our projects to a level where we consistently exceed our clients expectations.

Read more about us atwww.noosdigital.com

About the position:
As a Data Analyst at NOOS, you will be a part of our Data and Insight Team and have the opportunity to help us develop our offering within Insight and Strategy. This makes you a central part of NOOS, where you work closely with our consultants to deliver the best results for our clients.

By nature, you are an analytical and structured profile who bridges the gap between business and technology in your analytical capabilities. You are skilled at translating data into insights and drawing conclusions from them. We place great importance on your ability to collaborate, flexibility and a solution-oriented mindset.

In your work, you will be challenged in various areas related to retail business development and digital transformation. We work from different perspectives depending on the customer and business we encounter. In this role, your responsibility, together with the team, will be to support projects of various natures from start to finish in close collaboration with the client.

Skills:

Strong Excel skills.
Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics.
Knowledge or experience working in BI.
Skills in SQL, Python, Node.js.
Interpretation of large data sets.
Understanding of how we translate insights into recommendations.
An interest and curiosity in business development and business analysis.

Education:

Business Economics.
Industrial Economics.
Or equivalent academic education.

We offer:

The opportunity to be part of building tomorrow's management agency.
The opportunity to work with clients of different characters and with different challenges and conditions to create a successful digital business together.
Colleagues with a vast knowledge base in digital business and strong internal knowledge sharing.
Attractive benefits.
Office in central Stockholm.
Competitive salary conditions (pension, wellness allowance, etc.).
Flexible work environment with the possibility to work partially remote.
Several company activities.

description:
AGCO is a global leader focused on the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural machinery and infrastructure. As a Fortune 500 company and one of the global leaders in agricultural equipment manufacturing, we have an extensive network of over 9,200 dealers and serve more than 140 countries. While headquartered in Duluth, Georgia, AGCO has manufacturing facilities all over the world creating and distributing their full-line of products, including Challenger, Fendt, GSI, Massey Ferguson, and Valtra. Visit www.AGCOcorp.com for more information.

Financial Accountant / Analyst

Budapest, Hungary

We are looking for enthusiastic junior professionals to join our growing Financial Accountant/Analystteams in order to provide best class service to AGCO colleagues worldwide.

The junior financial accountant/analyst is responsible for the financial accountancy or analysis processes as part of the R2R organization in our Shared Service Center in Budapest and provides support for the entities under Budapest R2R team.

Your Impact

Completing month end close tasks within the agreed deadlines
Preparing accruals and posting them in SAP / OneStream
Analyze month end reports
Detect and notify unsuccessful payments. Assist to resolve unsuccessful payments.
Creation of manual payment instructions in several Bank Portals
Conducts data entry of accounting entries into the system and ensures data integrity

What You Will Bring

Bachelor degree in Finance or business (or similar)
0-2 years of relevant experience
Good MS Excel knowledge
Able to communicate in English

A Plus If You Have

SAP knowledge
Analytical skills
SSC reporting / GL accounting area experience
FASS/KPMG PBC List preparations experience

What We Offer

Working in international environment, possibility to grow global network
Additional benefits (Private medical insurance / Competetive cafeteria package / Employee assistance program, etc.)

If you are looking for an opportunity to work in an inspiring dynamic multinational environment for a leading global player of agricultural solutions, we look forward to receiving your application in English language (incl. your CV, motivation letter and earliest possible start date) via our career website: http://careers.agcocorp.com. For more information about AGCO, please visit www.AGCOcorp.com.

We offer you appropriate perspectives and personal as well as professional development possibilities

More people. More food. More farm productivity.

It's a simple but compelling growth opportunity for AGCO and for your career.

Join AGCO to grow your career. We are Leading the Way. Together.

AGCO - MAKE YOUR LIFE DIFFERENT

description:
WeÃ¢ÂÂre looking for the right candidate to join our Business Data Analyst team and become part of a fast-growing company that is on always on the look for people that will demonstrate theyÃ¢ÂÂre able to grow with the company. As the role is our entry level, this is a great entry point for a career path at Lokad, either as a future technical expert or as manager.

We help companies in different verticals (aerospace, automotive, ecommerceÃ¢Â? to forecast and make decisions about their inventory. The vast majority of our clients are based outside of France, mainly in North America and Europe.

As a Business Data Analyst (or Supply Chain Scientist in Lokad's terminology), your role is to make sure our clients get the most from Lokad's technology. The role is a mix between technology, data crunching and supply chain expertise. You will address complex supply chain issues and craft quantitative strategies. Your goal is not only to advise your clients on strategies to adopt, but to craft and execute these strategies on a daily basis while leveraging the data available as much as possible. Your goal is also to keep refining these strategies over time to keep them aligned with the needs of our clients.

At Lokad, you will benefit from the extensive training and coaching of our expert team. You will gain skills in supply chain, predictive analysis and overall quantitative optimization for business. You will learn how to achieve measurable business results grounded on scientific analysis of data.

About one quarter of your time is spent interacting with clients in order to better understand their business (mainly over the phone or by mail, with occasional travels). Note that, in order to benefit from your colleagues expertise, you won't be required to work on the customers' premises.

The rest of your time is spent on data analysis, including manipulating and cleaning data, setting up forecasts, economic optimization, reporting and data vizualisation. In order to do this, you'll learn to use our Differentiable Programming tools and a DSL (Envision) developped by Lokad.

We are looking for candidates with the following skills and qualities:

A strong engineering background.
A keen interest in data and quantitative analysis in general.
Good Excel skills or programming skills (e.g. Python, VBA, SQL, etc.).
Impeccable command of English( French is optional).
Excellent communication skills and telephone manners.
A well-made head, rather than a well-filled head.We are not looking for someone who is already an expert in supply chain or programming. WeÃ¢ÂÂre looking for a fast learner, with an ability to quickly grasp technology and concepts, since our technology is by no means a simple and plug-and-play product. Knowledge or understanding of supply chain would be a bonus, but the ability to quickly assess and grasp a new situation or get a clear picture of how an organization works and what are the pain points is what we are really after.
Candidates must be self-motivated, confident and highly driven to achieve results with a Ã¢ÂÂhands onÃ¢Â?attitude.

The role is predominantly office based, although some travel will be occasionally required to customers, partners or events. We are located in the very center of Paris, France (station Chevaleret).
linkedin_skills: Data Analysis, English, Python (Programming Language), Communication, Analytical Skills, Supply Chain Optimization, Programming, Supply Chain Management, and Customer Service

Your daily life?

description:
Het zijn roerige tijden in de markt voor fusies en overnames; hoge inflatie, oplopende rentes en de nasleep van supply chain problematiek. Ondanks deze ontwikkelingen kan Catapult Corporate Finance de vraag naar haar diensten met moeite bijbenen. Daarom breiden wij ons team uit met onder meer (junior) business analysts.

Over Catapult Corporate Finance
Catapult Corporate Finance werkt voor opdrachtgevers die voor wezenlijke beslissingen in hun bedrijfsvoering staan. Of het nou gaat om gedeeltelijke of algehele verkoop van het bedrijf, de acquisitie van een concurrent, of het aantrekken van (groei)kapitaal; in al deze fases spelen de specialisten van Catapult een cruciale rol. Wij hebben een indrukwekkendtrack recordvan transacties in het hogere MKB-segment, in zowel binnen- als buitenland. Als processpecialist zijn wij werkzaam in vrijwel alle sectoren: productie (kunststof, staal, steen, hout), software/ICT, logistiek, handel, en alle denkbare vormen van dienstverlening.

De functie
Als (junior) business analyst verzamel je, al dan niet met een collega, relevante informatie en voer je (financiÃÂ«le) analyses uit. Je identificeert risicoÃ¢ÂÂs en kansen, komt met werkbare oplossingen en bijbehorende acties met tijdspad. In teamverband werk je doorgaans aan meerdere opdrachten tegelijk. Jouw functie is veelzijdig en varieert per opdracht, afhankelijk van de situatie van de klant en de rol die Catapult heeft.
Je maakt deel uit van het transactieteam. Je werkt aan waarderings- en financieringsvraagstukken, voert financiÃÂ«le analyses uit en stelt informatie- en financieringsmemoranda samen. Daarnaast ondersteun je het transactieproces, heb je contact met diverse partijen en ondersteun je het onderhandelingsteam. Je wordt aangemoedigd om initiatief te nemen en probleemoplossend te denken, met een gezonde dosis creativiteit.
Je bent vanaf het begin een integraal onderdeel van een overzichtelijk en hecht team, met een grote mate van vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Je verantwoordelijkheden nemen al snel toe en je zult direct en actief worden betrokken bij onder andere transacties, transities en financieringsvraagstukken.
De uiteenlopende situaties eisen proactief en zelfstandig handelen, niet zelden onder tijdsdruk. Je leert bij Catapult Ã¢ÂÂon the jobÃ¢Â? Kortom, een unieke leerschool en een kickstart voor jouw carriÃÂ¨re.
Aanvullend zul je na enige tijd de mogelijkheid krijgen om mee te werken aan een bedrijfsherstructurering of deel uitmaken van een turnaround team. Je ondersteunt jouw senior collegaÃ¢ÂÂs met (financiÃÂ«le) analyses op basis waarvan essentiÃÂ«le keuzes worden gemaakt.

Wie zoeken wij
Je bent een jonge professional met flair en eigenheid. Een autonome denker met verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en werklust. Een teamspeler met sterke financiÃÂ«le en analytische vaardigheden en een oplossingsgerichte instelling. Je bent proactief en hebt een scherp oog voor detail. Je begrijpt het belang van betrouwbare kwantitatieve en financiÃÂ«le inzichten, passend bij onze bijzonder hoge kwaliteitsnormen.
Je bent net afgestudeerd of je hebt net je eerste jaren relevante werkervaring opgedaan. Je hebt een Master degree in Finance, Economie, Econometrie, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde, Accounting of een andere vergelijkbare studie. Werk- en/of stage-ervaring binnen een corporate finance, private equity, transaction services of accountancy omgeving is een prÃÂ©. Uitgebreide kennis van Excel is een must.
Je kiest bewust voor de unieke mogelijkheden die Catapult biedt. Je wilt aan transacties werken, en betrokken worden op de momenten dat je kunt leren van ervaren specialisten.
Ondernemerschap spreekt je aan en je bent geÃÂ¯nteresseerd in wat mensen drijft. Je beschikt over uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden. Een flexibele instelling is een voorwaarde. Je bent bereid je in de breedte verder te ontwikkelen en de handen uit de mouwen te steken.

Wat biedt Catapult
Een unieke omgeving om de meest uiteenlopende bedrijfssituaties en sectoren te leren kennen. Een intensieve leerschool met steile leercurve, om door te groeien binnen Catapult of als basis voor een functie in het bedrijfsleven. Wij investeren volop in de ontwikkeling van het team. We verwachten dat je alle ruimte pakt.
Onze primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn meer dan marktconform. Daarnaast hechten wij veel aandacht aan persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling van onze teamleden.
Catapult kent een informele en betrokken cultuur. Wij werken vanuit ons prachtige pand aan de IJssel in Deventer.

description:
Job Introduction

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Culinary Data Assistantforan 18months FTCto join our central Food Platform team and help establish Sodexo as the culinary leader in the UK & Ireland marketplace. As the Culinary Data Assistant, you will play an integral role in the successful and consistent implementation of our Food Management System (FMS) through recipe and menu transfer, compliance management, and future development for core, retail, and segment requirements. You will work closely with the Culinary team and various stakeholders to ensure that the FMS is fully developed, deployed, and maintained within the agreed framework, while delivering excellence through the FMS.

To be successful in this role you will have great communication skills, be a highly motivated individual with a broad understanding of the catering industry and a sound knowledge of different basic cookery principles.

Come and be a part of our exciting journey towards culinary excellence and make a positive impact on our customers and clients. Apply now to join our team!

Role Responsibility

Transfer of data to the FMS in line with the DRIVE project strategy
Support the process for managing expectations to support segments
Ensure full collaboration with all teams impacted by role
Support the Co-ordination of alignment of recipe and menu development protocols and processes
Liaise with central and segment peer group to ensure all are fully aligned to FMS and Drive systems
Work inside the framework of best practice for culinary excellence when developing recipe and menu content
Fully support the culinary team to effectively test the robustness of all recipes and menus prior to launch
Liaise with design team, central culinary team and segment executive teams to execute briefs effectively
Establish strong working relations with all relevant stakeholders to ensure the most successful and effective use of the role

The Ideal Candidate

Highly motivated data inputter with a good level of catering experience in industry including system management
Experience in recipe and menu creation
Broad understanding and sound knowledge of different basic cookery principles
Computer literate and a good working knowledge of Food Management Systems
Strong self-motivational skills with proven track record of delivery to deadlines
The ability to interpret and translate new developments in a structured manner to ensure the project continues
Strong influencing and relationship building skills with wide range of stakeholders
Must be able to work with competing demands
Ability to manage a number of different projects at the same time including the allocation of resources as appropriate to deliver to timescales and deadlines
Strong listening and influencing skills with proven effectiveness in successfully working as part of a project team
Strong communication and rational decision making skills

Desirable

A background in recipe, menu, and concept design
Product development within various sectors
Proven track record in supporting the development of projects
SME Experience within a number of segments within foodservice/contract catering market
Development and Training background

About The Company

In the UK and Ireland, Sodexo employs around 30,000 people, and partners with clients in many sectors across business and industry; schools and universities; sports and leisure; energy and resources; government and agencies; healthcare; justice and defence.

SodexoÃ¢ÂÂs connected; people-centric approach brings together a diverse range of expertise. description:
12 Month Contract

Your team

The Paddy Power Sports Team is responsible for the overall revenue for the online Paddy Power Sports business. We are tasked with defining and ensuring consistent delivery of a customer led proposition to grow our share in the UK and Irish market.

This role will report to the Senior Performance & Analytics Manager, Paddy Power Sports. The overall purpose of the role is to provide insights to help grow the customer base of the Paddy Power online business via acquisition and retention.

What youÃ¢ÂÂll do

Investigate, analyse and provide recommendations on key areas of customer lifecycle
Lead customer growth performance to understand growth drivers, trends and customer behaviours. Ensuring that the customer is central to our decision-making process.
Supporting strategic, deep dive analysis to drive recommendations on how we can better deliver against the PP customer growth strategy
Working with the Digital Acquisition team to manage and optimise digital media spend and updating partners on the performance of PP overall marketing spend
Evaluate and understand the drivers of all Sports revenue streams.
Show how customer experience and interactions impact performance.
Encourage a data led approach to the decision-making process across commercial team.

How youÃ¢ÂÂll do it

Skilled at assimilating numerous sources of information to make or change decisions
Ability to prioritise and focus on what really matters and to communicate these decisions in a timely manner
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with ability to communicate effectively at all levels within the business
Strong personal presence and presentation; ability to feel comfortable when surrounded by senior partners and speak with confidence
Ability to build successful relationships and positively influence people Ã¢Â?including direct reports, peers and partners
Team player with personal characteristics that engender trust and confidence

About PaddyPower

Work that makes play jealous

Paddy Power has been breaking and re-writing the rules since 1988, from on-track bookmakers to cheeky upstart mischief-makers, to part of the largest betting and gaming technology company in the world.

Although weÃ¢ÂÂve grown to the betting behemoth we are today, weÃ¢ÂÂve not forgotten our roots. We continue to offer great value and entertainment to our customers and keep them at the heart of what we do.

Our culture of hard work, boldness and an innovative spirit got us to where we are and we take our work seriously, but not ourselves! We win by having the best people working well together. DonÃ¢ÂÂt pigeon-hole us either Ã¢Â?our company is a mix of sports nuts, gaming innovators, tech geniuses, perceptive people-people, inspiring leadersÃ¢Â?and a very busy legal team.

WeÃ¢ÂÂve got a growing squad of specialists, and we make the work fun. Sound good? Maybe thereÃ¢ÂÂs a spot on the team for you!

Plus, PaddyPower is part of the Flutter UK & Ireland family Ã¢Â?a collection of big-hitting entertainment brands such as Betfair, Sky Betting & Gaming and Tombola.

What weÃ¢ÂÂll offer you

ÃÂ£1,000 learning fund
Unlimited holiday
Twice-yearly bonus (with part of it guaranteed!)
Pension contribution scheme
Private healthcare
Flexible ways of working Ã¢Â?home or office, itÃ¢ÂÂs your choice!
Access to thousands of Udemy courses
Invest via the Company Sharesave Scheme
16 hours paid volunteering time per year

WeÃ¢ÂÂre working to be an inclusive employer, and we encourage people from all backgrounds, ways of thinking and working to apply. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don't have to meet all the requirements listed to apply for this role.
If you need any adjustments to make this role work for you let us know, and weÃ¢ÂÂll see how we can accommodate them

About Our Client

Our client is the driving force behind the recycling of household packaging in Belgium. Every day,they work with public and private partners to create a circular economy for household packaging, from collection among the general public to sustainable recycling in our own country.

Job Description

You have a central role in order to ensure right observations, conclusions and decisions across the business; from upstream (members, total market) to downstream operations (collection and recycling).

With a critical eye you contribute to various internal and external reports.
You provide our internal and external clients with actionable and easily interpretable reports and dashboards that support them in their decision making.
Through your knowledge and your insights in our data, you monitor and report on data quality.
You have a permanent view on external data which can help us enriching our own data.
You follow up your projects in an autonomous and efficient way.
As member of the Data Team, you help spread the data story throughout the organization so that data stays top of mind within the company

The Successful Applicant

you have a university degree (or equal by experience); with at least 5 years of work experience;
You have a profound knowledge of excel
You have a basic knowledge of applied statistics;
You have experience with BI reporting;
You speak fluent French or Dutch with a good knowledge of the other language.
You have an analytical mind, you work in an accurate and structured way;
You are a strong problem solver
you are a teamplayer
You are an autodidact

What's On Offer

Working in a company focusing on growth of their employees

Working with passionate team members

Working directly with top management

Competitive salary package

description:
This is the perfect opportunity if you have passion for Data, Analytics & E-commerce. You get enthusiastic about providing actionable insights to improve our usersÃ¢Â?experience & e-commerce performance. We are looking for 2(!) Data Analysts who will join us in our journey to become a truly data-driven e-commerce company. We work in agile product teams, where product owners, developers, data analysts, UX & CRO specialists are working closely together and fully focus on their product. With 3 E-commerce data analysts already in the team & a data analyst community of > 50 colleagues across the group, weÃ¢ÂÂre sure you will get challenged to keep learning and look forward to your contribution!

During the last years we have spent a lot of time on the implementation of the Google Analytics 360 suite and Tableau. The implementation gives us great insights in our visitors & customersÃ¢Â?digital behaviour. Think about what you can analyze and contribute to our business with access to all our click, customer, product- & sales data of >50k (recurring) customers, >500k products and >1 billion of yearly turnover data. We are looking for the person who is always looking for the question behind the question, can combine & extract data from multiple sources and is comfortable in translating these into actionable insights and presenting this to stakeholders.

The role

You will enable product teams to make decisions from the data lens, by conducting in-depth analysis and creating insights through dashboarding.
You will analyze and monitor the development of our e-commerce KPIÃ¢ÂÂs, the progress of our objectives & key results (OKRÃ¢ÂÂs) and translate these into insights.
Support multiple teams in working with OKRÃ¢ÂÂs by defining metrics, baseline measurements & targets. Then validate & analyze the impact for all improvements we create in our digital experience (such as pre-post analysis and/or experimentation analysis).
Build relationships with stakeholders to establish yourself as the expert for data insights & web analytics expertise, working together with the other analysts in different teams to continuously improve our maturity in data-driven decision making.
You are responsible for our key journeys, such as findability of items, delivery communication & check-out. A very challenging opportunity!

Who are you?

Completed bachelorÃ¢ÂÂs or masterÃ¢ÂÂs degree in a relevant professional area.
At least 4 years of experience as an analyst in e-commerce/digital companies.
Good communication and advisory skills (written and spoken).
Strong experience with web analytics like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics or similar tooling.
Experience with dashboarding and data visualization.
Strong ability to extract actionable insights from advanced analyses and being able to advise on possible next steps.
Preferably you have experience with Python, SQL & Google BigQuery (we provide room for training & personal development to learn).
You live in the Netherlands, near Utrecht or Varsseveld, because we work at least once a week together at our office in Utrecht and also at our main office in Varsseveld.
Since the working language in our team is Dutch, we prefer candidates who are fluent in Dutch, both verbally and in writing.

What do we offer?

We are an ambitious, fast growing and financially sound organization. Therefore, you can expect a few important things from us. We value personal development a lot and thus we offer great budget for courses and trainings. Besides a competitive monthly salary we also offer:

37 holidays
A lot of room for growth and entrepreneurship
Profit sharing bonus scheme
Flexible working hours and location
Laptop and working from home package
Generous pension plan

Who are we?

Johan Kramp started in 1951 from his garage in Varsseveld. When cycling he crossed borders to Germany: the beginning of the international millions company we are nowadays. We still follow the principles of Johan Kramp, but in time of today. Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business.

Working at Kramp means working with more than 3.000 international colleagues. Despite our size, we retained our family culture. Colleagues describe our culture as warm, friendly and informal. Entrepreneurship is in our DNA, but it's allowed to make mistakes. Trust and responsibility is what our colleagues value in Kramp as their employer.

Procedure

In case you feel challenged by above role description and requirements, weÃ¢ÂÂre interested in meeting you! Please use the application button and send your CV and motivation letter.

Location

Varsseveld (NL) / Utrecht (NL)

Contact

Do you have a question about this vacancy? Please donÃ¢ÂÂt hesitate to contact Bob Veurman, Manager E-business Marketing.

E: bob.veurman@kramp.com

Varsseveld (NL)

Location:

Varsseveld (NL)

description:
The Data Annotation Specialist is a key component in building the next generations of speech recognition by producing high quality transcriptions and contextual turns which train and improve Microsoft products and services. The Data Annotation Specialist will use native language skills and cultural knowledge to capture linguistic nuances with high fidelity. In this role you will be the foundation of the Microsoft teams responsible for driving machine learning and high AI technology, such as, AI assistance for peopleÃ¢ÂÂs daily life, meeting captioning, and more. Join our team and use your background and expertise to continue delivering value to Microsoft.

Data Annotation Specialists

Use in house tools to transcribe and annotate data for various projects. A few examples may be providing transcription (text) for audio clips or annotating text or images to verify certain types of data.
Go through content (online and offline), extract information, provide needed information through tools with high accuracy and consistency.
Perform quality evaluation of transcription and annotation results produced by different sources.
Collaborate with team members on day-to-day problem solving and projects assigned by managers.
Data Annotation Specialists will come across offensive, sensitive, or objectionable material and may be required to work with this type of content to help train our AI models for the protection of MicrosoftÃ¢ÂÂs customers.
Data Annotation Specialists are comfortable understanding data as it relates to :

Sentiment: The emotional intonation and other subjective implications behind keywords and phrases.
Intent: The human intent, or the userÃ¢ÂÂs end goal, behind different statements.
Semantic: Understanding exactly what the meaning is behind what users are seeking
--

Microsoft Business Process Outsourcing and AI Operations (BPO & AIO) is responsible for the contracting, performance management, and continuous improvement execution activities for all outsourced global service providers supporting a wide range of business units within Microsoft. Our Mission is to be trusted advisors who anticipate and operationally execute on Business Process and opportunities delivering value to both Microsoft and our Customers.

If you love the pursuit of excellence and are inspired by the challenges that come through driving innovations that impact how the world lives, works and plays, then we invite you to learn more about Microsoft Operations - and the value we deliver across Microsoft and to our customers and partners. We offer unique opportunities to work on interesting global projects in an environment that appreciates diversity, focuses on talent development and recognizes and rewards great work.

We make doing business with Microsoft easy.

Job location: Lisbon, Portugal (on-site only)

Fluent speaker or equivalent experience of French, France
Responsibilities

Data Annotation SpecialistÃ¢ÂÂs use in house tools to transcribe and annotate data for various projects. A few examples may be providing transcription (text) for audio clips or annotating text or images to verify certain types of data; go through content (online and offline), extract information, provide needed information through tools with high accuracy and consistency; perform quality evaluation of transcription and annotation results produced by different sources; collaborate with team members on day-to-day problem solving and projects assigned by managers.

Data Annotation Specialists will come across offensive, sensitive, or objectionable material and may be required to work with this type of content to help train our AI models for the protection of MicrosoftÃ¢ÂÂs customers.

Business Program Planning and Design

Learns to perform program landscape research and analysis (e.g., internal and/or external market, sales, delivery), forecasting, and examine business trends (e.g., customer feedback and expectations) to identify audience size and program scope, and stay current, agile, and competitive. Learns the overall business goals, objectives, and strategies, and understands the short-term business priorities. Understands and identifies current program risks, impact, and mitigation plans under close guidance from senior team members.
Learns to identify internal opportunities to develop new programs and improve current ones. Learns to identify root problems (e.g., root-cause analysis), define the program strategy, gather program requirements, identify resource needs, create the project plan and targets, and work across teams to align on the plan of record. Begins to develop the expertise to improve operations of existing programs by helping applying industry methodology, define program issues, assess various scenarios, and select the optimal scenario to resolve issues.
Learns to work with cross-functional (e.g., organizational, product, business) stakeholders (e.g., Engineering, Marketing) to design programs from initiation to delivery. Learns to produce collateral (e.g., proposals, strategy walking deck, internal and external pitch content) to incorporate stakeholder needs and ensure the business objectives are met.
Learns how to track the success criteria and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]), such as quality, adoption, usage, impact, and effectiveness for the program.
Business Program Excellence and Execution

Learns to define and execute on landing and communication plans, such as the target audience(s) and communication strategy. Maintains the rhythm of business (ROB) during plan execution to ensure participants and stakeholders are communicating and responding according to the necessary cadence under close guidance from senior team members. Learns to work across teams (e.g., Landing, Design, Engineering, Supply Chain, Finance, Technical Program Management) to ensure all program requirements are understood and can be met.
Learns to evangelize the programs to stakeholders, partners, and customers to gain buy in. Leverages data and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]) to demonstrate the value of the program and show business impact under close guidance from senior team members. Learns to adapt communication style and storytelling strategy according to audience and business needs.
Business Program Management

Learns about project portfolios including the project plan, timelines, milestones, financial management, performance metrics, and resource needs for programs. Communicates the program status to relevant stakeholders and holds them accountable for following the established schedule, and risk mitigation plans and processes, under close guidance from senior team members.
Learns about mapping or how systems work and impact one another. Learns to work with other teams (e.g., Supply Chain, Engineering, Sales) to ensure program processes are executed efficiently.
Business Program Evaluation and Improvement

Learns to conduct cost-benefit analyses to examine performance to value drivers (e.g., profit and loss [P&L], return on investment [ROI]). Learns about monthly business review (MBR) and helps run rhythms regularly to identify what is working and what is not.
Learns to collect and evaluate success criteria and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]), such as acquisition, usage, impact, effectiveness, and customer feedback, and uses scorecards and dashboards to monitor programs and ensure all activities align with business and program objectives. Learns to use data analytics (e.g., scenario analyses) to derive insights and training that help identify program risks and mitigation plans, as well as opportunities to streamline and optimize programs based on lessons learned.
Demonstrates the skills needed to help ensure buy in and adoption of the new program or change by others in the organization. Learns to develop the collateral required to enable key stakeholders and others to be on board. Learns of the training, reskilling, and mapping of individuals conducted in partnership with Human Resources (HR).
Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

High School diploma/ GED or equivalent work experience
Fluent in French, France Ã¢Â?both written and spoken
Troubleshooting experience, customer service, or equivalent experience
Preferred Qualifications

BachelorÃ¢ÂÂs Degree or equivalent work experience
In depth knowledge of required language pitch, tones, rhythm, intent, etc.

description:
Ga jij met ons de uitdaging aan om richting onze collegaÃ¢ÂÂs de juiste service en continuÃÂ¯teit te garanderen van onze applicaties? In de rol van Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van gegevens om bedrijfsbeslissingen te ondersteunen en te organiseren in PowerBI.

Werken als Data Analist bij Broekman Logistics

Broekman Logistics is een logistiek dienstverlener die wereldwijd actief is op het gebied van Forwarding & Shipping, Warehousing & Distribution en Breakbulk Terminals (onze business units). Wij ontwikkelen creatieve logistieke totaaloplossingen voor onze bestaande en nieuwe klanten in een Business to Business markt. Dit alles met een personal touch!

Broekman Information Technology & Services (BIT), ons IT bedrijf, is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van alle ICT gerelateerde diensten aan de business units van Broekman Logistics. Binnen BIT zorgt de afdeling Business Applications & Data voor hoogwaardige en kennisintensieve applicatieondersteuning en het aanbieden van een data warehouse. Een groot onderdeel is het opzetten en onderhouden van het data warehouse. Daarvoor is er recent een data team opgericht met een data developer en een project manager. Ter versterking van ons team zijn wij op zoek naar een data analist, die zich zal focussen op het onderhoud van het data warehouse en het verzamelen, analyseren en organiseren van gegevens.

Jouw profiel als Data Analist

Als Data Analist ben je gepassioneerd voor het ontwerpen en verbeteren van data-gedreven oplossingen. Dit doe je voor de interne stakeholders, het management en onze klanten. Ook specificeer je waar nodig user stories. Je prioriteert en test de issues om de missie en doelen te behalen. Hiervoor werk je in Azure. Vanuit Azure wordt data uit meerdere bronnen ontsloten en beschikbaar gesteld aan PowerBI. Deze informatie breng jij (visueel) zo in kaart dat het voor alle stakeholders duidelijk en overzichtelijk is.

De Belangrijkste Verantwoordelijkheden Omvatten

Het verzamelen van gegevens uit verschillende bronnen, zoals databases en online bronnen;
Het organiseren van gegevens in een begrijpelijke en bruikbare indeling in PowerBI;
Het analyseren van gegevens met behulp van statistische methoden en tools;
Het interpreteren van gegevens en het identificeren van trends en patronen;
Het opstellen van rapporten en presentaties om bevindingen te communiceren aan het management en andere belanghebbenden;
Het aanbevelen van strategieÃÂ«n en acties op basis van de gegevensanalyse.
Vanuit de rol van data analist kan je doorgroeien naar data developer waarbij je verder kan zorgen voor het beschikbaar stellen en toetsen van de data.

Jouw profiel als Data Analist

Je bent iemand die energie krijgt van data om bedrijfsbeslissingen te ondersteunen.

Verder heb jeÃ¢Â?
Minimaal HBO niveau in de richting van IT;
Ervaring met Microsoft PowerBI en Azure. Ervaring met Azure Data Factory en SQL is een pre;
Kennis van zowel de Nederlandse als de Engelse taal (ook op IT technisch gebied).
Tot slot ben je in staat issues in te schatten op prioriteit en complexiteit en de juiste escalatieprocedure te volgen. Je hebt een klantvriendelijke, proactieve en resultaatgerichte instelling en bent daarbij analytisch sterk en probleemoplossend ingesteld.

Verder kijken?

Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met CornÃÂ© Rutten, Corporate Recruiter (06-83653194 of recruiter@werkenbijbroekmanlogistics.com).

CornÃÂ© Rutten +31 6 83 65 31 94

description:
Who are we?

We want to improve the lives of our patients. That is our daily mission. Our pride is our 2,500 employees who supply millions of people with important medicines every day. Health needs a healthy environment, we are convinced of this and, as an environmental pioneer in the German pharmaceutical industry, we are making our German sites climate-neutral in 2021. And that's not all: we are represented in over 80 countries worldwide, the market leader in generics, home to Germany's best-known drug brand ratiopharm, and a leading manufacturer of biopharmaceuticals. In total, we offer a broad range of approximately 700 products. These include innovative drugs, generics and over-the-counter medicines.

In short, we are Teva and we are very proud of it!

If you tick like us and are someone who enjoys breaking new ground - then we would like to get to know you. Are you also passionate about global markets and technologies? And would you like to revolutionize the future of healthcare at a leading provider of generics and biopharmaceuticals? Fantastic! Then why not become part of our team!

Curious? Then take a look HERE and see how it is working at Teva Ulm.

A day with us in quality control

In your new role as a QC Analyst / Laboratory Technician (m/f/d) Quality Control, you will be working in an international team of experts and will be responsible for testing raw materials, bulk and finished products according to currently valid guidelines (GMP quality standards) and perform independent analyses according to existing test methods.

You support laboratory processes and changes and take over the equipment responsibility of analytical instruments.

The maintenance of data systems (column database, reference database), support in the processing of deviations, OOS events and EHS measures as well as collaboration in project-related working groups are also part of your responsibilities.

Who We Are Looking For

You are

a reliable person with high team spirit and self-motivation.
solution-oriented and enjoy working with complex analytical equipment.
responsible, you distinguish yourself by your structured way of working and you like to work in a team.
accurate and have a proper operation style.

Ã¢Â?ready to seek your next long-term opportunity in Ulm, Germany.

Ã¢Â?ready to learn and develop yourself further in a growing organization.

Have you

successfully completed vocational training as a chemical laboratory technician*, CTA*, PTA*, laboratory assistant* or comparable education?

Ã¢Â?pursued a bachelor's or even master's degree in chemistry and see your entrance into the pharmaceutical industry via the quality control department?

experience in analytical laboratories?
good computer skills, SAP and/ or LIMS knowledge? (Equipment software in general would be an advantage)
good knowledge of English, both written and spoken?

What We Offer

At Teva

we take care of your health (among other things through a company health management system, a company doctor, physiotherapy, sports activities and a company canteen)
you have time for your family (through our own company kindergarten and holiday camps for school children, as well as 30 days of vacation)
you can develop your potential to the fullest (through a comprehensive virtual training program)
your achievements are valued accordingly (e.g. through recognition and Senior-Leaders-Programs, as well as various company events)
we think together with you about your future (e.g. through a company pension scheme)
we will provide you with relocation support to help you settle in

Function

Quality

Reports To

Group Leader Quality Control

Already Working @TEVA?

If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site

The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.

TevaÃ¢ÂÂs Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment

Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. description:
Your Main Activities Are

Ensure the Global Markets revenues are published in time on a daily basis, both for front office estimates and actual validated revenues
Challenge the data received by Middle Office to ensure consistency of the Global Markets scope
Contribute to the distribution of revenues reports to diverse interlocutors and provide analysis and qualitative explanation
Contribute to the monthly closing every end of month with several issuances of revenues that implies the respect of a tight calendar with multiple contributions
Active collaboration with other Finance departments (Reporting, Transfer Pricing, Accounting Controls) and Back-Office areas to ensure consistency and reconciliation of data
Partnering with the business managers to define qualitative commentaries of the performance of Global Markets and ensure management needs is reached

Profile And Skills To Success

Engineering or Business school, University Graduate, Finance Degree
Experience in Finance within the Banking sector including audit and consultancy firms
English | Advanced
Performance Management
Capital Market activities knowledge
Effective analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills and capacity to interact with senior management
Reactivity & pragmatism
Self-starter and team player, able to work independently and collaboratively with various teams in a deadline-focused environment
Excel (including VBA basics and core functions as Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, SUMIF) and Access

Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees Ã¢Â?including more than 145 000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

International reach

BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success.

Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the GroupÃ¢ÂÂs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

description:
Keyline is a family-owned business headquartered in Conegliano Veneto, Italy. The company is a leading manufacturer of keys, key cutting machines, transponders and smart access solutions with 160 employees globally. With 9 subsidiaries in 3 continents the company is present in approximately 70 countries.

Keyline is part of the Bianchi 1770 Group (ABG Holding) and has inherited the centuries of experience in the key industry that has been passed down through the family since 1770.

About the role:

This role is responsible for managing projects within the IT team, as well as the evolutionary maintenance of tools and processes already in use, in an international context.

What we are looking for:

We are looking for a highly motivated individual with passion for Business Intelligence and Data Analytics. This person must exhibit exceptional leadership and management abilities, enjoy working on a team, and demonstrate critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

What you'll do:

Design and implementation of corporate data strategy.
Implementation of the Data Warehouse & Business Intelligence architecture.
Identification, implementation and management of data integration needs between different company systems.
Work with all business departments to gather and meet information needs by developing decision support systems and valuable insights.
Defining and implementing Data Governance and Data Management rules that ensure compliance with policies and regulations and make it possible to ensure data quality and consistency between the various departments and company systems, maintaining an adequate level of access to data.
Manage Data Integration, Data Preparation and Data Modeling activities and implementation of Business Glossary and Data Catalog, Lineage and Metadata management solutions.

Knowledge, skills and abilities:

An understanding of business dynamics
Proficiency in the English language
Excellent reaction and interaction skills with colleagues
Excellent ability to analyze and listen, as well as a strong disposition to working in teams to accomplish outlined objectives
Flexibility, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Dynamism, marked leadership skills, and flexibility complete the profile

Minimum Qualifications:

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics
5+ years' experience in the data/analytics field in consulting firms or data-intensive companies.
Experience in Data Warehouse, Data Hub, Data Lake construction projects.
Experience with Cloud Data Warehouse (i.e. Snowflake)
Experience with SQL Oracle and MySql databases and NoSQL databases.
Experience with structured and semi-structured data and in relational and non-relational data modeling.
Experience with Data Visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik).

description:
Five9 provides businesses reliable, scalable, and secure cloud contact center software designed to create exceptional customer experiences, increase agent productivity, and deliver tangible business results.

We are driven by a passion to transform contact centers into customer engagement centers of excellence. Since 2001, Five9 has led the cloud revolution in contact centers, helping organizations transition from legacy premise-based solutions to the cloud.

We are looking for a Data Analystwho specialises in utilising the Looker data platform to create reports and visualisations. This role's main responsibility will be to develop robust, interactive, and visually engaging reports and visualisations to be integrated into our cloud solution for end users. They will also ensure data accuracy and system optimisation, contributing to the usability and efficiency of our end-user application.

Responsibilities

Develop, maintain, and improve data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, and dashboards using Looker.
Transform raw data into comprehensible visualisations and reports that will be served directly in our end user application.
Design and create engaging, user-friendly dashboards and data visualisations for our end user application.
Collaborate closely with the product team to ensure the alignment of the data visualisation with the end-user requirements.
Maintain data systems and databases, including fixing coding errors and other data-related problems.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting.
Optimize system performance to ensure efficient data processing and reporting.
Qualifications

BachelorÃ¢ÂÂs Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in a data analyst role, or a similar position, is required.
Proficiency with Looker is required.
Experience with SQL and other data manipulation languages.
Demonstrable experience with data visualisation and reporting.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Nice-to-have

Interest or experience in Data Engineering.
Familiarity with Google BigQuery.
Experience in data mining, data cleaning, and data management.
Previous experience in the Contact Center industry.
Benefits

Five9 Shares
Bonus Scheme
10% Flex Benefits
Meal Allowance
Medical Insurance
Life Insurance
25 day Annual Leave + Public Holidays
Five9 embraces diversity and is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.Ã¢Â?The more inclusive we are, the better we are.Ã¢Â?Five9 is an equal opportunity employer.

View our privacy policy https://www.five9.com/pt-pt/legal.

California residents, view our Privacy Notice here: https://www.five9.com/legal/candidatenoticeca.

Our headquarters are located in the San Francisco Bay Area with global hubs in the United Kingdom, Germany, Philippines, Portugal, and Australia.

In a context of quick growth and deep transformation, you will join the HR Monitoring team of the Group HR department. Developing and maintaining Dashboards to be shared with HR and business

description:
We are actually looking for a Data Analyst specialized in Genetic Analysis for a permanent full-time job.

The data analyst is responsible for analyzing large sets of data related to Corn and Sunflower breeding, providing insights, and developing bioinformatics and automated tools to improve crop breeding.

He will work closely with our R&D teams to provide data-driven insights that guide our breeding programs. The ideal candidate will have experience with genetic analysis, bioinformatics, and programming.

Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large molecular datasets related to Corn and Sunflower breeding.
Deliver comprehensive and timely data analysis results to support R&D departement.
Develop and implement automated tools and pipelines for data analysis and interpretation.
Contribute to develop bioinformatics tools
Provide data analytics expertise to R&D team.
Collaborate with R&D teams to provide data-driven insights on genetic traits and breeding strategies.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in genetic analysis and bioinformatics.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy.

description:
BayWa r.e.
ArabellastraÃÂe 4, 81925, Munich, Germany
Fulltime

At BayWa r.e.we r.e.think energy - how it is produced, stored and can be best used to enable the global renewable energy transition that is essential to the future of our planet. Based in 30 countries, BayWa r.e.is a leading global renewable energy developer, service provider, distributor and energy solutions provider. Operating throughout Europe, the Americas and Asia-Pacific, we are strategically investing in emerging markets around the world, actively shaping the future of energy and taking a stand against climate change. Embracing equity and diversity, we are committed to creating inclusive environments where everyone can reach their full potential. Every day, we are working hard to find new solutions, push technological boundaries and redefine service standards to make renewable energy even better.

About The Role

Due to our dynamic growth, we are currently looking for a Financial Analyst (m/f/d)to join our global Analytics & Business Intelligence Team and to support the group top management with financial planning decisions while playing a key role in enhancing our internal tools and procedures on business planning and valuation.

This position is preferably located in our companyÃ¢ÂÂs head office in Munich, keeping in mind that mobile working is part of our DNA.

What You Will Do

You will model, develop, update and own the groupÃ¢ÂÂs consolidated financial business plan, collaborating with the Business Entities, Treasury, and Finance and Controlling departments, working directly with BayWa r.e.Ã¢ÂÂs top management
You will present and discuss the results of the business plan modelling regularly at top management level
You will evaluate projects and business development activities around the globe in terms of cost and value, fostering best practices with models and analysis tools

Your Profile

You have 3-4 years of experience with financial modelling as an analyst at an auditing firm, a corporate finance consultancy or comparable position, preferably in renewable energy
You have an excellent degree in a numerical subject such as Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or similar with finance-related aspects
You have very strong MS Excel skills
You are a self-motivated and enthusiastic team player with a getting-things-done mindset, willing to provide support to all colleagues
You are proactive and committed to improve tools and innovate procedures
You are a good communicator and well-versed in conveying insights to top management
Your very structured way of working, strong reasoning skills and good command of English complete your profile

What We Offer You

Mobile working
Flexible working hours
Modern office atmosphere
Company restaurant / Barista bar
Discounted Conditions Fitness
Discounted Online Shopping
Smartphone, also for private use
JobRad

Contact

We look forward to your application!

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion matter to us

At BayWa r.e. we cherish the diversity of our people and are dedicated to providing an inclusive environment of mutual respect. We aim to create equal opportunities for all applicants and colleagues.

We welcome everyone and do not discriminate based on origin, religion, social, cultural, or ethnic background, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

If you have any questions about the job offer, please get in contact with us.

Yasmine Haroun
International Recruiter

description:
BNP Paribas EMEA Finance employs 500 employees, of which more than 325 are based in Madrid. We manage more than 250 BNP Paribas entities from all over Europe, covering +60% of GroupÃ¢ÂÂs balance sheet and all groupÃ¢ÂÂs banking activities (Corporate & Investment Banking, Retail Banking, Personal Finance and other financial services activitiesÃ¢Â?.

Our mission is to measure, control and explain all the financial indicators required to monitor accounting, tax, regulatory, liquidity, credit risk reporting and management result activities.

Mission

Client Performance Management teamis responsible of monitoring and consolidating figures from all Business Lines (CIB and Retail Banking & Services) at client level in order to generate Coverage reports, special reports for due diligence and mÃÂ©tiers teams, and even a full recap of the total revenues situation for Top Management.

Responsibilities

Ensure global consolidation and analysis of Management Accounting figures by clients (worldwide view) as well as other KPIÃ¢ÂÂs (CVC, RAROC) in line with BNP Paribas standards.
Provide CIB Management and Group Finance with an in-depth analysis of CIB and Non CIB data (explanation of variations, normalization of the results to isolate one-off items) in order for the Group to communicate adequately monthly and quarterly results and for CIB Management and Coverage community to take strategic decisions of 3 Regions.
Elaborate and delivery on time the reports to Group Finance, CIB Management and Coverage members.
Perform a central reconciliation between Client and Business Lines reported figures.
Analyze and understand the results reported by the local/regional finance departments in order to ensure the quality and completeness of the data published in our Coverage reports.
Contribution to various studies to support business monitoring and decision making: ad-hoc analysis, reporting reengineering, specific projects related to clients scope, etc.
Coordinate Actual / Forecast / Budget reporting for the 3 Regions, prepare instructions, define timelines and ensure efficiency of the data chain process.
Projects, Systems Support, Operational Process Improvements

Requirements

University degree in finance & accounting, economics or comparable background
Experience: 0-2 years of experience in a Banking/Accounting/Finance/Audit environment is mandatory
Languages: ENGLISH C1

Skills

Attention to detail/rigour
Ability to synthetize/simplify
Ability to deliver/Results driven

Benefits

Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%)
31 vacation days"

Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

description:
Ben jij (bijna) klaar met je studie, heb jij een passie voor werken met data en ben je klaar voor een vliegende start van je carriÃÂ¨re? Lees dan snel verder!

Als data specialist ben jij bezig met het verzamelen, verwerken en controleren van data. Je hoeft hier nog geen ervaring in te hebben, want wij leiden jou, betaald, op tot data analist! Dit doen we door je een opleiding aan te bieden, maar ook een plek om te werken zodat je jouw geleerde kennis direct in de praktijk kan uitoefenen. Je wordt vanaf dag 1 betaald!

Tijdens deze training word jij opgeleid tot volledig professional. Je behaalt erkende certificaten die goed staan op je cv. Binnen dit opleidingstraject zal je in ongeveer 1 maand klaargestoomd worden om aan de slag te gaan als data specialist. Je krijgt de kans om alsyoung professionalgedetacheerd te worden bij verschillende internationale partijen.

Wat Breng Je Mee

Een (bijna) afgeronde MBO niveau 4 of hbo-opleiding
Je bent initiatiefrijk, communicatief vaardig, analytisch en flexibel ingesteld
Je hebt een ''hands-on'' mentaliteit
Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Wat Bieden Wij

Je komt terecht in een warme, hechte en gezellige organisatie. Er is veel ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en we zullen je blijven uitdagen om het beste uit jezelf te halen. Verder bieden wij jou:

Elke maand een gezellige borrel met alle data analisten die via Walters People werken
Vanaf dag 1 een salaris tussen de 2500 - 3000,- bruto per maand obv 40 uur
Betaalde opleiding
25 vakantiedagen
8% vakantiegeldtoeslag
Een goede pensioenregeling
Reiskostenvergoeding
Startdatum Traineeship

Je krijgt bij je start direct een contract, daarom starten de traineeships altijd de eerste van de maand. De volgende startdata's zijn nog mogelijk;

1 juli 2023
1 augustus 2023
1 september 2023
1 oktober 2023
1 november 2023
Hoe werkt de procedure?

Via de button op deze pagina kan je je aanmelden. Heb je jouw cv niet bij de hand, dan komt deze later wel! Na het aanmelden bellen we met je en nodigen wij je graag uit bij ons op kantoor.

ENGLISH BELOW

Hummingbird Technologies and Agreena are seeking part-time agricultural data collection contractors across Lithuania to help with in-field data collection as part of ongoing sustainability projects tracking regenerative agricultural practices in agrifood supply chains.

Responsibilities:

Travelling to local designated areas of interest and collecting information including which crop is being grown and the level of farming intensity

Following a simple protocol to document the required type data per field

Logging the information for each field on a mobile device using an easy to use app.

Contact with the farmers is not required as the data is collected from the roadside

Uploading data daily.

Requirements:

Travel may be required to farms in your assigned region, which will be determined based on your geographic location

An iPhone/Android phone or tablet to run our data collection app

A valid driverÃ¢ÂÂs licence

Your own car to travel to the assigned location

Experience working in agriculture to a level where you can reliably and confidently identify major crops and the type and intensity of tillage performed.

Timeline:

This work will take place from January 2022 to May 2023

The work is flexible to your schedule as you choose the number of hours and when you work but a minimum of 8 hours per week availability is preferred

Salary:

Employment is contract based

Payment will be made per data point collected

The average payment for a full day of data collection (8 hours collecting) is 100-150 Euro plus the expenses listed below:

Lunch is covered at a rate of 6 Euro per full 8 hour day

Mileage is covered at a set rate for EU countries at 0.23 Euro per Km

If you would like to be part of this exciting project with the ultimate goal of rewarding farmers for regenerative and sustainable agricultural practices then please either apply via LinkedIn or send your CV to data-operations@agreena.com
