description:
Sportnco Group is one of the leading sports betting and gaming solutions providers in the online gambling industry. We focus on producing the best iGaming & Sports Betting solutions for our clients so that they can grow and develop across regulated markets worldwide. Now, Sportnco belongs to the GIG group. Gaming Innovation Group is a leading iGaming & Sports Betting technology company, providing solutions, products, and services to Sports Betting & iGaming Operators. Founded in 2012, GiG operates out of Malta and is dual listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol GIG and on Nasdaq Stockholm under the ticker symbol GIGSEK.

We are passionate about our work, and we have pleasure in making our work our great passion, proud of our great collaborative culture and work environment. We are looking for professionals who are eager to learn and work as a team, committed and positive, to join our multidisciplinary team. To support this strong growth which continues into 2023, SPORTNCO is hiring to grow.

We are looking for a QA Analyst to strengthen our established product team

Main responsibilities:

Contribute to the definition and implementation of full functional testing strategies and plans on all Sportnco's projects including new deliveries and product development
Functional / User-Acceptance Testing on all Sportnco's projects to ensure quality and conformity of deliverables with requirements
Work closely with product owners to contribute to and challenge features and user stories
Report and track defects & fixes in close collaboration with the rest of the Sportsbook development team
QA sign off on all releases
Other duties:

Continuous platforms' monitoring to identify improvements proposition and bug reporting
Permanent technology and best-practices intelligence
Client operational support when required
Required skills:

Previous experience as QA analyst within an Agile environment is a big plus
Rigor and great personal management
Excellent communication skill
Knowledge in SDLC & projects management softwares (JIRA Software and Service Desk)
Team player, with ability to work autonomously
Ability to share knowledge
Knowledge of the online gambling industry, and more specifically sports betting, is a big plus
Fluent English is a must, Spanish is a plus
linkedin_skills: Bug Tracking, Acceptance Testing, Quality Assurance, Communication, User Stories, Test Cases, Software Testing, Quality Control, Functional Testing, and Software Quality Assurance

description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced QC Analyst to join a global pharmaceutical company based in Cork. If you are a highly motivated QC Analyst with a passion for ensuring product quality and compliance in the global pharmaceutical industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Responsibilities

Testing, review and disposition of pharmaceutical DSs, Intermediates, cleaning samples, investigatory samples, In Process Control (IPC) samples and/or raw materials in accordance with Corporate procedures and in compliance with the current GMP standards.
Carry out testing of DSs, Intermediates, cleaning samples, investigatory samples, cleanrooms, IPC samples and/or raw materials in accordance with the valid testing procedures and regulatory requirements.
Ensure that laboratory equipment is well maintained and calibrations are performed at the designated frequencies.
Review results generated by other analysts for compliance with requirements.
Ensure correct data entry to the current Laboratory Information Management System - SAP
Carry out method transfers and participate in the validation of analytical test methods as required.
Write and maintain necessary documentation (test protocols, SOPs, instrumentation manuals and templates / checkout sheets, method transfer reports, OOS reports, etc) according to the existing SOPs and cGMP standards.

Requirements

BSc in Scientific discipline
1-2 years minimum work experience in the pharmaceutical industry
Preferable to have experience in analytical testing techniques such as (HPLC, GC, UV, wet chemistry, dissolution, etc.)
Professional requirements: familiarity with current Good Manufacturing Practices and sound knowledge of analytical technologies.
linkedin_skills: Dissolution, Method Transfer, Titration, Karl Fischer Titration, High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC), Gas Chromatography, and Wet Chemistry
Portuguese, Arabic, Communication, and Customer Service

description:
The Role

We are looking to recruit a Data Analyst. In this role you will undertake data analysis to help ensure our customers are playing sustainably and in a safe environment.

You will support initiatives related to fraud prevention, AML, KYC, detecting early signs of problematic gambling and optimising the effectiveness of our responsible gambling tools and processes.

At Kindred we see challenges as an opportunity to do something in a better way, both personally and professionally. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to society.

Kindred's ambition is to reach 0% revenue from harmful gambling by 2023. Our success is built on trust; we trust each other to deliver on our promises and believe giving ownership and responsibility at all levels is the way to make the right choices for Kindred and our customers.

What You Will Do

Undertake ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Deliver actionable insights to inform data driven decisions.
Liaise with stakeholders to understand business goals and identify analysis projects that support these goals.
Communicate findings of analysis throughout the business.
Assist Senior Data Analysts with the delivery of larger complex projects.
Improve constantly on your technical & soft skills.

Your Experience

A record of turning data insights into actionable solutions.
Experience with SQL, R, Python, or similar.
Experience of data analysis in a high data volume business.
Knowledge of fraud prevention, AML, or responsible gambling would be an advantage.
Degree preferred in computer science, statistics, economics, or other math/science related field.

We are also looking for someone that:

is solution oriented, curious, humble, and resilient.
has strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
has meticulous attention to detail.
has a strong work ethic.
has excellent interpersonal skills.

What do we offer?

Ã°ÂÂÂ« 24 days paid vacation plus bank holidays.

Ã°ÂÂÂ Employee share plan.

description:
About us:

Amach Software is an industry-leading technology driven company with headquarters located in Dublin and remote teams in UK and Europe.

Our blended teams of local and nearshore talent are optimised to deliver a cost efficient, high quality and collaborative solution.

Established in 2013, we specialise in digital transformation including agile software development, DevOps, automation, cloud consulting, data and machine learning.

We are seeking a highly motivated and data-driven individual to join our customer's Global Contact Centre team. You will be reporting into the Data & Insights Manager and play a critical role in driving business decisions through data analysis, visualisations and insights.

Please note this is a 4-month contract.

Required Skills:

2+ years of experience in a data analysis role, with a focus on customer experience
Strong SQL and/or Python skills (Python desired, but not required), with a proven ability to manipulate large datasets
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or QlikView
Strong analytical skills, with a passion for solving complex problems through data
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations and proven strength in storytelling with data

Desirable skills:

A passion for improving customer experience and driving business outcomes
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics or proven background in the area of data analysis or similar field
Knowledge of AWS Connect system beneficial

Key responsibilities & duties include:

Utilise SQL and/or Python to extract, clean and analyse large datasets from various sources
Design, develop and implement data visualisations to effectively communicate complex data insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key business questions and provide actionable insights to support decision making
Monitor and analyse key performance metrics to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for improvement
Develop and maintain data dashboards, reports and tools to enable self-service analytics
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis and visualisation techniques and tools to continuously improve data insights

What's in it for you:

An opportunity to join a fast-growing company
Options for career advancement
Learning and development opportunities
Flexible working environment
Competitive rates based on experience

Not for you?

Check out all of our open positions in our careers pageand follow us on LinkedInand Twitterfor future opportunities.

P.S. Share this with friends and co-workers! Don't be afraid they'll steal it from you, if you're amazing and smart we'll find a role for you. We are growing fast and are always looking for talented people.

At Amach, we strive to be an inclusive community of open-minded individuals with different backgrounds and we are committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion. We strongly believe that a diversity of experience and background is essential to create a fulfilling environment and better solutions for our people and our customers. All Amach employees and contractors are expected to honour this policy and act to ensure that every individual is respected in the workplace.

description:
Radisson Hotel Group is one of the world's largest hotel groups with nine distinctive hotel brands, and more than 1,600 hotels in operation and under development in 120 countries. The GroupÃ¢ÂÂs overarching brand promise is Every Moment Matters with a signature Yes I Can! service ethos.

People are at the core of our business success and future. Our people are true Moment Makers and together we bring the culture, spirit, environment, and opportunities that empower you to be your best, every day, everywhere, every time. Together, we make Every Moment Matter.

DESCRIPTION:

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play an instrumental role to deliver meaningful business insights to various business groups within Radisson. You will support the business partner and develop a good understanding of business needs and business objectives and define appropriate ways to turn data into actionable insights.

Supported by the rest of the Business Intelligence function, you will support business stakeholders by doing detailed analysis, deliver initial insights and design/develop PowerBI reports and dashboards.

This position will report to the BI Business Partners and will work closely with the key members of the business areas.

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create and deliver insights to end-users, with a strong focus on actionable data.
Support the BI Business Partner and develop a deep understanding of various business functions. Identify how data can provide actionable answers to key business questions.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and use storytelling techniques to showcase prototypes and demonstrate possibilities.
Implement data reporting solutions, including creating and maintaining BI reports and dashboards, improving data quality and automation, and prototyping new reports and BI solutions.
Ensure the correct implementation of the corporate BI strategy.
Provide coaching and training to end-users on the effective use of BI tools.

REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a similar position.
Extensive expertise in developing reports in Power BI, including visual design, data transformations, and optimizations.
Knowledge of database concepts, relational databases (e.g., Azure Synapse, MySQL, SQL Server), and data exploitation techniques (including SQL).
Background and/or experience in predictive modeling and (descriptive) machine learning on the Microsoft stack is desired but not mandatory. Familiarity with other Microsoft Power Platform applications is a plus.
Proficiency in data analysis and data management, including business requirement engineering and basic project management.
English proficiency. Fluency in Spanish is an advantage.

"Radisson Hotel Group is a leading hospitality company serving as a true host and best partner to guests, owners, business partners and talent. Our eight unique hotel brands offer award-winning and exceptional hotel experiences, originating from our strong Scandinavian heritage of design and innovation. Our brands embody our modern vision of hospitality, including authentic local tastes, stylish living design, unique locations and vibrant social scenes.

Radisson Hotel Group brings a refreshed commitment to hospitality leadership to meet the changing travel industry and the bespoke needs of our guests. We provide exceptional service in all of our hotels across the globe and strive to deliver a hospitality experience that is beyond guest expectations."

CAREERS

Join us in our mission to make every moment matter for our guests and be part of the most inspired hotel company in the world. At Radisson Hotel Group we believe that people are our number one asset. As one of the worldÃ¢ÂÂs largest hotel companies, we are always looking for great people to join our team. If this sounds like an ambition you share, then start with us.

To find out more about the Radisson Hotel Group, our Culture and Beliefs, then why not visit us at careers.radissonhotels.com.

Skills

Excellent Communication Skills

Building Relationships

Strategic Thinker

Change Management

By applying you confirm you have these skills.

description:
Van leuk werk, komt goed werk!

Whooz is onbetwist marktleider en dat willen we graag blijven. Onze medewerkers hebben veel kennis en ervaring, zijn innovatief, hebben grote ambities en vooral veel plezier. Ons team bestaat uit enthousiaste medewerkers, die met elkaar zorgen dat we onze klanten nÃÂ³g beter, efficiÃÂ«nter en daadkrachtiger kunnen helpen met het bereiken van hun doelen.

Whooz koestert een informele en nieuwsgierige cultuur waar mensen oprecht blij worden van data. Van leuk werk, komt goed werk, nietwaar? En als dit werk tot nieuwe toepasbare inzichten leidt, worden we al helemaal vrolijk. Dat verveelt nooit en dat merken we elke dag.

Puzzelen met data
De toepassing staat voorop
Zelfstandig in een team
Jezelf ontwikkelen door onze dienstverlening te ontwikkelen
Eigenwijs
Hybride werken
#WhoozLovingData

DATA ANALIST Ã¢Â?startersfunctie

Kom jij net van hogeschool of universiteit en heb je zin om in de praktijk echt met data aan de slag te gaan, dan hebben we voor jou de juiste functie! Bij Whooz helpen we in een team met specialisten elke dag onze klanten om met data antwoorden te geven op marketing- en locatievraagstukken.

Dus puzzel jij graag met veel data en creÃÂ«er je graag waarde voor onze klanten door data om te zetten naar inzichten? Dan ben jij wellicht degene die we zoeken.

Wat we bieden is een mooie functie waarbij je data bewerkt en analyseert om vervolgens waardevolle inzichten te creÃÂ«ren voor onze klanten. Niet de data, de tool of de methodologie staat voorop, maar de toepassing van de klant! Stap voor stap begeleiden we jou op een informele manier, zodat je leert hoe jouw analytische skills waarde brengen aan de hand van concrete vraagstukken binnen klantanalyse, -werving en -behoud.

Al snel voer je in het team van analisten zelfstandig en in teamverband analyses uit voor onze opdrachtgevers. Daarnaast doe je dataleveringen aan licentieklanten en ondersteun je onze klanten in het vinden van waarde in data. Je bent nauwkeurig en analytisch en vindt het leuk om concreet aan de slag te zijn met data en klanten.

We snappen dat je wellicht nog niet 100% weet wat je wil voor de rest van de carriÃÂ¨re en daarom is er binnen Whooz altijd ruimte om aan de hand van je interesse en/of nieuwe vragen uit de markt nieuwe technieken te proberen en nieuwe toepassingen te ontwikkelen. Bijvoorbeeld door een nieuwe manier en/of vorm te bedenken waarop we inzichten generen voor onze klanten of door mee te werken aan de ontwikkeling van een nieuw product.

Het allerbelangrijkste voor ons is dat je echt enthousiast wordt van data en analyses en dat je altijd nieuwsgierig bent naar nieuwe inzichten. Aangezien veel van onze klanten werken in het marketingveld is het fijn als je affiniteit hebt met (online) marketingtoepassingen. Vanzelfsprekend ben je veel met data in de weer, maar je schroomt niet om aan de klant je gevonden inzichten te presenteren, je advies toe te lichten en proactief met hem mee te denken.

Wat bieden we

Onze medewerkers vinden het fijn dat er een informele sfeer en open cultuur heerst binnen Whooz, waarbij we binnen het team samen de klant helpen en onze doelen behalen. Ook is er altijd ruimte voor eigen inzicht en ideeÃÂ«n. Ben je een beetje eigenwijs? Helemaal goed want dat zijn wij ook. We bieden een marktconform salaris en bieden je ruimte om je binnen je werk te ontwikkelen. De meeste dagen werken we met elkaar op ons ruime kantoor nabij het centrum van Den Haag, maar er is zeker ook ruimte en flexibiliteit om een deel van de dagen thuis te werken.

Functie-eisen

Naast dat iemand met HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau zoeken, vinden we het belangrijkste voor deze functie is, dat je iedere keer weer enthousiast wordt van data en analyses en de mogelijkheden die deze bieden voor organisaties. Vanzelfsprekend is het wenselijk dat je beschikt over analytische vaardigheden (statistiek, clustering, modellering, dashboarding) en datamanagement vaardigheden (dataprocessen inrichten en runnen). Kennis van het toepassen van technieken, zoals web scraping en artificiÃÂ«le intelligentie, voor het verzamelen en genereren van data is een prÃÂ©. Je bent daarnaast servicegericht, professioneel, zelfbewust, communicatief vaardig en kunt zelfstandig, maar ook samen werken. Voor communicatie met onze klanten is een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal een must.

Ben jij de oplossingsgerichte dataliefhebber die wij zoeken? Neem dan contact met ons op. Je kunt je motivatie en CV sturen naar info@whooz.nl t.a.v. Peter.

We zien bij Whooz absoluut de toegevoegde waarde van recruiters in sommige wervingstrajecten. Acquisitie en benadering door recruiters op basis van deze vacature wordt echter niet op prijs gesteld!

description:
Meet the CFO & EV Enterprise Analytics Team

A new era of digital transformation is being driven by the emergence of cutting-edge technologies. Companies use data analytics to accelerate their operations, make better decisions and provide higher quality service to their customers. To leverage the potential of data and maximize the benefits of a data-driven strategy, companies are looking for experts that are ready to define new standards and guide them towards success. That is where the Enterprise Analytics practice at Accenture comes in. We combine data analytics and strategy consulting as part of a single agenda which helps our clients solve complex problems, discover new opportunities and thrive in todayÃ¢ÂÂs global business environment.

What will you do?

Although no two days at Accenture are the same, as a Data & Analytics Analystin our CFO&EV Enterprise Analytics practice, typical tasks will include:

Design and development of cutting-edge, innovative, powerful reporting and analytics solutions

Advise on state-of-the-art reporting, including preparation of proof of concepts

Work directly with clients to gather specifications for data and report requirements

Effectively translate end-user reporting requirements into functional design documents

Explore large datasets, execute data preparation and data blending procedures, and create data models/sets, reports and dashboards

Improvement of existing solutions to ensure consistency and cohesiveness across all data analytics applications

Participate in strategic cross-domain projects that require analytics and business acumen

Participate in large-scale digital transformation programs working with international teams and collaborating with the brightest minds across many industries.

Who and what we are looking for?

Minimum bachelorÃ¢ÂÂs degree preferably in finance and/or computer science

Sound knowledge of financial controlling aspects, enterprise performance management and financial analytics

Working knowledge in the area of SAP

Familiarity with design and implementation of reporting & analytics solutions

Familiarity and/or willingness to work with modern, market-leading technologies: SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP BW, SAP S/4HANA

Data savvy, ability to integrate data to create new insights

Problem-solving and out-of-the-box thinking ability, directed at defining innovative solutions

Strong communication skills: ability to explain solutions verbally and in writing

English at professional level, additional proficiency in German or French is highly welcomed.

Working Conditions:

Employment contract (Umowa o pracÃÂ)

Headquarter in Warsaw with offices in Cracow, Wroclaw or Lodz.

Due to COVID-19 global situation we are delivering our work remotely. Knowing that our Capability Network model is based on traveling and serving advisory working closely with our Clients, willingness and ability to work at clientÃ¢ÂÂs locations mostly across Europe, but also other locations, for short or long term is still required if pandemic situation will change.

What we offer:

Challenging job in a dynamic, professional, international and multicultural environment

Opportunity to gain exceptional on Polish market, skills, knowledge and experience gained on large scale international projects

The unique chance to work in a global network using only state-of-the-art tools and technologies

One of a kind experience with best know-how, with broad access to certifications and professional industry-recognized trainings.

Very attractive and competitive salary as well as a well-defined career path shaped to the individuals career focus & priorities

Attractive benefits package: Remote/Hybrid way of work, Cafeteria System, Multisport card, Lunch card, Private medical care, Employee Assistance Program, 100% paid sick leave, AMEX Gold Card, Lounge Club Priority Pass, Life insurance, Employee referral program and much moreÃ¢Â?
If this sounds like the ideal role, career, and company for you, please apply online as soon as possible.

Accentureis a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.

We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.

Ã¢ÂÂAcross the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.Ã¢Â?Ã¢Â?Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO

Capability Networkis a Global Strategy & Consulting practice, pulling together multinational and cross-cultural professionals based at key locations around the world. No matter what business, no matter where in the world, our unrivaled industry and function experts help our Clients to shape the future creating clearly defined, measurable value. We are delivering on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Our Poland Capability Network is located in Warsaw, Krakow, Wroclaw, Lodz. Your impact will be truly global as you will leverage an unmatched network of people, knowledge, tools and technologies and work alongside some of the best thinkers in the market.

Ã¢ÂÂJoin our world class capabilities and experience unique opportunities to grow your skills with us.Ã¢Â?Ã¢Â?MaÃÂgorzata NasiÃÂowska, Accenture Capability Network Lead for Poland

description:
About PSC Biotech

Who we are?

PSC Biotech is a leading Biotech Consultancy firm founded in 1996, headquartered in Pomona, California, USA, with Global operations in Ireland, India, Singapore, Australia and the US, serving 350 clients in more than 23 countries worldwide. We provide cloud-based software solutions for Quality Management and Regulatory Inspections, pharmaceuticals contract manufacturing professionals, and metrology services to our clients.

Ã¢ÂÂTake your Career to a new LevelÃ¢Â?
PSC Biotech disrupts the conventional consultancy model by aligning our EVP as one of the unique selling point which includes the opportunity to work with the most talented cohort of like-minded professionals operating in the Pharma/ Biotech Industry. We offer a permanent contract of employment giving exposure of working in Top Pharmaceutical client sites in a diverse-cultural work setting.

Employee Value Proposition

Employees are the Ã¢ÂÂheartbeatÃ¢Â?of PSC Biotech, we provide unparalleled empowering career development though Learning & Development in-house training mentorship through constant guidance to facilitate career progression. We believe in creating high performing teams that can exceed our clientÃ¢ÂÂs expectations with regards to quality of all scalable and business unit deliverables, staying under budget and ensuring timelines for our deliverables are being met.

Responsibilities:

Support the group genotyping operations through timely and accurate completion of assigned data analysis projects.
Clean, transform or model data using appropriate software for analysis and report generation.
Carry out livestock breed, traceability, parentage and other relationship analysis testing using molecular genotyping data.
Perform meat DNA traceability using bespoke DNA traceback system.
Interpret data and analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in the datasets.
Follow standard operating procedures, to perform quality control review of the data.
Help form part of the design and implementation of new programs and processes across the business as required.
Leverage prior analysis and programming experience to locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Participate in code review and program testing for existing and new processes.
Communicate progress and non-conformities to line management.
Resolve problems by examining and evaluating data; selecting corrective steps.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.
Enhance laboratory and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to the role.
Perform other technical duties appropriate to the role as assigned by the Division Head.
Report any Health and Safety issues.
Adhere to ISO 17025 requirements.
Other duties as required.

Requirements

Experience, Knowledge and Skills:

Technically focused with strong analytical and quantitative aptitude.
Experience in molecular biology.
Knowledge of statistics and technical expertise in data analysis methodologies.
Detailed functional knowledge and expertise of data collection methods, data analysis, data integrity, and report preparation.
Demonstrated knowledge in MS Excel and R / Python programming.
Experience with dashboard report building (Power BI / Tableau) an advantage
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to compare data outcomes for concordance and perform quality assurance.
Familiar with working in a quality assured environment.
Ability to work independently, under pressure and to tight deadlines.
Ability to take ownership and responsibility.
Familiarity with ISO quality systems.
Good time management skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English

Qualifications:

Masters Degree in Biological/Computer science or Engineering.

description:
Together let's make ITALY great again, my client is seeking a highly motivated Renewable Financial Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for renewable energy and a strong background in financial analysis.

About Company: Italian Developer, already operating for close to 3 years they have very ambitious growth plans, only apply if you want to be challenged and make a real change!

The ideal candidate should be passionate about finance, technology, innovation and renewables as a whole, to help make the

'switch' for a more sustainable future and longer lasting planet.

The Role

Our finance team is looking for a highly motivated financial analyst who has interest in joining a high performing team to drive company forward on its journey to a clean energy future. The individual will be responsible for supporting project finance and conducting financial analyses of all projects.

Develop financial models and providing financial forecasts
Be responsible for the project finance model and ad hoc amendments
Prepare monthly financial reports that monitor cash flow, identify trends in spending
Analyse project costs and preparing estimates for new projects
Work with management to develop budgets and forecast future revenue and expenses
Report to and work closely with the CFO
Work closely with the Development team
Assess and report on project returns and profitability
Maintain transaction data books for projects
Verify project inputs in financial models with the Development team and analysis of market conditions
Help prepare presentations at key milestones in project lifecycle
Provide analytical support to various groups internally
Closely follow industry trends and competitors
Other ad-hoc tasks as they arise

Requirements

Excellent knowledge of Excel and proven ability to navigate and manipulate Excel based financial models
Experience with statistical analysis and financial forecasting
Attention to detail and the ability to identify data patterns
Good verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of renewable energy or energy project finance (a plus)
Knowledge of Excel (required) and VBA coding (a plus)
Able to work autonomously and as part of a team
Fluent in English, proficient in Italian

Qualifications/Experience

Bachelor's degree, ideally in finance or a quantitative field
Proven experience in similar role
Understanding of principles of finance

Location:Milan

Salary:ÃÂ£30,000 TO ÃÂ£40,000 euros per annum

This is a great opportunity to join an expanding business in the renewable energy sector in a strategically important position for the company

If like me you feel passionately about the fight for climate change and moving towards a zero-carbon world then reach out to me: d.ogunsola@ewi-group.com

ewi is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. ewi is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

description:
Why SoftwareOne?

About Goatpath

Goatpath is SoftwareONEÃ¢ÂÂs software team that builds platforms and products to automate and govern customersÃ¢Â?software and cloud investments through intuitive products they love to use. We are humble, nimble, focused, always ready to do whatÃ¢ÂÂs right, not afraid to take the toughest and unmarked path Ã¢Â?this is what Goatpath stands for. Within Goatpath there are currently four product groups: Marketplace, Cloud, Digital and Insights. Marketplace aims to redefine/revolutionize how software is bought, managed, and sold, while Cloud seeks to build the most simple and intelligent cloud management platform. Insights will allow customers to benchmark their maturity in the space of spend and technology, while Digital will revolutionize how customers will interact with SoftwareONE. All products are built on a shared platform.

The role

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer with experience in SQL, ETL pipelines and data warehousing. The ideal candidate should have a very strong ability in data modelling and be comfortable working with large and varied data sets. They should be able to create secure and flexible systems and model data for output through a variety of means including the use of report visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop data models for business intelligence and analytics
Build and maintain ETL pipelines and data warehousing solutions
Source, manage and integrate data from SQL and NoSQL databases, APIs, and other sources
Work with large and varied data sets, including structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data
Develop and maintain secure and flexible OLAP systems for analysis & self-serve reporting
Design and implement data visualizations and dashboards using tools like Power BI
Optimize data processing code for performance and reliability
Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to provide high-quality data for analysis and decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation, cleansing and enrichment processes.

What We Need To See From You

Experience in data engineering/business intelligence development, with a proven track record of designing and implementing data pipelines and data storage solutions.
Advanced knowledge of Azure, including Databricks, Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL.
Familiarity with NoSQL technologies like MongoDB or CosmosDB.
Knowledge of data governance, data security, and regulatory compliance.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python, R, or C# is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Being part of SoftwareONE means we live and breathe our companyÃ¢ÂÂs core values, most of all Ã¢ÂÂCustomer FocusÃ¢Â?and Ã¢ÂÂSpeedÃ¢Â? But being part of the Goatpath team is a little more than that. Every single day we ask ourselves and our team members to:

Be curious, try things out! If you fail, thatÃ¢ÂÂs ok Ã¢Â?we donÃ¢ÂÂt blame
Embrace change and start with Ã¢ÂÂwhy not?Ã¢Â?instead of Ã¢ÂÂwhy?Ã¢Â?Prioritize good over perfect Ã¢Â?donÃ¢ÂÂt withhold customers from functionality
Leave the ego and office politics at the door
Take ownership
Ã¢Â?. and have fun!

Job Function

Goatpath

Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The Future Is What We Make It.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our Global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

By changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Make the Best You.

Working at Honeywell is not just about developing cool things. All our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Join us and Make an Impact.

We have an opportunity for a Finance Analyst to join our CORPteam in Bucharest.As Senior financial analyst you shall be a valuable business partner, ensuring value creation and support the PPE GBE.

Finance Analyst Responsibilities

Drive, review and back up for month close processes by ensuring the entityÃ¢ÂÂs financial transactions are properly accounted for and correctly reported through HFM on a US GAAP basis, in accordance with Honeywell accounting policies.; f.e. monthly accruals, booking and reconciliation of sales between HSPE and Commissioner, allocation by LOB in HSPE and reconcile with COGS commissioner, timely preparation of Journal Vouchers, determine and submit I/C recharges, follow-up and drive resolution of any issues related to month close activities.
Partnership with Controllership and COTA to ensure operational efficiencies and transparency and timing of financial results.

Understand any balance sheet exposures and ensure inclusion in forecasts and outlooks

Owns and maintain the SOP (standard Operating Procedures) for the Country activities
Other accounting and finance duties where required; f.e. provide codding to AP team for external/I/C invoices, liaise with COTA / Controllership / Regional and global Finance Centre
Producing reports that enable continuous measurement and optimization of all key aspects of the business
Proactively identifying, communicating, and reporting P&L and balance sheet exposure mattersParticipate in the AOP/Forecast cycles
Partner with SBG Controllers to address in-country legal entity change management needs, including acquisitions, divestitures, site closures and core business processes migrations.

Fluent English writing & speaking skills required

description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Truecaller transformed how we communicate when we launched in 2009 in Stockholm, Sweden.

Our mission is to build trust everywhere by making tomorrow's communication smarter, safer and more efficient. We focus on bringing smart services with big social impacts, like protecting people from fraud, harassment, and scam calls or messages. We identify new numbers from anywhere in the world and build a space for trustworthy conversations, for those that matter. Truecaller is loved by over 350 million people around the world and is growing very rapidly across regions.

Who we are:

The world's #1 caller ID and spam blocking service for Android and iOS.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities, spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, Tel Aviv and Nairobi.
Listed On Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap

We at the Cloud Telephony team,are on a mission to enable AI-powered communication solutions for consumers and businesses through the Truecaller platform. The team will focus on creating cutting-edge cloud telephony solutions for consumers. The features the team will develop will affect the experience of hundreds of millions of users around the world directly, and will improve their daily interaction with their phone.

As a Data Analystin the Cloud telephony team, you will build the dashboards which the team uses to analyze how the users are utilizing the Assistant feature.

What Do We Expect From You

4+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis (experience working for a Product oriented company is a plus)
Expertise in data visualization tools, such as Google Data Studio, Looker, QlikSens,Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Experience using SQL to extract, transform and analyze data
Ability to communicate results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Good communication skills

What Will You Work On

Identify different sources and types of information from the different app stores, internal analytics, Campaign management tools, AB test solutions.
Collect, clean, organize, analyze and interpret application data and usage, draw insightful conclusions to enable data-driven product enhancements
Create visual interpretations of data on Data Studio or Looker, produce graphs and charts with insightful notes and summaries
Analyze customer data and assist product development in finding new innovative ways to optimize conversion and retention
Support the management in identifying, measuring and following up on key metrics
Analyze campaigns and user journey results in order to improve conversion and retention tactics
Provide regular, accurate and comprehensive statistical reports
Provide objective insight and analysis to influence decision making
Keep up to date knowledge on external market and data research to compare our metrics and create a value-added analysis

It would be great if you also have

Worked with Campaign management tools and metrics
Good understanding of A/B experiments and hands-on experience is a plus.
Good scripting and programming skills
Experience with Python and R programming language

Life at Truecaller -Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:

A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance and pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: For the days you're working from home, we provide you with an attractive budget for creating your cozy office at home.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun at our playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!

Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.

description:
Trustpair is reinventing B2B payment security.

We are building the leading anti-fraud solution for large corporations to help them avoid $20 billion in fraud every year.

With Trustpair, finance teams work with accurate data to avoid the risk of fraud and proceed to payments with peace of mind.

Trustpair is the best-in-breed product against B2B payment fraud and it must stay this way! Today a market-leader, Trustpair aggregates more data sources than its competitors and leverages on a bigger amount of payment data, making an intelligent use of the data collected.

Your role :

Integrated into the Data Team with 1 experienced Data Analyst, 1 experienced Data Engineer and a Data PM, reporting to our VP Operations, you will build and deliver a Data Analysis roadmap helping TrustpairÃ¢ÂÂs management and teams take the best strategic and operational decisions.

You'll collaborate with all teams (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, ProductÃ¢Â? in the company to help them define and track their key performance indicators, as well as identify compelling insights to enhance operational and business performance.

In the long run, you will be a key contributor in fostering a data-driven culture and mindset across all Trustpair teams, and optimizing the use of internal data to improve the performance of our solution.

Your next challenges & main missions:

Design and deliver our data analysis roadmap

Work with management and internal teams to identify Business Intelligence priorities and design a clear company-wide Analytics roadmap
Roll out the roadmap by leading focused projects with various teams (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, ProductÃ¢Â?, understanding their business needs, designing efficient data marts and delivering impactful visualisations (Looker) to help them take the best decisions

Foster a data-driven culture and empower business users

Make business, operations & product teams more autonomous by designing dedicated data marts, making data more accessible to them and training them to build self-serve data visualisations (Looker)
Support these teams on advanced business intelligence and exploratory analysis projects
Contribute to shaping TrustpairÃ¢ÂÂs Data TeamÃ¢ÂÂs processes, organisation and tools, and rolling out data best practices

Why join Trustpair? A list of our perks here!

Required skills & experience:

2 years of Data Analyst experience, ideally in a startup/scaleup environment
Strong SQL skills and experience with BI / Visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, or similar)
Analytical, structured and result-oriented mindset
Ability to simultaneously manage several projects and collaborate/communicate with any type of stakeholder (Product & Engineering, Customer Success, Operations, etc.)
Dynamism and ability to adapt to new challenges
Knowledge of programming languages (Python), software engineering skills, familiarity with dbt and Looker are a plus

Recruitment Process:

Call with AÃÂ¯cha, our Talent Partner (30 min)
Experience interview with Cyrille, VP Operations (1h)
Case study (should take around 2 hours of work on a 1 week timeframe) & restitution
Coffee fit & meet one of our co-founders

Equal Opportunity Statement

Trustpair's policy is to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.

Applicants for all positions in Trustpair must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for or be a citizen from Schengen / EU zone. The verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

description:
About Us

We are Quadcode, a company that develops a SaaS trading platform for clients around the world.
We are currently looking for an Antifraud Analystto join our Market Making department. As an Antifraud Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team's efforts to combat fraudulent activities.

Your responsibilities will include:

Fraud Analysis: Conducting technical, financial, and behavioral pattern analysis to identify potential fraudulent activities on the platform.
Monitoring Trading Activity: Proactively monitoring trading activity to detect any anomalies or adverse patterns that may indicate fraudulent behavior.
Anti-fraud Measures: Developing and implementing anti-fraud measures by creating effective anti-fraud rules and assessing their effectiveness in reducing fraudulent incidents.
Fraud Detection: Staying updated on new fraud mechanics and proposing innovative ideas to mitigate emerging fraudulent practices.
Internal Tool Improvement: Collaborating in the continuous improvement process of internal anti-fraud tools and mechanisms, contributing to enhancing their efficiency and effectiveness.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Finance, or a related discipline.
Previous experience in fraud analysis, risk management, or a similar role within the financial/gambling/gaming industry.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify patterns and anomalies in data
Knowledge of financial and technical aspects related to fraud analysis
Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques
Understanding of machine learning concepts and their application in fraud detection
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Effective communication skills to collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python programming and data analysis libraries.
Familiarity with Jupyter Notebook for data exploration and analysis.

We offer

relocation opportunity to Cyprus after a trial period;
remote or hybrid work model in our Cyprus office;
health insurance and mental health services;
13th salary and 21 vacation days per year;
provided lunches or food allowance;
monthly tuition reimbursement (kindergartens/schools);
opportunity to learn English and Greek;
sports reimbursement;
team buildings and parties;
bonuses for special events (e.g. child's birth).

Note:All applications will be treated with strict confidence. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

description:
About us:

Pioneering trusted medical solutions to improve the lives we touch: Convatec is a global medical products and technologies company, focused on solutions for the management of chronic conditions, with leading positions in advanced wound care, ostomy care, continence and critical care, and infusion care. With around 10,000 colleagues, and a promise to be forever caring, our products and services are available in over 100 countries. Our solutions provide a range of benefits, from infection prevention and protection of at-risk skin, to improved patient outcomes and reduced care costs. The company is a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index (LSE: CTEC) and in 2021 revenues were over $2 billion. To learn more about Convatec, please visit http://www.convatecgroup.com

Overall purpose of the Role

The BI Developer Engineer is responsible to implement complex and specialized data solutions ensuring high quality on the delivery always looking for opportunities to improve and automate.

As a Developer Engineer, you will be working with business users, collecting their requests, and then updating the set of existing BI reports to accommodate business needs. You will also be expected to establish company standards and common reporting terminology, and to help align existing and future reporting requests to such standards.

Good communications skills are required to partner with business leaders across the company creating unique conditions to make you grow in the BI and Analytics ecosystems. This role should act as an transformation agent in Convatec.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, and deliver self-service infrastructure and BI content, including reports and dashboards, to business professionals using last generation ETL/ELT tools, reporting tools, and Dashboarding.
Design and build data management solutions focused on data acquisition, data quality, data transformation, migration planning, schema structures, and master data management.
Provide hands-on design and implementation expertise around data warehousing, ETL, OLAP/tabular cubes, report development and data modelling across the company.
Document and communicate processes and data structures to preserve institutional knowledge.
Ensure a high level of data integrity and work output with attention to detail, while meeting time sensitive goals.
Proven experience of interpretation and presentation of defined Business requirements supporting best practice and guidelines in delivering optimal operational quality.
Experience in showcasing full capability and functionality of Power BI to the End User community
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and ability to demonstrate collaborative working with differing Teams across the IT landscape, including onshore and offshore.
Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective reporting and data visualization solutions to the various business units and executives.
Roll up sleeves and work hands-on with project teams to support objectives throughout delivery life cycle

Language Skills

English - Fluent
Portuguese (if not a native speaker)
Other languages can be a plus

What we are offering

Chance to move your career within the company that is the leader in delivering the pioneering trusted medical solution for the patients
Hybrid work model (1 day per week from the office in Lisbon)
Modern office space in the Lisbon city centre
Attractive compensation package with incentive plan and benefits
Great atmosphere across the team

Our progress will give you countless opportunities to move forward too. Seek out new challenges, and youÃ¢ÂÂll find them. Stretch your thinking, and youÃ¢ÂÂll find new ways to make an impact. And if you embrace the opportunity to drive your own growth, you could go further, and achieve more, than ever before.

This is a big step forward.

This is work thatÃ¢ÂÂll move you.

Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent Convatec

A formal recruitment process is required for all our opportunities prior to any offer of employment. This will include an interview confirmed by an official Convatec email address.

If you receive a suspicious approach over social media, text message, email or phone call about recruitment at Convatec, do not disclose any personal information or pay any fees whatsoever. If youÃ¢ÂÂre unsure, please contact us at careers@Convatec.com.

Equal opportunities

Convatec provides equal employment opportunities for all current employees and applicants for employment. This policy means that no one will be discriminated against because of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, nationality, citizenship, ancestry, sex, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, genetic predisposing characteristics or any other basis prohibited by law.

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives

Convatec is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Convatec employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written and signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Convatec. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

Already a Convatec employee?

If you are an active employee at Convatec, please do not apply here. Go to the Career Worklet on your Workday home page and View "Convatec Internal Career Site - Find Jobs". Thank you!

description:
Job

From the house of dream to the house of talent

"Whatever you do - for work or pleasure - do it with passion!"Live with passion ... "*Christian Dior

Christian Dior was the designer of the dream.From the foundation of his house in 1947, marked by the New Look Revolution, he metamorphoses his dreams in wonderful creations.His visionary spirit has never ceased to magnify women around the world, inspiring today and more than ever his successors. "The fabric is the only vehicle of our dreams (...).Fashion, in short, comes from a dream, and the dream is an escape, "he wrote in his work I am a couturier.Throughout his collections, Mr. Dior has become the demiurge of the happiness of his Muses.

Today, rich in this exceptional heritage and a community of more than 7,500 talents, our house embodies more than ever of talents expected by Christian Dior.In more than 40 countries, we promote our know-how, our audacity and our excellence through the passion and creativity of our employees.Join us and create your future in our generous, disruptive and ambitious universe where we grow in excellence, courage and optimism.

The little fashion dictionary
GENERAL INFORMATION

Department: Digital _ Team Data Intelligence

Tutor: Christelle Llanes

Availability for brief with Young Talent team: Date

Proposed contract: internship or work -study

Duration of the mission: (1 to 2 years alternating)

Desired start of the mission: early October

Title: Assistant Data Analyst

Mission detail

Context

Within the Studies Clients team (world headquarters), you will assist the team in the production and analysis of customer data to help decisions.You will have to be in contact with our interlocutors in the zone as well as the divisions produced in order to support them in their customer monitoring.

Description

Depending on your profile, we will be able to define a main mission: realization of a product appetite score, rework current customers segmentation, refine the definition of inactive customers to set up differentiated treatments, etc.

On the outskirts of this main mission, you will participate in the daily production and analysis of customer data

Team spirit

You will be able to develop your analytical skills (reading results, analysis and relevant communication of lessons).

You will also have the opportunity to apply your statistical skills to help SAS, which you can also improve your mastery.

You will participate in the everyday life of a large luxury group, will discover the universe and customer issues.

Personally, you will develop your relational skills in contact with the various teams in the zone and the product divisions, as well as your rigor and your autonomy.

Encouraging inclusion and diversity in all its forms, Christian Dior Couture has been committed since 2013 in an approach in favor of the employment of people with disabilities, and the valuation of all singularities.

description:
Permanent TSB is one of Ireland's leading retail and SME banks, with an innovative range of products and services powered through an evolving digital landscape, our focus is centred on ensuring we deliver what our customers, colleagues and communities need to be successful.

As an Analyst - Analytics Platforms & Processes, your role is to design, implement and maintain analytics systems and processes that support Bank-wide solutions including the implementation of IRB, IFRS9, collection, acquisition & data models as well as regulatory process deployments such as LCR, FINREP & COREP. You will also be required to perform in-depth analysis into model and process outputs to ensure they have been deployed accurately and correctly, that model drivers are clearly understood and key trends are identified

Responsibilities:

Support the production of model and process outputs, including key metrics
Support the ongoing enhancement and changes required to the systems that perform these calculations
Assist in the development of new systems and processes to adhere to emerging legislation
Provide excellent service to process owners by delivering high quality outputs within agreed timelines
Produce high quality insights across all portfolios covering required regulatory and operational requirements, key performance indicators, risks and trends
Research new technologies and techniques to drive efficiencies
Work with colleagues across business functions on multiple projects to deliver changes and enhancements
Maintain and test the systems to provide first class service to all users of the system
Produce model and process documentation as required
Ensure compliance with Risk and Control framework

Requirements:

The role requires rigorous analysis of data and the use of advanced methodologies. Candidates should possess, at a minimum, a third-level honours degree in a numerate subject area such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics
Excellent IT skills with proficiency in all of MS Office suite
Proven ability to prioritise workloads and will show determination and flexibility to deliver to very challenging timeframes
Experience and knowledge of programming and databases
An ability to communicate complex issues in a straightforward manner
Excellent documentation, report writing & presentation skills
Positive attitude with an eagerness to learn

This is a Permanent role based in Permanent TSB's St Stephens Green.

Is this you?

Please apply online on our website or via the apply link of this role. Your application will be sent through to our Talent Acquisition team and they will be in touch regarding your application. We reserve the right to draw up a shortlist for interview. The Bank understands the importance of a consistent and relentless focus on championing diversity and inclusion. We aim to attract, recruit, and retain individuals with diverse backgrounds, skills, competencies and abilities to work collaboratively to enhance the service we provide to all of our customers and the communities we serve.

At Lyreco We All Share a Common Goal to Strive for Passion, Excellence, Respect and Agility.We are proud to be the European Leader and the Third Largest Distributor of Workplace Products and Services in the World

We are committed to the development of our employees and we aim to achieve that by creating a culture that inspires and empowers.

Are you seeking a new challenge?This sacrifice might be for you!

Just like society, our company also evolves very quickly.Data naturally plays an important role in this.Both internal data and external data.Important projects are based on the insights that this data provides.To gain those insights and to coordinate data projects, we need you.

You are very strong at handling data, you enjoy bringing out the story, and you are able to tell this story to your colleagues from different departments.

You work in a structured way and you can set the necessary priorities based on strategic purposes and in consultation with stakeholders.What does your day look like?

Management of segmentation data

Data collection, - Validation and - Maintenance
Enrichment of our internal data
Management of Prospect Data from external sources

Link to our internal data
Set out a system to make this transparent.
Analysis

Based on the needs of your conversation partners, collect the right data, connect to each other and bring out the right story from there

Perform geographical analyzes
Project effect

Data -driven thinking along in projects within the local and the international organization.

You are analytical and critical, and you like an intellectual challenge.

Excellent market salary

description:
Data analist

Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland

Delft, 36 uur, salaris minimaal Ã¢Â?3736 - maximaal Ã¢Â?5092 Als data analist ben je een echte specialist op het gebied van data-analyse en het gebruik van tools met de focus op PowerBI. Door jouw kennis in te zetten in ons team groeien wij naar een betere samenwerkingspartner in de organisatie. Ben jij die data enthousiasteling die wil meebouwen aan het team Datagedreven Werken? Dan komen wij graag met jou in contact!

Wat ga je doen?

Vanuit de hele organisatie komen datavraagstukken. Jij pakt die met het team op en speelt een actieve rol bij het verduidelijken van het vraagstuk en het beoordelen van de haalbaarheid ervan. Samen met de data engineer ga je aan de slag met de databronnen en zorgt dat data op een juiste manier gebruikt kan worden. Je maakt een mooi dashboard met behulp van PowerBI (DAX) en Azure (SQL) waarmee je een organisatieonderdeel inzichten biedt, die niet meer handmatig gegenereerd hoeven te worden. Ook bied jij de organisatie de mogelijkheid zelf rapporten te maken. Tenslotte zorg jij dat de datastromen en de rapportagetool op een goede manier beheerd worden. Verder hou je je bezig met het:

Opstellen van aanpak om data te verkrijgen over of ter ondersteuning van bedrijfsprocessen;
Verwerken van de verkregen data, deze omzetten tot begrijpbare informatie en hierover advies geven;
Opstellen van automatische rapportages;
CreÃÂ«ren van datamodellen en visualisaties;
Het ondersteunen van self service analytics;
Beheren van datastromen en rapportages.

Meer weten? Bel of mail Anna!

Voor vragen over de procedure kun je contact opnemen met:

Anna Zanstra Corporate recruiter en adviseurazanstra@hhdelfland.nl06-46885095

Wat bieden we jou?

Deze functie is ingedeeld in schaal 10 van de CAO Werken voor Waterschappen en kent een minimum van Ã¢Â?3.736,- en een maximum van Ã¢Â?5.092,-bruto per maand. Doorgroeien naar een senior positie in schaal 11 (een minimum van Ã¢Â?4.149,- en een maximum van Ã¢Â?5.742,-) behoort tot de mogelijkheden.
Een aanstelling van een jaar, met intentie tot een vast dienstverband.
Het betreft een fulltime functie van 36 uur per week (1,0 fte).
Afwisselend werken op onze prachtige locatie in hartje Delft en vanuit huis.
Een Individueel KeuzeBudget (IKB) ter waarde van 21% van het salaris. Dit budget geeft jou de vrijheid om zelf te beslissen of je extra verlof wil kopen, een studie wil financieren of bijvoorbeeld je basissalaris maandelijks wil aanvullen.
Wij stellen Ã¢Â?6000,- beschikbaar voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling, dit noemen wij Ã¢ÂÂPersoonsgebonden Basis BudgetÃ¢Â? waar het om gaat is dat wij jou stimuleren jezelf te ontwikkelen.
Je krijgt een NS-businesscard of als je niet met het OV reist, dan krijg je netto Ã¢Â?0,21 per km. Je kan ook tegen gunstige voorwaarden een fiets aanschaffen voor je woon-werkverkeer.
Delfland biedt een mooie aanvulling op de wettelijke ouderschapsverlofregeling
Samen met Fello bieden wij mantelzorgondersteuning. We vinden het namelijk belangrijk dat werkende mantelzorgers ondersteund worden.

Wat maakt jou succesvol?

Je bent klantgericht en communicatief vaardig zodat je optimaal kan bijdragen aan de gezamenlijke doelen van Delfland. Hierbij kan je zowel goed zelfstandig werken als in teamverband. Je werkt nauwkeurig en je kan plannen, rapportages en informatie helder verwoorden.Behalve deze vaardigheden heb jij naast aantoonbaar hbo werk- en denkniveau ook:

Minimaal zes maanden werkervaring met Azure of een vergelijkbare clouddienst.
Minimaal twee jaar werkervaring met PowerBI of een vergelijkbare applicatie.Verder maken een proactieve werkhouding en gevoel voor humor jouw profiel compleet!

Waar kom je te werken?

De afdeling IMG is verantwoordelijk voor de informatievoorziening van Delfland. ZoÃ¢ÂÂn 40 bevlogen professionals houden zich bezig met themaÃ¢ÂÂs als architectuur, functioneel beheer, gegevensbeheer, GEO-informatie en GIS, business analytics, documentbeheer, archivering en data-gedreven werken. Er heerst een informele en open werksfeer waar op vaste dagen afwisselend op kantoor en vanuit huis wordt samengewerkt.Het Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland heeft een belangrijke maatschappelijke taak: wij zorgen voor droge voeten en schoon water in een dichtbevolkt en intensief gebruikt stukje Nederland. En hoewel Delfland ruim 730 jaar bestaan, zijn we allesbehalve ouderwets. We besteden veel aandacht aan belangrijke maatschappelijke themaÃ¢ÂÂs zoals klimaatadaptatie, duurzaamheid, circulariteit en inclusiviteit. Geworteld in het verleden werken we zo, samen met verschillende partijen, aan een mooie toekomst voor ons gebied en onze inwoners!

Onze drive

Onze ambitie is groot maar onze drive om samen te werken naar een schone en veilige leefomgeving is nog groter!

Sollicitatieproces

illustratie Eerste gesprek Tweede gesprek Optioneel klikgesprek Arbeidsvoorwaarden- gesprek en aanbod Je hebt de baan!

Interessante baan?

Contact

Stuur dan jouw motivatie en CV uiterlijk 18 juni via de link. De 1e gespreksronde staat gepland op dinsdag 27 juni as, de 2e gespreksronde op vrijdag 30 juni as. We vragen je daar alvast rekening mee te houden.Voor vragen over de functie kun je contact opnemen met Robin van den Assem (06-31645005, Product Owner team Datagedreven Werken). Voor vragen over de procedure kun je contact opnemen met Anna Zanstra, recruiter (06-48665095).

description:
Who are we?

At Vertiv, we build products that keep critical technologies running 24/7. We are proud we were the first to protect mainframes with precision cooling systems. We were the first to introduce an integrated enclosure system to distributed networks. We help some of the largest names in the industry bring new capacity online faster and at a lower cost when search and social media increased demand for storage and computing. Our portfolio spans power, thermal and infrastructure management products, software and solutions, and is complemented by a network of nearly 250 service centers worldwide.

We are now looking for a Junior Data Analystto join our team in Cluj-Napoca, Romania.

Summary

Vertiv Service business is designed to provide full life-cycle service support for our customers and as such is a core part of the Vertiv market offering. On site activity is a crucial element of Vertiv Service organization around the world. Vertiv CE are doing hundreds of thousands visits every year to maintain the critical infrastructures devices supporting Vertiv Customer applications.

As Junior Data Analystyou will within Big Data team to deliver meaningful output for use by the business and its customers. This could be different type reports like performance (equipment, site, operational) analysis, statistical (bench marking, operational, site, customer) analysis, maintenance planning, cost analysis for service contracts, etc.

In this role, you will be working directly with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, cross functional teams across various teams, both at a Regional and Global level, as well as Technology, Data, Insights & Analytics teams.

Reporting relationship:

This position will report directly to Big Data Team Leader, who reports to Global Service Platforms organization.

Essential role functions:

Interpret the data, analyses results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports that will convert into business opportunities.
Work with Management Systems leaders (Product Management and Marketing) and with the experts in the different technologies to priorities business and information needs.
Actively work with the Center of Expertise leaders (Thermal, AC and DC power, Batteries, Generators) to identify the needs for data collection at system, site and network level.
Collect feedback from Technical experts to improve the reports and data collection and verify that the improvements suggested have achieved the expected results.

Additional responsibilities might be assigned:

Define, with the subject matter and product specialists, the data to collect from the systems and site process sold and utilized by Vertiv.
Define strategies to optimize statistics in terms of efficiency and quality, including filter and clean data defining KPI's to identify problems at data base level.
Collaborate with the Monitoring solution architects to assure the efficiency of the data collection in different projects and solutions.
Work with the Global and regional teams to design, develop and maintain the Service Analytics concept. Develop and maintain the Global Data Lake used in conjunction with the Analytics Service organization plus other requirements as needed by the company.

Minimum qualifications:

Degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.
Working experience for minimum 1-2 years as a data analyst or business data analyst preferably oriented to IoT and M2M environments.
Technical knowledge regarding data (models, mining, cleansing, segmentation) and database design techniques.
Good knowledge and experience with BI reporting packages (Power BI, Tableau, etc), databases (SQL, etc), programming (Python, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Modeling skills to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment text representations.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyses, and disseminate significant amounts of information from different technical environments.
Knowledge and capability to understand specific applications in the Data Center, Telecom, Industrial and Edge segments.
Strong Communication skills and be able to pick new technology as we expand our data analytics footprint
Ability to ideate and be able to pursue those ideas to deliver business value

Language skills: English - Advanced/native level; Any additional major foreign language is a plus.

Travel Required: approximately 10% to visit real installations and Vertiv Center of Expertise

Location:Rumania - Normal office environment and schedule. Geographically distributed (virtual) team.

Are Youthe one we are looking for? Perfect! Apply directly to this job ad and take the first step towards a career with Vertiv!

description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?

Do you love digging into data to find insights and solve problems?

Are you excited to work in a fast-paced global environment?

Do you thrive in an open, positive, and dynamic culture built on competence and trust?

If you answered yes to the above, then the Finance Analyst role may be a good fit for you.

As a finance analyst at VMware, youÃ¢ÂÂll be part of a global team that provides the visibility, reporting and insight for data driven decision making. You will get hands-on experience presenting financial results to business partners, managing operational expenses, tracking metrics, implementing process improvements, and researching drivers impacting future investments. You will get opportunities to innovate, build your own models, grow your role and become a trusted finance advisor.

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

Forecast and analyze headcount (HC) and OPEX spend for assigned organizational unit:

Within 30 days of employment, become competent with VMwareÃ¢ÂÂs FP&A processes, fiscal calendar, and main tools.
Within 90 days you would be independently updating HC and OPEX forecast for assigned organization based on latest available information and would be executing on period close activities as per applicable timelines
Within 180 days you would be in position to maintain and distribute regular reporting packages and analyze variances to forecast; be able to provide commentary and additional context to business partners and address other ad hoc requests they might have
Within 360 days you would be ready to review and challenge HC and OPEX investment requests received from the business as well as assist in developing new financial models supporting long term planning and scenario evaluation
You would be collaborating with other colleagues from Finance, Accounting, Procurement, Operations and Sales to improve existing reporting and build new dashboards as requirements evolve

The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

The primary goal of this role is to support the business with all the aspects of HC and OPEX financial management. Your regular activities may be modified to suit your professional strengths, but you can expect a variety of the following assignments:

Prepare and input in Hyperion OPEX and HC forecast as per FP&A calendar; discuss main assumptions, risks, and opportunities with business and central sales finance
Review spend and make variance analysis using SAP BI, general ledger and other available data sources
Complete close tasks as per quarterly schedule
Review and approve Purchase and Personnel Requisitions; make sure approved spend is as per budget, drives savings or has reasonable ROI
Update excel dashboards and power point decks required as per the regular reporting schedule
Maintain and start building financial models for evaluating existing and up-coming investment initiatives
Manage queries and reporting requests from the various stakeholders

What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?

You would be joining the 50+ Sofia Finance Team. The global team is spread across the VMware offices including Palo Alto, Cork, Bangalore and Heredia.

We are a community that supports each other and strives to provide psychological safety. Our team culture is one based on trust, having pride in oneÃ¢ÂÂs work, continuous improvement and adaptivity.

Where is this role located?

Flexible: The location of this role is flexible within Sofia region. Work will be done from an office some days during a week and other days from a non-VMware building.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?

VMware offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package for you and your loved ones. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.

Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long-term incentives
Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, open communication
Work-life balance Ã¢Â?25 days paid vacation
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes

discipline is required or relevant years of experience within the pharmaceutical

industry.

the candidate have experience working in an aseptic manufacturing facility,

preferably in quality assurance, manufacturing compliance, clinical quality, or cell

therapy.

description:
L-Stone Capital, launched in October 2022 and based in Athens, Greece, is a seed / seed+ venture capital firm.

We invest in companies that are looking to take advantage of the monumental changes in the post Covid-19 world and the 4th Industrial Revolution.

L-Stone Capital provides financing and support high-quality and ambitious Management teams in growing their start-ups into scalable international businesses.

Having completed our first investments, we are looking to strengthen the team with an Analyst / Associate.

This is a dual investing / operational role providing an excellent career path for a highly motivated individual within a highly ambitious and growing platform.

The role represents the opportunity to join an open and flat team culture where everyone is encouraged to contribute to all investment discussions.

Key Responsibilities:

Assisting in sourcing & evaluating potential investment ideas Ã¢Â?you will be part of the full investment process from origination to exit

Investment screening
Investment report writing
Due-diligence and market research
Financial modelling
Portfolio monitoring & active interaction with portfolio companies

Assisting in LP reporting

Preparation of presentations
Assisting in LP reporting

Leading operational tasks

Ongoing communication with external parties (e.g. custodian, lawyers, auditors, advisors etc.)
Assisting in fund structuring, auditing, valuation, tax management etc.
Assisting in preparation of fund calculations, IRR returns etc.
Management of capital calls, wire payments, distributions, etc.
Monitoring and review of fund expenses
Managing website and LinkedIn etc (posting new investment, portfolio updates etc.)

Experience & Skills:

Excellent educational background from a top academic institution
Minimum 2 years of work experience (management consulting, investment banking, engineering and start-ups could be a relevant background; however, given the highly dynamic nature of venture capital, exceptional candidates from a wide spectrum of work experience can be considered)
Ambitious & driven
Entrepreneurial - seeing and taking opportunities
Commercial and highly analytical mindset with: (i) strong analytical skills and ability to evaluate risks & opportunities (ii) ability to research & analyse businesses from an industrial and strategic point of view, not only financial, (iii) enthusiasm to create and own a network of key stakeholders
Excellent communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to prioritise & work independently
Fluency in English
