description:
Job Description

Career Family, Level & Title: Senior Professional

Job Type: Permanent

Closing Date: 24 February 2023

Who are we?

We want to be the best place that any of our colleagues have ever worked.

At Standard Life International, we believe everyone should have a future to look forward to, and that means looking after our customers, our shareholders, and our people. Standard Life succeeds because of our people Ã¢Â?our skills, passions and experience. We will help you grow and progress by acknowledging your talent and rewarding you fairly. In return, youÃ¢ÂÂll give us your energy, enthusiasm and the drive to deliver results.

We are a part of the Phoenix Group. Phoenix Group are the UKÃ¢ÂÂs largest long-term savings and retirement business with c.13 million customers and c.ÃÂ£300 billion of assets under administration. As a market leader and FTSE100 organisation, we understand that our scale and expertise means that we have a key role to play for our customers, colleagues and our communities to help as many people as possible secure a life of possibilities. We are tackling key environmental and social issues such as transitioning our portfolio to net zero by 2050 Ã¢Â?but weÃ¢ÂÂre not done yet.

WeÃ¢ÂÂve seen huge growth and change, and this means there is enormous opportunity for our 7,000 colleagues to grow alongside us.

Flexible working

You can expect to work in a hybrid manner with time spent working in the office and at home. We believe that work/life balance offers benefits for customers as well as ensuring that you can balance a successful career with your life outside of work. We will discuss flexibility, what is important to you and balancing this with business requirements during the recruitment process.

Role Context

We currently have an opportunity within the Calculations Team. Working within a small team, the role reports directly to the team manager and will involve interaction with senior colleagues across the Irish branch as well as colleagues based in UK. The Calculations team sits within the Operations function in the Irish branch.

Role Purpose

Within Standard Life Ireland, the Calculations Team is responsible for supporting system development by producing calculation specifications in initial design stage of projects and following through with testing these developments.

In addition, the team supports the business when system failure occurs. This can range from producing statements that have failed, to analysing and remediating system calculation errors, calculating policy values and ensuring our quotations and statements are correct and comply with regulations.

The successful candidate must be highly numerate with an ability to understand and use formulae in Excel, have an analytical mind, logical decision making abilities, strong problem solving skills, be an excellent communicator and must enjoy working as part of a team. Knowledge of Standard LifeÃ¢ÂÂs products and systems, and an ability to demonstrate working in an analytical environment will be advantageous.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

Represent the team as subject matter expert on a wide range of projects
Produce calculation specifications when required
Test calculation development to ensure that systems are working as intended
Calculate values and/or produce adhoc/annual statements for policies when our systems fail
Maintain and develop calculation spread sheets that are used by the team and in other areas of the business
Act as document owner for documents owned by the team
Investigate and remediate calculation issues as and when they arise
Perform monthly processes
Assist with complaint handling
Production of With Profits Investment Report and PRSA Schedules
Maintain a working knowledge of the legislation and regulations appropriate to the role

Required Skills

Numerical Honours Degree Qualified is desirable but not essential
Experience in the Financial Services
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Highly numerate with an ability to understand, use and create complex formulae
Attention to detail
Keen business sense and an ability to simplify complex details
Strong customer focus
Ability to work alone and cross functionally and able to adapt and react to continuous demand changes
Performance driven individual and self-motivated
Excellent communication, particularly of technical concepts with the ability to make the complex simple (verbal and written)
Provide technical support and coaching to less experienced analysts in area of expertise.
Balancing competing priorities on different pieces of work.
Influencing decision across SL project teams where priorities and interests are often conflicting.
Will escalate issues that have a high impact to the appropriate manager using the established governance frameworks.
Authorised to produce non standard quotes, provide information on technical area of expertise to internal and external customers, but cannot give advice.

What We Offer

Bring your Ã¢ÂÂwhole selfÃ¢Â? skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and weÃ¢ÂÂll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. WeÃ¢ÂÂll ensure youÃ¢ÂÂre rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.

Join us and you join a unique organisation. ItÃ¢ÂÂs not just the 14 million policyholders we serve, or the ÃÂ£300 billion of assets we look after. Or that weÃ¢ÂÂre a FTSE 100 company that has been listed as one of the UK's Top Employers for nine years running. ItÃ¢ÂÂs our talented, inclusive and diverse workforce that makes us a success. We offerflexible workingopportunities ensuring we attract and retain the very best of talent. Find out about more about our peopleÃ¢ÂÂsstories, ourvaluesand our commitment todiversity.

We value diversity in our workforce and welcome enquiries from everyone.

description:
A new job as Junior Business Analyst has just been created in an international company located in the South of Brussels in the FMCG sector. You will be integrating a team of 5 other controllers, and you will be reporting to the Head of Controlling.

As a Junior Business Analyst, you will be responsible of the following tasks:

Contribute to the preparation of the Promotion ROI analysis and improvement proposal to the local team.
Contribute to the preparation of the Customer profitability analysis and overview presentation to local Finance team and to SLT on a session basis.
Participate actively to the construction of the budget and forecast in close collaboration with the local commercial organization with a particular focus on trade agreements.
Support the Financial Reporting, Controlling Manager, and the local team in the Gross to Net analysis and ensure that the sales teams have adequate tools and templates to support the development of the annual plan.
Contribute to the preparation of the Commercial Profit & Loss by Product.
Ideal Profile Of The Junior Business Analyst

Master degree (Business) Economics/Controlling
A first experience of 2 years in a controlling department
FMCG or Retail background is a plus
Advanced skills in Excel and the knowledge of Power Pivot or Power BI is a plus
Fluent in English & French
Good communication skills to collaborate with and challenge key stakeholders
Our Client Is Offering You

A permanent contract
The possibility to work 2 days at home
Continuous trainings
To be part of renowned family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands
A very attractive salary package with interesting advantages in line with your experience
If you have strong organisation and analytical skills, as well as being detail oriented, this job as Junior Business Analyst is what you have been looking for. Do not hesitate to send your CV today with the reference YNN1916912.

description:
Are you a big data expert? We are looking for a creative developer to strengthen our geospatial intelligence team

Scania is a world leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. Sustainability at Scania is also about having a healthy work place with diversity, inclusion and equal opportunities for men and women.

Our team, Connected Intelligence, is a group within Connected Systems at Scania R&D. In the context of connectivity, we innovate and deliver scalable analytics that enables informed decision-making for product, service, and business developers.

Do you want to shape our solutions in close cooperation with the stakeholders and the development teams? We provide an environment where we apply agile working methods and where the teams are responsible for their solutions all the way from requirement handling, development, quality assurance to production, and root cause analysis.

Together with us, you get a key role in shaping tomorrow's connected transport system. Our motivation comes from working for a bigger picture where collaboration, innovation, and exploration are common drivers among your colleagues.

Your Assignment

We want to strengthen the geospatial intelligence team to further develop our visualisation and infrastructure for self-service solutions that democratize data from ScaniaÃ¢ÂÂs connected fleet of more than 500.000 vehicles. The data is derived from GPS-positions, operational vehicle data and other data sources that describe and help improve the global transport network.

You will be working in a cross-functional team to deliver repeatable and quality-assured results through self-sustained analytics services. The competencies in each team usually cover a wide range of areas, such as software development, data engineering, data science and front-end interaction and visualization of data.

The daily work is planned and carried out following agile principles, where your team is part of the departmentÃ¢ÂÂs flow. You will contribute with your core competence and be responsible for tasks assigned to you during each sprint while over longer periods contributing to the overall planning and vision of the team.

Your profile

You have an academic degree in a computer science related field or equivalent work experience.

As an experienced developer or data scientist, you are analytical, with a genuine technical interest. You enjoy collaboration with different competencies to find the best solution to a problem.

In Addition

You understand how to turn requirements into code to continuously deliver value as you go along.
You have a high-quality focus and an understanding of how industrialized solutions scale -what we build is what we will run in production. Continuous improvement of the development process is a natural priority for you.
You have experience in one or more of the following areas: working with data streaming, big data analytics, cloud software development, geospatial visualisations and/or operational vehicle or transport data.

You communicate fluently in English in both speech and writing.

Our offer

We offer a healthy and inspiring workplace, with focus on respect for the individual, where you have many opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is important and something we encourage and support.

In addition to personal and professional development opportunities, we offer benefits such as company car, mutual bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer direct bus service between Stockholm and SÃÂ¶dertÃÂ¤lje, Scania Job Express. You can also work from our office in central Stockholm from time to time, Scania Sergel.

Contact information

If you have questions about the job you are welcome to contact Frank Deubzer, recruiting manager, at frank.deubzer@scania com

Application

If you feel you have the skills and desire to take on this interesting role, donÃÂ´t hesitate to apply! Submit your CV and relevant certificates. You don't have to send a cover letter, just upload your CV twice.

Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.

description:
At the moment we are looking for a dedicated Data Expert. You will be working in a team of passionate Data Experts focused on sustainable and impact investments. You'll gather, clean, and analyse data from multiple sources, collaborate on innovative projects, and create insightful reports and dashboards.

Project Details

Location: Rotterdam
Type: Hybrid
Duration: 12 months

Responsibilities

Gather and clean data from multiple sources, including data providers, clients, and custodians.
Link financial and sustainability data to ACTIAM investments and analyse the results using software tools and Microsoft BI (SSMS and SSAS).
Develop visually appealing dashboards (Power BI) to enhance ESG integration and disclosure of results.
Explore new methods and data for measuring positive impact and adaptiveness towards sustainability transitions, in collaboration with topic experts.

Requirements

Master's degree in Econometrics, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Economics, Earth Sciences, or a related quantitative field.
5+ years of relevant work experience.
Proven experience with SQL and Power BI.
Knowledge of ESG and financial services is a plus.
Proficiency in Dutch and English, both written and spoken.

If you are interested in this role, please share your latest resume with Tristan Lamme. If you know someone who might be interested in this role, please share his or her details.

Michael Bailey International is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

description:
Do you have the right qualities and do you think you are a good addition to Trilations?Then apply for the position as data analyst.Then you will soon receive a message from us!

The vacancy

The initial process looks like this: the first weeks you get to know the Qlik tools by following both internal and external training courses.You will be called in with existing customers to perform support and change request tasks, first supported by a senior consultant, but quickly independently.You do your first projects under the supervision of a senior consultant.

Here we assume

You have a good feeling for BI solutions and a strong interest in data, analyzes, business intelligence and reporting.A first experience in developing BI solutions in Qlik or another BI tool (Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau) gives you a lead.You are enthusiastic, you show a sense of initiative and you are open to new experiences.You are driven in looking for technical solutions for business questions and how you can realize them with the available BI tools.You have ambition to take control of your career and learn a lot in the short term.Offer a company with challenging projects and sturdy growth spectives

Employment conditions

The salary is 2100 to 2500 euros gross per month
You get 32 Ã¢ÂÂÃ¢ÂÂvacation days
Your working hours become flexible
For this position it is possible to work at home
Training will be given
There is a budget for employees to train further
Pension is being built up
There is an expense allowance in force
As an employee you can take out health insurance through the employer
Work telephone
Work -laptop
lease car from the company
Fuel card
As an employee you get a 13th month
Possibility to obtain bonus

About Trilations:

Trilations is an open-minded, no-nonsense consultancy organization.We strongly believe in long -term engagement, with both our customers and our employees.We invest in sharing knowledge, lifelong learning and coaching and building on our pragmatic culture, which is based on trust, professionalism, integrity and involvement.The consultants of Trilations are distinguished through their expertise and their professional and customer -oriented, friendly attitude.

Founded in 2001

description:
Data analyst (f/m/d) wanted- for our customer, a company based in Dortmund, we are looking for a data analyst (f/m/d) as soon as possible.

The position is a direct permanent position with our customer.The support and mediation as well as all our other services are free of charge for you as an applicant.

Our customer offers

Very good social benefits such as employer -financed company pension schemes
Flexible work design by using the existing regulations for mobile work (at least two days / week presence at one of the locations)
Employment in a secure work environment at a top employer
Open feedback culture, flat hierarchies and a motivated team
Excellent design and development opportunities
Attractive employee discounts, for example on vacation trips, cars etc.

Your tasks as a data analyst (W/M/D)

You help to optimize the business processes.You work at the interface between processes and IT and accompany the account of the data-based recording of processes up to the process analysis and derivation of concrete optimization and automation measures
You live and experience technical diversity - you implement projects and smaller initiatives with the help of digital solutions and data models and visualize meaningful analyzes in process mining tools
You check existing digital solutions and processes and conduct optimization measures
You advise management as well as the college: inside from the department on procedural and technical questions
You ensure the optimal transfer of knowledge within the department

Your profile

Your studies of (economic) computer science, the (economic) engineering system, economics or a comparable specialty has been completed or concludes this shortly
You bring interest in process mining, data mining and data analysis technologies
Ideally, you have knowledge of application in one of the common languages, e.g. Python, PQL or R. You also know your way around with common database technologies such as SQL
Experience in automation with tools such as Power Automates and VBA is an advantage
Dynamics, motivation and curiosity for accounting processes
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and German;Ability to explain complexes from other areas

Have we sparked your interest?

Then apply online as a data analyst (f/m/d), stating the reference number 06601-0012598321- Your resume is sufficient.If you have any questions, Gorof Kapoor from Robert Half will be happy to help you.

Robert Half Deutschland GmbH & Co. KG processes the data of applicants that are required to carry out the application process.Further information on data protection, in particular on your rights, can be found at

description:
Our client is a major player in mass distribution with an international dimension.He is a major player in large distribution who currently experiences a major transformation by adapting his model and organization to become the leader in food e-commerce.He wishes to place digital and data at the heart of all its operations and its value creation model

To support its growth in activity, the e-commerce management and digital transformation of our client seeks a data analyst S&P F/H.

The Data Analyst S&P is in charge of providing the data necessary for the animation of a monthly process of the evolution of the commercial equation of the distributor brand of the group, and to support, in particular in the form of reports, theIn place of action plans that will result from it.It will have to define and deploy all the analytical tools in the department to control brands, categories and different levers of marketing mix (assortment, promotion, etc.).

Your missions will consist of

Understand the business issues, identify the needs of the different teams of the group's brands in analytical specifications,
Define and designer the corresponding reporting / dashboards tools and guarantee the reliability and relevance of the tools produced,
Implementation of processes/requests and automation,
Support teams in the use of reports to ensure a high level of adoption of the solutions put in place,
Promote the rise in skills of the teams in terms of data analytics, and develop their autonomy in terms of access to data, to carry out analyzes, to build dashboards ...
Being a force for proposals to improve the solutions developed, and identify opportunities for new analytical tools to meet the needs of teams.

Your profile

Coming from an engineering school, specialized in supply/purchase, or university training, you justify a first experience on a similar function in the analytics professions in strategy consulting, B2C or a panelist.

You master one or more of the following areas

Good capacity in manipulating large volumes of data;Mastering a data requirement language (SQL, Big Query), datavisualization tools (Table, Google Data Looker Studio);Python / R mastery is a plus,
Expert in the graphic representation of analyzes and data, and very sensitive to form and ergonomics,
Control of distributor/consumer panels, and performance analysis tools,
Good relational, creative, enthusiastic around analytics and data, and strong capacity for popularization and pedagogy,
Major analytical and statistical capacities,
Rigor, proactivity and autonomy,
Knowledge of the world of mass distribution and/or industrialist desired, especially in the food sector,
Knowledge of the S&P processes would be a plus,
English required, desired Spanish.

POST TO FOR CDI.

description:
Company description

World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering implements an in -depth sectoral knowledge and the mastery of the latest digital technologies and software to support the convergence of physical and digital worlds.Combined with all the group's capacities, Capgemini Engineering helps its customers accelerate their transformation to the intelligent industry.Capgemini Engineering has more than 55,000 engineers and scientists in more than 30 countries, and operates in sectors such as: aeronautics, space, defense, naval, automobile, rail, infrastructure & transport, energy, utility & chemistry, life sciences, Communications, semiconductors & electronics, consumer industry & goods, software & internet.

Capgemini Engineering is part of the Capgemini group, a world leader, responsible and multicultural, bringing together 325,000 people in more than 50 countries.Strategic partner of companies for the transformation of their activities by taking advantage of all the power of technology, the group is guided on a daily basis by its raison d'ÃÂªtre: freeing human energies by technology for an inclusive and sustainable future.With 55 years of experience and great expertise in the various sectors of activity, Capgemini is recognized by its customers to meet all of their needs, strategy and design to operations management, inTaking advantage of innovations in the perpetual evolution fields of cloud, data, artificial intelligence, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms.The group achieved a turnover of 18 billion euros in 2021.

Get the Future you want* - www.capgemini.com.

Capgemini, the future you want

Description of the mission

More specifically, your missions are as follows

You are passionate about the Da Data field and you want to take part in a major project in the Telecom sector.Join our Hybrid Intelligence team within Capgemini Engineering as Data Analyst.

Understand the need for trade, assess charges and design technical and functional solutions
Write the specifications and describe in the form of specifications
Ensure the link between business need and functional and computer possibilities
Provide technical teams with project documents
Write application recipe notebooks
Ensure coordination and monitoring of the functional recipe with business experts
Train and ensure support for business experts

Profile

You come from an engineer training or equivalent BAC+5 IT specialized in business intelligence and you have a successful experience in the development/ integration of BI solutions (minimum 2 years).

You master Power Bi and the SQL language.Knowledge of an ETL is a real plus.

Finally, you have a sense of priorities, you are recognized for your ability to create a link with technical teams and business teams.

Do you recognize yourself in the description of the profile and want to know more?Apply now!

description:
Country

Bulgaria

Job Family

Operations

For almost 90 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the worldÃ¢ÂÂs biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumerÃ¢ÂÂs life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, ROI, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of 8,000+ employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and will support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future, as we continue our evolution from Market Research provider to SaaS data solutions and consulting partner. We value extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!

Job Description

Junior Market Data Analyst - sector Fashion

Mission Of The Role

The purpose of the role is to ensure the quantitative and qualitative control of marketing data and the creation of new products in existing databases, complying with all global quality requirements.

You Will

Search for information on the Internet about the characteristics of different products for the sector Fashion.
Enter the received information in a database or Excel.
Categorize, classify and update of information in Excel.
Ensure quality data control.
Manage the monthly production of data through internal platforms.
Ensure the publication of data according to customer requirements and deadlines.
Track several market trends.
Work with specialized applications for database processing.
Cooperation with other internal departments and partners of GfK.
Report to Service Manager GSC MI.
You Have

University degree in: Economics, Mathematics, Information Technology, Data Management or other related area
Working level in English (B1 - B2)
Good knowledge of MS Office (Excel)
In-depth knowledge of methods, procedures and tools for data processing and analysis
Initiative and analytical thinking
Attention to detail
Maintaining high- quality standards
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Skills to work within deadlines and goals
Benefits

Use the latest digital technologies.
Ongoing trainings to support your development.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
Competitive remuneration and bonus scheme linked to individual performance and company results.
Flexible working hours and home office.
3 additional non-working days annually.
Food vouchers
Health insurance
Discount program with external vendors
Multisport card
Eco friendly travelers are welcome to the office Ã¢Â?parking places for bikers and free card for public transportation are available to all employees
Last but not least Ã¢Â?GfK Sofia office is located close to the city centre and easily accessible from any point by public transportation Ã¢Â?47A Tsarisgradsko Shose Blvd
All documents will be treated in the strictest confidentiality.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for an interview.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do on: https://www.gfk.com/about-gfk/diversity-and-inclusion

At GfK we work collaboratively with our colleagues but offer a flexible working approach, including dividing our time between office & remote working as well as the opportunity to flex our working hours around team core hours.

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit and make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to get to know you!
job_posting_title: Junior Market Data Analyst - sector Fashion
linkedin_skills: Data Control, Market Data, Market Analysis, Quality Control, Customer Requirements, Communication, Databases, Analytical Skills, B1, and Attention to Detail
DWH, Dashboards, Analytics, Bug Tracking, Data Analytics, Analytical Skills, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), Data Warehousing, and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)

description:
About the CAF Group

Sustainable mobility is one of the most important challenges of today's society.It is necessary to have great capacity transport networks that offer a high level of comfort to passengers and at the same time be respectful of the environment.

The CAF Group is one of the international leaders in the design and implementation of comprehensive sustainable mobility systems.In addition, it has a wide range of products and services that include system design, civil works, signaling, other electromechanical systems, services, supply of rolling material and system operation.

Functions and responsibilities

Person is required responsible for obtaining production indicators, costs, deadlines, etc.being responsible for generating the database system to analyze productivity and efficiency and therefore improve operational efficiency.

The vehicle business is immersed in a process of transformation of its operational model.This transformation seeks improvement through specialization and standardization of both products and processes.In this context, the need to implement project management based on standard tasks with the objective of measuring, analyzing and improving efficiency arises.

Within the framework of the transformation of the vehicle business, it will be integrated into the production engineering team, responsible for generating the system to automate data extraction for later analysis and decision making.

Required training

University training in engineering (superior engineer/ master) or technical degree

Professional experience required

Data analyst in manufacturing environments, provide experience of at least 3 years in similar positions.

Competencies

Serve customers

Strive to achieve results

Demonstration of technical experience

Critical thinking

Adapt to changes

Behave with integrity

Creation and maintenance of equipment

Other requirements

We are looking for a person with knowledge in Business Analytics/Intelligence capable of establishing tools and data models that allow decisions and boost continuous improvement in manufacturing processes.

Pro-active person, executive, with analytical capacity and objective oriented.Teamwork and leadership capacity.
Knowledge of databases and tools of Business Analytics and Business Intelligence.Experience in implementation of management processes based on Business Analytics and Business Intelligence.
It will be valued that you have collaborated in transformation processes and manufacturing improvement.

description:
Acoladest one of the world leaders in the sector of linguistic engineering solutions, services and technologies and content management.

Bringing together the AcOlad, Textmaster and Ubiqus brands, the group displays a presence in 25 countries and relies on a solid network: more than 2,500 internal experts, and a panel of more than 20,000 freelance linguists.

With the acquisition of several companies, the Acolad group aims to structure its data environment.In this context, the recently constituted data team is responsible for collecting the data of different sources, structuring and harmonizing it in order to make it best.

Attached to the Head of Data, you will be at the origin of the transformation and harmonization of data in our datawarehouse as well as the development of views and reports allowing the different trades and the top management to best pilot the activity.

More precisely :

Collect the business need in terms of analysis
In collaboration with the Data Manager and Data Engineer, define the architecture of Datawarehouse
Consolidate and harmonize data in Datawarehouse (Snowflake / SQL)
Defining views that meet the business needs that will be used to export the raw data, or will be the source of visualization data reports (table)
Designer reports in Tableau in order to highlight the consolidated data in the datawarehouse
Ensure user membership by evangelizing the profession through workshops
Maintain the other sources of reporting of the group inherited from the various entities until their decommissioning
The +:

Join a team under construction with major ambitions
A beautiful issue and a major challenge: set up an environment and a data strategy
Complete post with attractive technical stack (Mulesoft / Snowflake / Table / Salesforce)
Dynamic sector and strong growing international group
Everything is to be built

Requirements

Must have:

You have a graduate engineering school, trade or equivalent
You have at least 3 years of experience as Data Analyst/Consultant/Developer Bi or similar
You have excellent skills and knowledge in SQL (Oracle, SQL-Server) and in data modeling
You have good skills and knowledge in Data Visualization (Table, Power Bi, Bag, Qlik, ...)
You have skills and knowledge in data architecture and understanding data sources
You are independent, organized, force of proposal and endowed with a synthetic spirit
You have a good relationship
You have an understanding of the business and an appetite for the figures
You with a very good level of English

Nice to have:

You have knowledge and skills on snowflake and table
You with a basic understanding of financial processes

description:
7538 BGP Products Operations GmbH

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access Ã¢Â?Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;
Leadership Ã¢Â?Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and
Partnership Ã¢Â?Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.

For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.

The Role & What You Will Be Doing

The Data Quality Analyst will be part of a new and developing Data Quality Management team within Viatris responsible for driving data quality best practices and supporting data quality improvement initiatives. The Data Quality Analyst will work closely with internal business partners, IT and business analysts to define and execute data assessment plans, perform root cause analyses and manage data quality reporting.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and hereÃ¢ÂÂs how the Data Quality Analystrole will make an impact:

Work with both business and technical SMEs to document business rules and codify them into data quality rules.
Support ongoing monitoring, analysis and reporting of data quality metrics.
Prepare and consolidate data for established, periodic review and maintain data quality dashboards.
Recommend establishment of new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve data collection and reporting.
Assisting in root cause analysis, investigating any data errors or anomalies and assisting in the implementation of solutions to correct data problems.
Coordinate various data cleansing and enrichment activities.
Develop data quality reporting tools and reports.
Support and supervise data acquisition and reporting processes for assigned projects.
Drive the continuous improvement of the Data Quality Management program by refining processes and methods, tools and systems.
Communicate Data Quality non-compliance to Stewards and Business users to resolve issues.

About Your Skills & Experience

For this role, weÃ¢ÂÂre looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills and experiences:

Passionate about the value of quality data.
Minimum 3-5 years relevant data analytics or data quality management experience.
Strong understanding of data quality management principles. Familiarity with TIQM a plus.
Must possess strong analytical, communication (written and verbal), and organizational skills.
Hands on experience and current skills developing and performing data quality analysis with a variety of software tools and SQL.
Proficient with SQL. Familiar with Microsoft SQL Server a plus, but not required.
Proficient with MS Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
BachelorÃ¢ÂÂs degree in relevant discipline.
Experience with data quality analysis tools a plus.
Ability to present technical and non-technical information in appropriate terms to suit the audience and purpose.
Ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity.

At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if youÃ¢ÂÂre excited about this role but your past experience doesnÃ¢ÂÂt fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Benefits At Viatris

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others. Some of our benefits include the following on top of a competitive salary:

Excellent career progression opportunities
Work-life balance initiatives
Bonus scheme
Health insurance
Pension

Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris

At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion

Sustainability at Viatris

Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Do you want to understand which factors design energy prices?Do you want to understand which new markets are created by the energy transition and how they work?Do you want to know how German refineries are taken care of against Russia after the start of sanctions?Then come to our team and become an expert for the energy market.

description:
Company Information

Legend Biotech is a global biotechnology company dedicated to treating, and one day curing, life-threatening diseases. Headquartered in Somerset, New Jersey, we are developing advanced cell therapies across a diverse array of technology platforms, including autologous and allogenic chimeric antigen receptor T-cell, T-cell receptor (TCR-T), and natural killer (NK) cell-based immunotherapy. From our three R&D sites around the world, we apply these innovative technologies to pursue the discovery of safe, efficacious and cutting-edge therapeutics for patients worldwide.

Legend Biotech entered into a global collaboration agreement with Janssen Biotech, Inc. to develop, manufacture and commercialize ciltacabtagene autoleucel (cilta-cel). Through our strategic partnership, we look to advance the promise of an immunotherapy in the treatment of multiple myeloma.

Role Overview

The QC Analyst, CAR-T Manufacturing is an exempt level position with responsibilities for performing

QC testing related to the manufacturing of cell therapy products for clinical trials and commercial

operations in a controlled GMP environment.

Major Responsibilities:

Responsible for the completion of QC testing related to the manufacturing of autologous CART products for clinical trials and commercial operation in a controlled cGMP cleanroom environment.
Ensure testing is completed in compliance with all applicable procedures, standards and GMP regulations.
Work with Process Development team, Quality and Operations organization to successfully transfer process/analytical testing to cGMP facility to manufacture products.
Conduct analytical testing of raw material/utility, in-process, or final product samples submitted to the QC laboratories.
Perform peer review/approval of laboratory data.
Utilize electronic systems (LIMS) for execution and documentation of testing.
Create, review and approve relevant QC documents, SOPÃ¢ÂÂs and WIÃ¢ÂÂs.
Perform tasks in a manner consistent with the safety policies, quality systems and cGMP requirements.
Other duties will be assigned, as necessary

Qualification

Education:

A minimum of a BachelorÃ¢ÂÂs Degree in Science, Engineering or equivalent technical

discipline is required or relevant years of experience within the pharmaceutical

industry.

Experience:

A minimum of 1-2 years relevant work experience is required. It is preferable that

the candidate have experience working in an aseptic manufacturing facility,

preferably in quality assurance, manufacturing compliance, clinical quality, or cell

therapy.

Capabilities, Knowledge, and skills:

Experience in a Quality Control setting is preferred.
Experience with aseptic processing in ISO 5 clean room and biosafety cabinets is required.
Knowledge of cGMP regulations and FDA/EU guidance related to manufacturing of cell-based products is required.
Knowledge of Good Tissue Practices is required.
Detailed knowledge of CAR-T QC test methods and related equipment is preferred
Excellent written and oral communication skill are required
Candidates must be able to accommodate shift schedule. Shifts include routine weekend and evening work as required by the manufacturing process.
Candidates must be able to accommodate unplanned overtime (including nights and weekends) on little to no prior notice.
The candidate must be highly organized and capable of working in a team environment with a positive attitude under some supervision.
Comfortable with speaking and interacting with inspectors.
This position may require occasional travel to partner sites in NJ or PA as business demands.
This position may require up to 10% domestic or international travel as business demands.

Language(s):

English

Legend Biotech is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is LegendÃ¢ÂÂs policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Legend Biotech maintains a drug-free workplace.

description:
Smarttech247 is seeking a highly motivated and customer-oriented Data Governance Specialist to join our team. As a Data Governance Specialist, you will play a crucial role in providing data governance solutions and support to our clients. You will work closely with clients to understand their data governance needs and provide guidance and recommendations to enhance their data management practices. Your strong communication skills and technical expertise will be instrumental in building trusted relationships with our customers.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with clients to understand their data governance requirements and challenges, across areas such as DLP, DLM, Data Classification etc.
Deploy and enforce data governance policies and procedures tailored to each client's specific needs, ensuring data quality, usability, consistency, availability, security, and integrity.
Assess and evaluate client concerns related to data governance, providing problem definitions, opportunity and solution recommendations, and root cause analysis.
Support client compliance with relevant data protection regulations and industry standards.
Stay updated on the latest developments in data governance, data management, and data protection regulations to provide valuable insights and recommendations to clients.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in a field related to computers, such as Information Technology or Computer Science.
1-3 years of experience in data governance, data management, or a related field. Experience in implementing data governance programmes or initiatives is highly desirable.
Strong understanding of data governance principles, including data quality, data lifecycle management, and regulatory compliance.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively engage and collaborate with clients of varying technical backgrounds.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear and actionable recommendations for clients.
Knowledge of data protection regulations, such as GDPR, and their implications for data governance practices.
Familiarity with data management tools, data cataloguing, and metadata management systems is a plus.
Attention to detail and strong analytical skills for problem-solving and root cause analysis.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple client engagements simultaneously

description:
Omschrijving

Bij Belfius geloven we dat data de basis vormen van onze digitale transformatie. Of het nu gaat om digitale marketing, het leveren van producten en diensten op maat, het nemen van tactische en strategische beslissingen, het verbeteren van de procedures of het monitoren van onze prestaties, data spelen in dat verband een cruciale rol.

Elke dag opnieuw vinden miljoenen verrichtingen plaats in de systemen van Belfius, wat telkens data oplevert. In het Risk/ICM Data Delivery-team moeten wij die gegevens begrijpen en ze vertalen in insights en tools ontwikkelen ter ondersteuning van de beslissingen en de strategie van de metiers.

De job in een notendop

Wij zijn op zoek naar iemand die ons kan ondersteunen in onze activiteiten inzake reporting en kwaliteitscontrole. In die functie hebt jij twee expertisedomeinen:

producten die provisieloon opleveren (rekeningen, fondsen, beleggingen enz.)
de kosten, en dat voor alle activiteiten van de bank

In die context krijg jij twee hoofdtaken toebedeeld. Aan de ene kant voer je analyses uit van de maandelijkse resultaten en zorg jij ervoor dat die de nodige kwaliteit hebben. Je stelt je analyses eveneens ter beschikking van de diverse stakeholders zodat zij hun beslissingen kunnen nemen. Aan de andere kant bekommer jij je eveneens om de follow-up van de evoluties in het domein (impact op de berekening van de rentabiliteit bij de lancering van nieuwe producten, het veranderen van tariefstructuur enz.) om de potentiÃÂ«le impact op onze activiteiten te analyseren.

Binnen de afdeling Data & Analytics maakt het Risk/ICM Data Delivery-team deel uit van Data Transformation Risk & ICM en is het verantwoordelijk voor het exploiteren van de data van het domein Risk & ICM voor het berekenen van de rentabiliteit en de positie van de risicoÃ¢ÂÂs van de klanten, segmenten, producten, metiers enz. Het team identificeert transversaal en gecentraliseerd de behoeften van de diverse betrokken partijen in termen van de visualisering en architectuur en is verantwoordelijk voor diverse taken:

ontwikkeling van cockpits: visualisering van het financieel/commercieel rendement en van de positie van Risk voor de segmenten/klanten/producten
verslagen opstellen en bestaande verslagen automatiseren: die worden opgesteld op basis van definities afkomstig uit geharmoniseerde gegevensbronnen
ad-hocanalyses: bijvoorbeeld op een categorie van klanten, een bepaald product enz

De afdeling omvat multifunctionele teams met o.m. data engineers en data analysts.

De Data Analyst is in de eerste plaats een aanspreekpunt in het domein van de kosten en de provisielonen en de aanwending van de gegevens daarrond.

description:
Do you have experience as a Data Specialist/Data Analyst working with policy and regulation? Do you enjoy analyzing end-user projects and seeing how data can be best utilized? 3+ years as a data analyst - working with data cataloging & data policy regulation
Worked directly with data consumers to align them to company standards
Strong skills in SQL and troubleshooting within data warehouses
Utilized advanced Excel formulas and functions to work with large datasets
Worked with data visualization tools to create dashboards and data optimization
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

What you'll do:

Pursue data quality best practices and implement rules which will mitigate security risks related to the data used in the firm.

Python scripting knowledge

description:
About Glovo

WeÃ¢ÂÂre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, youÃ¢ÂÂll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of livesÃ¢Â?all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

You will be a key member of the sales operations team, working hand-by-hand with the Global Sales Ops Manager. At Glovo, it is in our DNA to do more with less, and your job will be to optimize the sales department across all markets.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Develop market analysis and identify strategic insights. Being able to bring down the insights to practical actions/recommendations.
Lead the standardization & digitalization of HQ processes. Identify automation opportunities and roll out the new process globally.

Previous experience is a plus

We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What YouÃ¢ÂÂll Find When Working At Glovo

Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

description:
RESEARCH ANALYST | Rotterdam | Fulltime | Ã¢Â?514 - Ã¢Â?716

Als Research Analystbij USP Marketing Consultancy ben je verantwoordelijk voor de onderzoeksfase(s) binnen een project op het gebied van bouw, installatie, doe-het-zelf of wonen. Denk hierbij aan het programmerenvan vragenlijsten, het samenstellen van een sample en het analyserenvan de onderzoeksresultaten. Je bent betrokken vanaf het moment dat het onderzoeksdoel duidelijk is afgestemd met de klant en de Projectmanager, en blijft betrokken tot en met de presentatie van de resultaten en de evaluatie van het onderzoek.

Een lopend onderzoek begint met het programmeren en uitvoerig testen van vragenlijsten, die eerder door de Projectmanager zijn opgesteld. Daarna komt het voorbereiden en monitoren van (internationaal) veldwerkaan bod; dit veldwerk wordt online of telefonisch uitgevoerd door een veldwerkpartner van USP. Vervolgens ontferm je je over de analyse van de resultaten in SPSS, waar je veel tijd aan besteedt. Je controleert de datauitvoerig en analyseert deze, waarna je de resultaten gaat rapporteren en conclusies kunt trekken. In de meeste gevallen is het veldwerk kwantitatiefen worden de interviews telefonisch of online afgenomen. Soms werk je mee aan kwalitatieveprojecten, waarbij er diepte-interviews afgenomen worden of groepsdiscussies gehouden worden met experts.

Het varieert per project hoeveel tijd je gemiddeld besteedt aan zaken zoals programmeren en analyseren. Je werkt regelmatig samen met de Projectmanager, de VeldwerkcoÃÂ¶rdinator en (internationale) veldwerkpartners; er lopen diverse projecten door elkaar, variÃÂ«rend qua omvang.
Er zijn drie Business Units: elke unit heeft een Business Unit Manager als verantwoordelijke. Deze Business Units zijn Constructie, Doe-het-zelf & Installatie en Wonen & Internationaal. De Business Units zijn onderverdeeld in teams en verschillende Teamleiders. Elk team bestaat uit minstens ÃÂ©ÃÂ©n Projectmanager of Consultant, een Research Manager of Senior Research Analyst en enkele Research Analysten. Je werkt niet alleen aan projecten met directe collegaÃ¢ÂÂs uit je team, maar ook aan organisatiebrede projecten met collegaÃ¢ÂÂs uit andere teams.

Wat doe je?

10% overleggen met collegaÃ¢ÂÂs
20% vragenlijsten programmeren
30% resultaten rapporteren
20% resultaten analyseren
5% onderzoeksdata hercoderen
15% veldwerk managment

Wat is vereist?

HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau
Ervaring met SPSS is een prÃÂ©
Affiniteit met marktonderzoek
Goede beheersing Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel in woord als geschrift
Analytisch, doorzettingsvermogen, punctueel

Wat krijg je?

Vanaf Ã¢Â?.514 bruto p/m (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring)
Bij voorkeur een fulltime dienstverband
25 vakantiedagen
Personal Development Plan dat gekoppeld is aan een trainingsplan
Op korte termijn mogelijkheid tot een vast contract
Gezamenlijke lunch, wekelijkse borrel, jaarlijks weekendje weg

Iedere medewerker krijgt een Personal Development Plan. Hierin legt USP vast wat de groeiambities zijn, welk tijdspad hierbij hoort, welke trainingen er gevolgd kunnen worden en welke ontwikkelstappen er gemaakt dienen te worden. Er wordt twee keer per jaar geÃÂ«valueerd en stilgestaan bij jouw ontwikkeling, maar tussentijds vindt er ook veel sturing plaats vanuit de Teamleiders en Business Unit Managers om ervoor te zorgen dat jouw groeiplannen behaald worden.

USP Marketing Consultancy is hÃÂ©t toonaangevende marktonderzoeksbureau voor de bouwsector, de installatiesector, de doe-het-zelfsector en de woonsector. Door onze kennis van de markt achterhalen wij relevante marktinformatie en brengen wij in kaart wat deze inzichten voor uw organisatie betekent, wat u moet veranderen of wat u moet optimaliseren. Maar ook hoe u dat kunt organiseren. Zo helpt USP Marketing Consultancy fabrikanten, retailers en organisaties in het binnen- en buitenland het beste uit zichzelf en hun producten of diensten te halen.

description:
Deloitte Italy

Junior - Business Intelligence

What Impact Will You Make?

Your Opportunity

With a view to the enhancement of the Clients & Industries structure, responsible for the implementation of the market strategy of the Deloitte Network in Italy and which, through market analysis and business development activities on the various sectors and customers, supports the achievement of business objectives eThose related to the notoriety and positioning of the brand, we are looking for a brilliant analystda placeing within the business intelligence team.

Your Responsibility

The candidate will be included in the Business Intelligence structure, within the clients and industries in the business intelligence team and will have the opportunity to deal with the following activities:

Implementation of useful dashboard for commercial reporting or advanced analysis;
Management of the commercial "datalake" in collaboration with the various teams;
Support to internal teams in the reporting production.

Our Requirements

The ideal candidate is in possession of the following requirements:

Specialist degree in economic or scientific subjects;
Solid analytical skills and aptitude for critical-numeric reasoning;
Basic knowledge of programming languages, such as VBA, Python SQL or R useful for data analysis;
Excellent knowledge of the Office applications;
Welcome basic knowledge of software for the date visualization such as Qlik, Tableau, Powerbi or the like;
Excellent team work skills;
Fluent knowledge of the English language.

We are committed to reducing our impacties we encourage people to take on sustainable behaviors.To safeguard the environment and limit the climate change, we developed the Worldclimate strategy, through which we set the goal of becoming a Net Zero.

Join Our #iact Movement!Make the quiz to calculate your carbon footprint and find out how to adopt more responsible behavior.

About Deloitte

Our services

Deloitte offers integrated Audit, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax and Legal services.Our approach combines multidisciplinary knowledge, global experience, innovation and high quality services.We help our customers realize their aspirations, providing them with the tools to face the most complex challenges of business, in Italy and in the world.We firmly believe that our work can positively influence the community in which we operate.

Our Purpose

Make an impact that matters.This is our goal, and what defines us.It means making a difference for our customers, for our colleagues and in society, creating a long -term impact.We want to be the first choice of customers, the first choice of talents and the first to leave a mark.

Our values

We encourage collaboration, the diversity of thought and the ability to think out of the patterns.With this approach we help the talents to best express their skills.For us, diversity is a value and respect is at the center of our inclusive culture.

Our talent experience

Those who work in Deloitte, from the first day, feel part of a network that supports and encourages colleagues.The growth and career path allows you to develop skills and skills to be successful.In a work environment that encourages collaboration and creativity, the well -being of our people and flexibility are at the center of a distinctive talent experience.

Milan

description:
PLAION - Munich

PLAION (formerly known as Koch Media) is an international media company with more than 2000 employees worldwide. As a leading and independent producer and marketer of digital entertainment products in Europe, the USA, Australia and Japan, our business areas include the production of films and games, the purchase and sale of film license rights, the distribution of digital media products and games publishing under the Deep Silver, Prime Matter and Ravenscourt game labels.

For our GamesLab Team we are actively seeking a talented and experienced Data Analyst (m/f/d).

PLAION's GamesLab operates to provide reliable insights that can be trusted and worked on, both on User Research and Data Science/Analytics topics.

Our aim is to collaborate with each team in a meaningful way, to add value to their projects and go together towards a common goal: create the best games possible.

To do so, the GamesLab is structured around two teams of deeply involved experts, each conducting projects in the Data or User Research field.

Combining these skillsets into one team allows us to better understand our player's behaviour, needs and expectations, enabling a relevant teamwork with our 10+ Game Studios.

Fuelled with passion, aiming for impact - this is the GamesLab.

Do you thrive to make a difference? Then jump onboard and join our crew!

Your Tasks

Main goals:

Communicate proficiently, be curious and listen in order to identify valuable data use cases. Then design, plan and develop your analytics projects and share insights following GamesLab's quality standards/procedures and Data Visualisation best practices
Collarborate with our User Research Team to ensure reliable, clear and impactful data analysis that benefits the Game Studios and internal teams
Help the team address new promising use cases and use new tools/methodologies to guaranty continuous improvement and push innovation forward

Your responsibilites:

Query and analyse high volumes of data using an efficient, reliable and commented approach (SQL, R, Python is a plus)
Choose and define appropriate methodologies, metrics and visualisations to accurately understand our players' behaviour, needs and/or expectations
Design and develop Dashboards aiming to be clear and impactful using BI Tools (Power BI) or open source libraries (R/Python)
Help Production Teams in the data collection process to guarantee completeness and reliability of our game's data
Support the Development Teams through all the stages of their games' lifecycle by providing Prelaunch (tests, QA, alpha, beta, early access) and Postlaunch (Premium and LiveOps games) data analysis
Ensure relevant integration of both qualitative and quantitative data in User Research/Playtest reports
Design new tools and help build new methodologies to steer GamesLab's innovation

Your Profile

Curious and committed, you have a strong ability to adapt and learn. You are rigorous, have good interpersonal skills and a strong team spirit
3+ years of experience in analytics and/or data management related role (in the Gaming Industry is a strong plus)
Advanced degrees in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Systems Management, AI/Machine Learning/Deep Learning, a related discipline, or comparable work experiences
Effective communication skills, including presenting and sharing information with audiences across a wide array of technical expertise, culture and seniority
Experience developing production-quality data products in SQL and R (Python is a plus)
Strong technical skills in BI/visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or open source libraries (R/Python)
Experience working with cloud and/or on premise databases, handling both structured and unstructured data (Google BigQuery, MongoDB, MySQL, RedshiftÃ¢Â?
Passion for both video games and analytics

What we offer

Employment in one of the most exciting industries in the world: the film and games industry
Partnership-oriented working atmosphere in a modern and broad-based media company
Wide range of training and development opportunities as part of our PLAION Academy
Company benefits such as employee events, fitness cooperation with Urban Sports, bicycle leasing, flexible working hours, 30 days vacation, company pension plan, free drinks, fresh fruit, etc.
Opportunity to share your passion for movies and games with colleagues

Do you want to be part of our success story? We look forward to receiving your application!

The more comprehensive your documents are to us, the better we can get a picture of you. You should upload at least one cover letter and your CV. Please prefer to use our online application form. If you have any further questions, please send an e-mail to jobs@plaion.com.

PLAION GmbH - Lochhamer Str. 9 - 82152 Planegg - www.plaion.de
